title: Sales Data Analyst
description:
Sales Data Analyst permanent job in Santa Monica, CA.

Great opportunity for a professional analyst with a strong analytically driven background. The Sales Data Analyst will be responsible for preparing data and strategically analyzing the company sales data. This position requires complex analysis skills and will be primarily responsible for reporting on sales performance. The individual will need to strategically understand and report from an abundance of data from multiple systems.

Reporting Relationship: The Sales Data Analyst reports to the C suite at this company.

5+ years experience in an analyst or data science role at a technology based company.
Strong business analysis skills – Work mentality should be driven from a strong understanding of the business first.
Strong communication skills - Be able to take complex concepts and boil down into simple easy to understand analysis that includes recommendations.
Strong SQL knowledge – Must have ability to query and create data marts, create procedures and write high performance joins.
Expert Excel skills – Experience with data modeling and excel graphing skills
Project management skills - be able to manage and prioritize effectively between weekly and monthly analysis reporting and quick ad-hoc analysis
Problem solving skills - Critical thinking is required in almost every project. Being able to see a clear path to analysis is key to success
Creative thinking - Be able to think about potential relationships between data and the business operations. Be able to connect the dots for stakeholders.
PowerPoint Presentation experience
Strong drive and self-motivated work ethic
Strong integrity and ability to stay unbiased in analysis
Understanding of sales processes and experience with sales metrics
Experience analyzing online web traffic (google analytics or similar) is a plus
Experience with Domo a plus
Job duties:
Take the lead position on creating and analyzing data reports, on sales team activity.
Responsible for daily reporting of sales and marketing KPIs.
Analyze reports and trends and provide recommendations on a weekly monthly and quarterly basis.
Create new views of data to consistently improve company understanding of trends and revenue.
Provide support for additional Ad-hoc analysis as needed for company initiatives.
Lead or participate in projects designated by the Chief Data scientist, CRO, or Director of BI.
Projects will include collaboration with multiple departments.
Benefits:
Fully paid benefits (medical, dental, vision)
401 (k) plan
Unlimited sick leave
Stock options
Paid vacation
Dog friendly office

title: Siri - EPM Data Infrastructure
description:
Summary
Posted: Dec 19, 2018
Weekly Hours: 40
Role Number: 113670731
The Siri Search team is creating groundbreaking technology for knowledge graphing and algorithmic search using machine learning, natural language processing, and artificial intelligence. We’re looking for an experienced Program/Product/Project manager to help drive our massive data platform efforts for real-time data, transactional data (OLTP), metric data (OLAP) and the related ETL pipelines at double digit PB scale. You will work closely with Data Engineers, Data Analysts, Data Scientists, and Platform Engineers in support of Apple’s largest data platform infrastructure. You must be able to thrive in a fast-paced and demanding environment, to lead innovative projects that have broad impact, and to coordinate projects across a variety of teams.
Key Qualifications
3+ years in a role leading cross-functional teams in product development (e.g. Program / Project / Product Management, or Business Analysis)
3+ years experience delivering multi-component, highly scaled software services
Foundational understanding of big data technologies (Hadoop, HBase, Spark, Kafka, Flume, Hive, etc.)
Experience building and maintaining efficient, scalable, and reliable data pipelines and processes
Demonstrated ability to manage complex, cross-functional projects and apply your skills in a data-driven environment
Ability to work across a large number of teams to enforce process and efficient outcomes
Ability to adapt quickly to change, influence peers/managers and build consensus
Excellent communication skills, both oral and written
Self-starter capable of defining and forging a path to success
Description
Drive multiple projects to scale the data platform infrastructure and ensure maximum availability of data including specifications, scope, requirements, timelines, and resource allocation Lead the definition and execution of the continuous deployment data pipelines for software projects Coordinate with cross functional teams to gather requirements and to define qualification plans and criteria for shipping new data streams Standardize and evangelize data platform on-boarding and tools for research support Keep teams focused on the right priorities to meet aggressive deadlines and clearly communicate project progress Build relationships across the organization and facilitate communication between cross-divisional groups
Education & Experience
BS/MS in EE/CS/CE or equivalent

title: Data Scientist - Entry Level
description:
As a Data Scientist you will be working on consulting side of our business. You will be responsible for analyzing large, complex datasets and identify meaningful patterns that lead to actionable recommendations. You will be performing thorough testing and validation of models, and support various aspects of the business with data analytics.
Ability to do statistical modeling, build predictive models and leverage machine learning algorithms.
This position will combine the typical Data Scientist math and analytical skills, with research, advanced business, communication, and presentation skills.
Primary job location is in Sacramento, but work-from-home option is available.

Qualifications
Bachelors, MS or PhD in a relevant field (Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, Physics, Applied Math)
Experience in R and/or Python is preferred

title: Data Analyst
description:
Continuum is a marketing services firm that works with leading clients to design, transform and run digital marketing operations that enable them to scale, optimize and improve marketing performance. With 500+ professionals in offices in Silicon Valley and Chandigarh & Gurgaon (India), our services include digital marketing operations, technology development, data operations and advisory services. More information available at www.continuum.global.
POSITION SUMMARY
The Data Analyst for Digital Marketing will work onsite with one of our leading clients and most recognizable brands in the world, based in Silicon Valley. The candidate will be working closely with a senior analyst at Continuum to support all data-related needs such as building, maintaining, and executing data pipelines to support marketing campaign infrastructure and building ad hoc dashboards to meet the needs of the business and marketing team. The candidate should have a keen eye for detail and have the ability to work independently and with a team.
ROLES & RESPONSIBILITIES
Build and maintain data pipelines to support marketing and campaign infrastructure; ensure all SLAs are met and 100% data accuracy is achieved
Build dashboards for strategic business areas to monitor progress and performance
Handle ad hoc data requests and build processes / tools to automate when needed
Assist business analyst with experimentation design and campaign measurement
Write, understand, and execute on Business Requirements Documents
OUR IDEAL CANDIDATE
3+ years’ experience working with fast-moving marketing teams in a data analyst or development capacity
Experience managing Quality Assurance testing on data pipelines, ensuring deployment is correct for account segmentation and personalization
Comfortable working with customer data sets larger than 50 GB
Motivated self-starter with the ability to think outside the box and independently figure out how things work
Exceptional work ethic, ability to perform under pressure, meet deadlines and demonstrate enthusiasm towards colleagues and clients
EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE
Required:
BS degree in a technical / quantitative discipline (e.g., computer science, statistics, operations research) or equivalent practical experience
Strong database experience including proficiency in SQL and query optimization
Experience working with multiple large data sources and combining relevant information to generate insights from analyses; creating effective reporting solutions (e.g. dashboards, tables, metrics)
Proven success record in managing multiple projects simultaneously
Nice to Have:
Data Warehousing (e.g. storage methods/formats, database design) involving large data sets
Development experience in at least one scripting language (PHP, Python, Perl, etc.)

title: Quality Improvement Data Analyst (3031)
description:
Quality Improvement Data Analyst - Central Office
Hours: 40 hours per week; Monday - Friday, 9:00 am to 5:00 pm

Are you interested in how quality improvement and data can be used to improve the lives of people with serious mental illness? If you appreciate a collaborative workplace, stimulating learning environment, creating positive change, and have a "can do" attitude, then CRF is the workplace for you!
CRF takes your dedication seriously, and provides benefits to help you balance your work life and your personal life. Our full-time (30 hours or more) staff earn 24 days of PTO per year plus generous holiday schedules; we offer top-of-the-line medical insurance, dental plans, paid life insurance, vision plans…and really generous retirement benefits. We also provide access to student loan repayment/forgiveness programs for graduates.

Department Overview:
Located at our Central office in the Mission Bay area, we provide management support services for all of the mental health programs of Community Research Foundation and PERT, Inc. Our Central Office consists of Administration, Human Resources, Accounting, Information Technology, Real Estate and Facilities, Quality Improvement, and Research & Development.
Our Quality Improvement (QI) team supports and monitors various risk management and QI activities throughout the organization, such as investigation of serious and critical incidents, implementation of process improvements, adherence to regulatory requirements, and resolution of client allegations/grievances related to client care. A high level of confidentiality and discretion is required.
Typical Duties of a Quality Improvement Data Analyst
Collects, organizes, analyzes and interprets clinical and functional outcomes service data.
Develops and/or utilizes instruments and tools to track, monitor and evaluate outcomes.
Produces written reports, quarterly dashboards, tables and charts based on outcomes data.
Leads process improvement projects with program staff based on data results.
Takes the lead on writing annual reports for CARF accredited programs.
Required Skills and Qualifications
A degree in a health-related field or experience working in quality improvement. California license or license-eligible (Psychology, LCSW, LMFT, LPCC, AMFT, ASW, or APCC) a plus, but not required.
A high level of demonstrated analytical, computational, organizational, and communication (both written and verbal) skills.
An intermediate level of proficiency in Access, Microsoft Word, Excel, Outlook, and PowerPoint. Experience using statistical software is a plus.
Ability to pass criminal/background clearance
Be a part of our vibrant non-profit organization and make a difference in the lives of the people we serve!
We are an Equal Opportunity Employer

title: Analyst, Baseball Research & Development
description:
We are looking to grow our Research and Development group by adding an Analyst to our team who has a passion for baseball and winning through data-driven decision making. Through both collaborative and individual work, members of our team will impact every part of the R&D process: idea and question generation, data exploration and analysis, development of decision making tools utilizing analyses, and communication of results to decision makers and other staff. Ideal candidates are those that are excited to challenge the status quo, improve how our organization makes decisions, and contribute to the continual development of the department.

Responsibilities:
Develop statistical models and perform general quantitative analysis dealing with player valuation, player development, and strategic decision making.
Collaborate with other members of the baseball operations department in the development process.
Investigate ad hoc research projects as requested.
Effectively present completed projects and communicate new insights to decision makers and other staff.
Maintain a knowledge of the latest data analysis techniques and data sources to aid in the continual development of the department.
Other duties as assigned.
Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree (BA) in a job related area or 2+ years of related work experience.
Some experience with computer programming. Experience with R, Python, SQL, and Stan preferred.
Demonstrated ability to solve problems in a data-driven way.
Creativity to brainstorm new avenues of research for the department.
Strong work ethic and attention to detail with the ability to balance multiple projects.
Passion for baseball and familiarity with current baseball research.
Comfortability with and ability to effectively communicate technical concepts to a non-technical audience.
Ability to work evening/weekend/holiday hours.
Consistent, punctual and regular attendance.
Professional image and demeanor.
Excellent time management, interpersonal, verbal and written communications, decision-making, and organization skills.
Minimum physical requirements: able to travel to and gain access to various areas of the ballpark for prolonged periods of time during games and events; able to lift and transport up to 25 pounds.
To Apply:
To apply, please send an email to BBOpsJobs@Padres.com with the subject “R&D Analyst” and include a resume, an unofficial transcript (if you were enrolled in a college degree program within the last three years), and answers to the following questions:

When would you be available to start?
Are you planning to attend the 2018 Winter Meetings?
Where did you learn about this opportunity?
What is a project you believe would add substantial value to a baseball team? Please describe the project and outline the steps you would take to complete it.
The San Diego Padres are an Equal Opportunity Employer.

title: Business Data Analyst
description:
About EQIS:
EQIS is an investing platform that gives investors more access to many of the investing advantages that ultra-high net worth investors have enjoyed for decades, including separately managed accounts (SMAs) with multiple institutional money managers, broad diversification, transparency, and tax efficiency. Sophisticated, cloud-based, easy-to-use and fee-based, EQIS is backed by dedicated advisor support making the entire proposal, account-opening, and client reporting processes fast and efficient. By providing tools that inform the investor, as well as creating a platform that is accessible by both the advisor as well as their clients, EQIS puts advisors and clients on the same side of the table.

Summary::
EQIS is looking for a Business Data Analyst to join our Finance team. The ideal candidate will be a strategic and analytical thinker. He or she will partner with business and operations teams and focus on analysis and reporting that monitors key performance indicators and metrics.

Primary Responsibilities::
Find, develop and maintain a database of competitor offerings
Develop customer data such as demographic info on advisers and their books of business as well as interpret market and customer information
Assist the salesforce by quantifying the effectiveness of our various sales and marketing efforts
Partner with colleagues facilitating the design, build and automation of tools that provide insight into customer behavior
Analyze and synthesize data into actionable information useable by management, including the identification and understanding of possible options/efforts and opportunities
Work with EQIS Leadership to define and implement key strategic and operational initiatives
Introduce and implement best practices for business optimization

Qualifications/Skills::
1-5 years relevant experience, ideally in Financial Services
BA/BS Degree in an analytical field such as economics, mathematics, or statistics
Strong analytical skills and Excel proficiency, experience with SQL preferred
Familiarity with data exploration / data visualization tools
Excellent conceptual and analytical reasoning competencies
Excellent oral, written and presentation abilities
Strong interpersonal skills and ability to effectively collaborate with all levels of the organization
Ability to work independently and thrive in a fast-paced environment

Perks:: Located on 4th St. in San Rafael just blocks from the SMART station. Excellent benefits including Medical, Dental and Vision, generous employer HSA Contribution and PTO. We also pride ourselves in being a fun place to work with lunch served daily, regular employee events and a highly-subsidized gym membership. EQIS is a place where every employee has a voice and actively participates towards making our business successful.

EQIS is proud to be an equal employment opportunity employer (EEOE). All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status. We welcome and encourage diversity in the workplace.

title: Data & Research Analyst
description:
$4,476 - $7,861 a month
The Research Technician III (Data & Research Analyst) supports the mission of the university by providing leadership and expertise in technical research and data analysis work that informs the DBFA, campus planning, decision-making, quality assurance, assessment initiatives, accreditation and external reporting.
Primarily responsible for designing, conducting and reviewing research and analytical studies; preparing statistical analyses, reports & data visualization; and coordinating and managing all aspects of survey projects conducted by IE, including consultation, questionnaire design, programming, survey administration, data processing, data analysis and report writing. Responsibilities fall into three main areas: Institutional research and analysis; survey analysis; and IE data management and reporting.
INSTITUTIONAL RESEARCH & ANALYSIS
Recommends, initiates and conducts analytical research on issues of importance to the Campus and in service to the Strategic Mission (e.g., decision-support, policy analysis, benchmarking, effectiveness studies, etc.); develops analytical studies to identify, measure and inform key indicators; compiles & prepares statistical and narrative reports that analyze Campus trends; assists in developing papers & presentations; prepares complex tables & charts for use in presentations and reports; provides administrative support to facilitate completion of tasks and projects as needed; prepares correspondence in the course of official duties; performs miscellaneous duties as directed; participates on college-wide committees, workshops, and activities.
Works with campus administrators, programs and principal investigators to identify research and institutional and divisional data needs for grants, assessment initiatives, program review, surveys and ad hoc data requests; support campus interaction with data; serves as subject-matter consultant to campus, designing, assessment initiatives, program reviews, survey research and ad hoc data requests.
Responds to research questions and data requests from within and outside the university; develops and works with technical staff on the programming and technical processing of data and resolves data integrity issues, analyzes results using advanced statistical methods; prepares information for presentation in written, graphic and tabular form, and produces both formal and informal reports and presentations.
SURVEY ANALYSIS
Coordinates surveys; manages the survey calendar; designs, plans and conducts survey and assessment activities; develops survey instruments and methodologies, assuring compliance with requirements of internal or external constituencies as appropriate; provides or recommends analysis with appropriate follow-up activities; responsible for communications with participants, arrangements for proctors, venues and incentives as needed; develops and maintains expertise in the management and use of the university survey software; provides training and support for others using this software on both the technical and methodological aspects of their work; provides consultative support to the campus.
DATA MANAGEMENT & REPORTING
Develop, document and maintain databases; collaborates with the AVP to determine priorities and strategies for meeting DBFA and campus institutional information needs; assists with the maintenance of databases (e.g., Blackboard Analytics, Tableau, Excel, Access, SAS, SPSS)and with identifying, documenting, and resolving data integrity and coding issues; maintains a thorough understanding of and assists campus technicians with extracting, loading and validating the accuracy of Census, End-of-Term and related Chancellor's Office and other external reporting as needed; maintains a working understanding of data element dictionaries and related documentation; assists in the design, development and maintenance of longitudinal data archives and all website data and reports; performs routine and ad hoc data collection; tracks the implementation of the Division's performance of the CSUCI Strategic Initiatives, enhance transparency of targets, and data management for divisional KPI's; and produces data reports as determined by the AVP.
Graduation from a four-year college or university, and three years of progressively responsible experience in technical research or statistical work in the collection, compilation, and analysis of data, including or supplemented by one year in the interpretation and graphic representation of data. Graduate study in the social sciences, economics, mathematics, statistics, public or business administration or engineering may be substituted on a year-for-year basis.
Preferred Qualifications: Graduate degree in a field encompassing extensive research methodology instruction and three or more years of experience in institutional or social science research.
Familiarity with SQLServer, Oracle/PeopleSoft or similar relational database architecture and processes.
Expertise in statistical programming (i.e., SAS, SPSS), Microsoft Office, Tableau, Blackboard Analytics or similar data warehouse and dashboard applications.
Thorough knowledge of research techniques, including the planning of studies and investigations, survey methods, the
determining of variables and the developing of reference materials; thorough knowledge of research reporting techniques; regression analysis, data visualization, treatment of data such as simple correlation methods, trend analysis, frequency distribution analysis, sampling techniques, hypothesis testing, methods of interval estimation; general knowledge of sources of information on social, economic, and population trends in California; familiarity with the principles of personnel management and effective supervision and ability to direct the work of others.
Ability to reason logically and capacity for independent and creative thinking on research problems; ability to develop
techniques for handling a large variety of detailed data and ability to analyze these data; comprehensive ability to prepare questionnaires and other survey instruments; ability to gather, compile, and analyze research data, and to present data in tabular, graphic, and
pictorial form; ability to prepare and work clear and comprehensive reports; capacity for independent and creative thinking and writing on research and statistical problems; ability to establish and maintain cooperative and collaborative working relationships; ability to speak and write effectively; ability to analyze situations accurately and to adopt an effective course of action.
Possess a strong customer service orientation, attention to detail, and the ability to adapt to change in an environment of rapid growth with a positive attitude and sense of humor. Enthusiastic about institutional research, data integrity and stellar data presentations. Ability to collegially interface with faculty, administrators, and staff and to provide data deliverables within tight time frames preferred.
A background check (including a criminal records check) must be completed satisfactorily before any candidate can be offered a position with the CSU. Failure to satisfactorily complete the background check may affect the application status of applicants or continued employment of current CSU employees who apply for the position.
Job Type: Full-time
Salary: $4,476.00 to $7,861.00 /month

title: Database Marketing Analyst
description:
The Database Marketing Analyst is responsible for helping pull data from the CRM database and create reports to help in the analyzing consumer behavior, as well optimizing existing and building out new database management approaches, constantly enhancing in-house database.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities
Leverage expert SQL programming skills to run extensive customer transaction data queries across large volumes of data, multiple data extensions, and campaign history. Develop and implement weekly reporting for the enterprise on customer segment performance, trends, and key behavior drivers.
Apply analytical and programming skills to mine the relational customer database for insights.
Develop expert knowledge of current DB architecture and ETL processes and recommend ongoing process improvements.
Employ expert knowledge of SQL, Tableau, and BI applications to design, execute, and ensure quality of weekly automated reports, dashboards and ad hoc requests for the marketing team and other stakeholders.
Demonstrate strong business and analytical acumen when reviewing data for inconsistencies or anomalies that could skew analytical results.
Leverage strong interpersonal skills with Marketing and other stakeholders in gathering information to determine specification requirements for data requests, reports, and ongoing utility.
Perform routine database audits that includes review of business rules, data validation and augmentation, merging and purging duplicate records, etc.
Work continuously with third party database vendors to enhance/optimize the data model to accelerate information, reporting, and insights while ensuring accuracy.
Use and support database applications and analytical tools such as Microsoft SQL, Tableau, Microstrategy, Cognos and SSRS

title: Data Analyst
description:
Bachelor's degree from an accredited university or college in Computer Science, Information Management or Statistics or similar degree. Proven Working experience as a data analyst or business data analyst Technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques Strong knowledge of and experience with reporting packages (Business Objects etc), databases (SQL, ACCESS, Crystal, etc). Some programming experience with (SML, Javascript, or ETL Frameworks, etc) would be beneficial Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with the attention to detail and accuracy Adept at queries, report writing and presenting findings Ability to work with stakeholders to assess potential risks. Ability to analyze existing tools and databases and provide recommendations. Ability to translate business requirements into non-technical, lay terms. High level experience in methodologies and processes for managing large scale databases. Demonstrated experience in handling large datasets and relational databases. High level written and verbal communication skills.

The Data Analyst is responsible for designing, building, and maintaining relational databases, and developing strategies for data acquisitions, archive recovery, reporting and implementation of databases.

title: Threat Intelligence Analyst
description:
Job Description – Threat Intelligence Analyst – R0029146

eBay is seeking an Information Security Threat Intelligence Analyst to join our highly visible Threat Management & Response Organization (TMR) to design and develop our threat intelligence program in support eBay’s eCommerce and Payments platforms. This position will perform intelligence collection/curation activities, and provide analysis using the Intelligence OODA Loop framework to identify emergent cyber threats to eBay.
Working within eBay’s TMR organization you will have the opportunity to build innovative solutions to identify and mitigate information-security threats. You will work collaboratively to creatively solve complex security problems in a heterogeneous environment. With your contributions, we’re building the best security operations center in the industry. Your skills, vision, tenacity, and passion will help us defend and respond daily to keep eBay’s critical information assets away from threats and hackers.
Candidates must have extensive experience working with various security methodologies and processes, advanced knowledge of TCP/IP protocols, extensive experience providing analysis and trending of security threats from various threat intelligence sources.

Core Job Functions Include:
Identify and assess internal and external cybersecurity risks that threaten the security or integrity of eBay’s eCommerce and payments platforms including all non-public information stored on systems.
Establish policies commensurate with eBay’s risk and complexity that addresses the concepts of threat information sharing through appropriate ISACs and other intelligence sharing bodies.
Modify control structures to use threat intelligence and build collaboration processes to identify and respond to information on threats and vulnerabilities.
Develop and formalize effective threat identification and assessment processes (Threat Knowledge), including maintaining procedures for obtaining, monitoring, assessing, classifying severity, and responding to evolving threats and vulnerabilities. Use this Threat Knowledge to drive risk assessments and response.
Develop, maintain, and update a repository of cybersecurity threat and vulnerability information that may be used in conducting risk assessments and provide updates to senior management, eBay board of directors, and eCI board of directors on cyber risk trends.
Conduct research and evaluate intelligence data - with specific emphasis on tactics, techniques, and procedures - focusing on threats facing eBay’s eCommerce and payments processing systems.
Correlate threat data from various sources and analyze network events to establish the identity and modus operandi of malicious users active in or posing potential threats to eBay.
Report security performance against established security metrics and compare to other similar businesses in the eCommerce and payments space.
Work closely within various Global Information Security teams and eBay’s Legal, and Risk teams to develop a fuller understanding of the intent, objectives, and activity of cyber threat actors.
Conduct complex cyber intelligence analysis, coordination, and interaction across a broad range of eBay, it’s adjacencies, and third-party ISAC partners.
Understand the trade-offs required to communicate the different levels of risk tolerance and risk exposures across the organization and balance this with risk investments
Coordinate with technology and business groups to assess, implement, and monitor business-related security risks/hazards.
Prepare assessments and cyber threat profiles of current events based on the sophisticated collection, research, and analysis of classified and open source information
Produces high-quality papers, presentations, recommendations, and findings for Senior Level Management and Enterprise Technology Leaders
Provides briefings and presentations to leadership supporting Information Security and Network Operations decision making
Provide situational awareness to executives and stakeholders of emerging threats and breaches in a timely fashion with appropriate guidance on impact to eBay, Inc.

To be successful in this position, you should be proficient with:
Communication – ability to articulate complex cyber threats to non-technical business partners. Proven competency in business writing and speaking for technical and executive audiences.
Teach – ability to train security concepts to other teams
Offensive Techniques – Penetration testing, IOCs, and exploits at all layers of the stack.
Logs Analysis - Comfortable with SEIM searching to gather and analyze logs to recreate incidents and hunt for threats.
System Forensics – Basic understanding of image acquisition techniques, memory forensics, and analysis
Networking Fundamentals - TCP/IP Protocols (HTTP, DNS, FTP, DHCP, ARP, etc.), and Wireshark/TCPDump.
Scripting – Should be familiar in scripting in at least one of the following: python, perl or a similar language.
Risk Analysis – Prior work experience analyzing threat and vulnerability data; classifying threats/vulnerabilities to determine severity and prioritize against existing system states, determining threats causing critical risk to business.

Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in Information Assurance, Information Security, Cyber Intelligence, or related field.
5+ years of experience in Cyber Threat Intelligence

Must have at least one (1) of the following certifications:
SANS GIAC: GCTI, ISC2: CISSP, NICCS: CCIP, EC Council: C|TIA

In addition, minimum of one (1) year of specialized experience in one or more of the following areas:
Security Assessment or Offensive Security
Application Security
Security Operations Center/Security Incident Response
Cyber intelligence Analysis

At eBay, your work makes a difference. We believe that we can build a better form of commerce that is enabled by people, supported by technology, and open to everyone – creating more opportunity for all.

title: Master Data Analyst III
description:
Job Description
Job Title: Master Data Analyst III
Requisition ID: 84182BR


When you join us at Thermo Fisher Scientific, you’ll be part of a smart, driven team that shares your passion for exploration and discovery. With revenues of $22 billion and the largest investment in R&D in the industry, we give our people the resources and opportunities to make significant contributions to the world.

Key Responsibilities Include

Policy Setting & Governance

Establish, document and enforce global Standard Operating Procedures across all business units to govern and control the integrity of material master data in the context of existing business processes.
Represent the Division on strategic programs that may have implications on master data design and operating controls

New Product Additions

Provide direct counsel to the business when new product configurations are contemplated to assure that our master data management processes can accommodate these evolving needs with existing ERP environments.

Maintenance and Continuous Improvement

Analyze and monitor the quality of material master data in accordance with standards, policies and procedures, utilizing both manual and automated screening approaches. Initiate corrective actions to ensure and improve the quality of material master data.
Communicate and interact with other teams and/or departments to resolve issues regarding material master data.
Create and publish monthly scorecards (key performance indicators) to evaluate performance and identify areas for improvements.
Focus relentlessly on streamlining processes using the PPI Business System and targeted automation (among other levers) to improve productivity.

Product Rationalization

Ensure that business processes and decisions that result in product/SKU rationalization incorporate proper decommissioning of product master data in all impacted ERP systems
Actively participate in the Product Rationalization activities either directly or by guiding and coaching other resources.


Minimum Qualifications
A minimum of a Bachelor Degree in business or other analytical discipline or 10+ years of master data management experience is required.
Excellent proficiency in SAP and other ERP environments with 5+ years of hands-on experience.
Possess high levels of data accuracy and attention to detail.
Strong analytical skills, combined with practical business acumen.
The ability to apply experience and knowledge to provide creative solutions to problems.
Strong verbal and written communication skills with the ability to write clear and concise business communication.
The ability to speak in front of groups of varying sizes and levels within the company.
Strong in building relationships across various functional teams.
Ability to manage multiple tasks within tight deadlines.
Advanced experience using Microsoft Excel to create spreadsheets, charts and pivot tables and using functions such as sumif, vlookup, etc.
Ability to work independently, typically initiating own tasks with input/guidance from manager and/or director.
Ability to thrive in a matrix and cross-functional team environment.
Experience in Cognos is a plus.

This position does not have relocation assistance


At Thermo Fisher Scientific, each one of our 70,000 extraordinary minds has a unique story to tell. Join us and contribute to our singular mission—enabling our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer. Apply today http://jobs.thermofisher.com

Thermo Fisher Scientific is an EEO/Affirmative Action Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability or any other legally protected status.

If you are an individual with a disability who requires reasonable accommodation to complete any part of our application process, click here for further assistance.
Thermo Fisher Scientific is an EEO/Affirmative Action Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability or any other legally protected status.

title: Senior Business Data Analyst- Digital
description:
Are you?

Excited to influence business decisions with data- driven insights?
Awesome with Google Analytics, AdWords, and SQL?
Looking to collaborate with stakeholders as a strategic thought partner?
If the above describes YOU, keep reading for more details about this opportunity:

Based out of La Jolla, California, National Funding, an innovator and leader in the financial technology industry, is seeking a Senior Business Data Analyst focused on our digital marketing channels. National Funding has experienced double digit growth for many years and that growth is expected to continue. Our new Senior Business Data Analyst will contribute to that growth by delivering insights and recommendations that drive business decisions in our digital marketing strategy.

How you will make an impact:
Partner with Marketing Managers, Sales, and executives as a strategic thought partner to deliver key insights from web tracking metrics
Study website behavior patterns to analyze and optimize business results and user experience
Synthesize data from multiple sources, developing assumptions where needed, to drive customer insights and strategy development
Coordinate with external partners and business stakeholders to develop actionable dashboards which present the end to end funnel metrics, contributing to the development of hypotheses and actions
Collaborate with Marketing to measure impact of website strategy across all campaign channels and to refine strategy driven by data-based insights
Work with stakeholders to develop learning plans with recommendations of analytics approaches, including A/B testing
Ensure site tagging is implemented properly to provide visibility to impact and value of various initiatives and releases
An ideal candidate looks like this:
5-8 years of experience in web analytics decision support and website optimization
Deep subject matter expertise with Google Analytics and SQL; experience with Google AdWords, Google Webmaster tools and Google Tag Manager a plus
Solid understanding of Paid Search, SEO, and other digital marketing channels such as Affiliate, Social, and Display
Strong analytical and problem solving skills
Experience with Tableau (or similar data visualization tools such as Spotfire, PowerBI, QlikView, etc.)
Proven ability to tell stories with data and instill confidence in recommendations to motivate stakeholders to take action
Outstanding communication skills with both technical and non-technical colleagues
Prefer candidates with experience with CRM systems (Salesforce)
Prefer candidates with experience in Finance, Mortgage, Banking
Why National Funding?

Positive, energetic, passionate, business casual environment
Fantastic benefits package including medical, dental, vision, life, LTD, FSA, 401(k) with an employer match and PTO
Numerous employee events throughout the year including our annual traditions such as a Day at the Del Mar Racetrack, Del Mar Mud Run, Bring Your Kid to Work Day, Holiday Party, Employee and Family Picnic, sporting events, and more
National Funding is one of the leading providers of short term loans and equipment leasing for small businesses across the United States. For five years running, we've been ranked by the San Diego Business Journal as one of the 100 Fastest Growing Private Companies in San Diego and listed on the Inc. 5000 List of America's Fastest Growing Private Companies. Since 1999, we have been in the forefront of the equipment leasing business, working with businesses in hundreds of communities and industries to expand and upgrade their business equipment. As we have grown, so too has our product line, and now we are one of the country's largest private lenders of small business loans. Our customers call on us to get working capital, merchant cash advances, credit card processing, and, of course, equipment leasing.

title: Data Quality Analyst
description:
Jumpshot is a marketing analytics company that helps marketers understand their customer’s entire online lives by analyzing online behavioral data from its 100-million user panel, covering 188 countries on both desktop and mobile. From the key sources of traffic to a site, to the browsing and buying behavior on a site, to where customers go once they’ve left a site, our products reveal the entire customer journey. Jumpshot tracks more than 160 billion monthly clicks, helping companies know what their customers are doing anywhere, anytime they’re online.

Jumpshot is looking for a dynamic and passionate individual to join our Data Insights team to help develop our data quality processes and capabilities for customer data deliveries. The Data Quality Analyst will participate in all aspects of the customer delivery cycle including: creation of technical specifications and test plans, quality assurance of data and working directly with customer to resolve quality issues. As a member working in a team environment, you will take direction from both the Director of Data Insights and Leads on data quality activities.

Responsibilities

Help build and maintain an effective data QA and testing procedure for our data and customer offerings
Develop, maintain and execute test cases, track defects, provide detailed test results and test status
Debug the defects and conduct root cause analyses
Work with Data Engineers to correct data quality errors
Maintain a high level of data quality through rigorous analysis and auditing of all data used in customer deliveries
Responsible for working with internal and external customers to ensure timely resolution of data issues and problems
Identify areas of improvement to achieve the best data quality possible
Requirements

Bachelor’s Degree in MIS, Computer Science, Math, Engineering or comparable major
2+ years of experience as a QA’ing data outputs
Experience in writing Python scripts or programs to analyze/validate large data sets
Data visualization tool experience (Tableau)
Ability to convert complex business, technical requirements, use cases and user stories to test cases and test plans
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
Excellent communication, presentation and documentation skills with the ability to communicate at all levels within the business
Demonstrated success in managing multiple deliverables concurrently often within aggressive timeframes; ability to cope under time pressure
Experience using Hadoop, Hive, SQL and Scala a plus
Jumpshot is located in the heart of SOMA in San Francisco, right near AT&T Park, Caltrain, Muni, and lots of restaurants and bars. Benefits include medical, dental, vision, 401(k), regular lunches, and more! We offer the opportunity to be part of a successful, fast growing company. To learn more about us, please visit our website at www.jumpshot.com.

If you are interested in applying or this opportunity, please submit your resume or CV, cover letter and salary requirements. All submissions will be evaluated and interviews will be conducted for those applicants who most strongly fit our needs. If you are not contacted for an interview, your resume will remain on file and active for available positions for a period of one year.

No phone calls please and no agencies or recruiters

title: Data Analyst
description:
Job Summary:
The right candidate will be excited about data, have excellent personal and technical communication skills, and be hungry to learn and master new things. We’re looking for someone who takes direction well but is a self-starter, and is meticulous when it comes to detail.
Overview:
This is a dual role. The right candidate will be responsible for creating, running, and analyzing data as well as performing basic administrative tasks:
Data Analyst Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
Manage and analyze company data.
Create, run, and analyze a variety of data reports from various databases using SQL and Microsoft Excel.
Routinely update external databases based on internal data.
Analyze company data to identify insights and anomalies on a regular basis.
Administrative Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
Process wholesale orders by entering data into our ERP for warehouse processing.
Maintain whole product and inventory data.
Innovate ways of presenting data as needed (i.e. customizing linesheets).
Manage wholesale customer accounts by adding and updating data as needed.
Assist customers with accessing their wholesale accounts as needed.
Required Skills and Experience:
2-3 years of advanced SQL programming required.
Ecommerce or fashion experience is preferred.
Familiarity with a variety of RDBMS types (MySQL, SQL Server, MariaDB).
Familiarity with writing complex queries (multiple joins, unions, and calculations).
Advanced Microsoft Excel experience (configuring data sources, creating/using pivot tables, and advanced analysis and formatting of data results).
Knowledge of Windows OS.
Strong math and logic skills.
Strong analytical skills are a must.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
Tokuyama Dental America (TDA) is an award-winning Japanese manufacturer that is recognized for its quality and reliability. TDA is a subsidiary of the Tokuyama Corporation based in Japan. Tokuyama Corporation is one of the largest and most advanced chemical and silicon manufacturers in the world. TDA is 100% committed to innovating Tomorrow’s Dentistry Today. It is our mission to listen to your needs, incorporate your voice into the development of top-quality dental products, and ensure our products meet the highest standards of the industry.
Position Overview:
Define and document processes, best practices, and strategies for future solutions, optimizing business efficiencies as it related to process improvement.
Design and develop highly visual, interactive, and layered business intelligence solutions using Tableau, SQL, Salesforce, & QuickBooks.
Apply market research to target and segment customers for all marketing (social, digital, email, and direct mail) campaigns.
Responsible for the implementation of data analytics to develop marketing campaigns and project increased revenue.
Develop production reports to be used by the business for ongoing analytical and strategic operation plans.
Triage requests, gather user requirements and facilitate ad hoc report and data requests with quick turn-around.
Leverage extensive datasets and various statistical software applications to develop and execute strategic business opportunities.
Investigate and report on complex data interactions to help identify and address our clients’ key strategic business opportunities.
Act as a liaison between business users, management, and application system IT support.
Analysis supporting data driven decision making.
Develop components of decision support for customer service, sales, and marketing and assist with data validation tests.
Collect, clean, and aggregates data from multiple sources.
Create technical documentation.
Other tasks, ad-hoc analysis and reports as needed.
Perform other job-related functions as assigned.
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in Engineering Science, Business Administration, Finance, or other related field with strong quantitative analytical skills.
Minimum 2 years of experience in business/data analytics.
Knowledge of relational databases (SQL).
Excellent people and management skills to interact with staff, colleagues, cross-functional teams, and third parties
Strong work ethic
Company perks:
100% employer paid medical benefits after 90-day introductory period.
Travel potential in the US and Canada for trade shows, training, etc.
Growth potential with the ability to gain experience with different product lines.

title: Data Analyst - Sports Media
description:
$80,000 - $120,000 a year
Data Analyst - Sports Media
San Francisco Bay Area
$80,000-120,000

The Company:
Harnham has recently partnered with a rapidly growing Sports Media company. This San Francisco based company is scaling massively and they are looking to build out a robust analytics team to utilize data to optimize article performance. As a leader in the Sports Media industry, you will have the rare opportunity to combine your passion for analytics and sports!

About This Job:
They are building out their analytics function and are looking for an experienced analyst to join their team and work closely alongside some of the leading editors and writers in the sports media industry. Essentially this person will be tasked with analyzing the content performance across different sports articles and drive strategy to increase engagement.


Responsibilities:
Expert level SQL skills with some exposure to R or Python
Exposure analyzing content, campaign, media analytics in a previous role is a must
Examples of results and impact driven by your analysis regarding guiding high level decision making
Excellent communication skills and ability to work with stakeholders across different teams such as Growth, Product, and Marketing

The Perks:
Working at a company that is driven by sports and data
Having high level discussions with some of the biggest names in Sports Media
Office conveniently located near public transportation

Please express interest by following the "Apply" link or this page or by sending your CV to Isabella Arellano at

title: Data Analyst
description:
Position Overview:
Fair Trade USA's newly formed Data Team works with departments across the organization to collect, manage and share data about Fair Trade USA’s business and the impact of our work. The organization is committed to being excellent stewards of our data while working quickly to create meaningful data insights that can be used to evaluate the effectiveness of our programs and deliver supply chain insights to our partners.
The Data Analyst will work directly with Data Scientists, Engineers, and Program Analysts on the Data Team as well as collaborate with multiple departments to implement new tools and methodologies that will allow for optimation data collection, analysis, and visualization.
Key Responsibilities:
Innovate, build, and implement code-based solutions and database infrastructure that facilitate prompt analysis of received information
Implement ongoing Producer and Transaction database record management
Provide key input for internal teams to innovate data analysis methodology
Operate and innovate a Salesforce-based data cleansing tool to centrally convert reported data to uniform values
Conduct ad hoc analysis and visualize data, as needed by internal and external customers
Oversee systematic certification communications
Work effectively in an agile framework as a team member, supporting peers and providing insights and solutions to help improve external customer service as well as internal procedures
Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience
Must be proficient in SQL or another query language
Must show demonstrated knowledge in a programming language, preferably Python
Must be proficient in MS Office applications (most notably Excel)
Exceptional oral and written communication skills
Must be detail-oriented, logical, systematic, methodical, highly organized, able to problem solve and often work autonomously
Experience with auditing, reconciling, collecting, and analyzing data and reports is desired
Demonstrated ability to be flexible, adaptable and able to multi-task in a fast-paced and deadline-oriented environment
Strong work ethic, and likes to have fun on the job
Fluency in English required
A passion for Fair Trade USA’s mission, vision, and accomplishments
To apply:
Please submit your resume and cover letter to the attention of Serena Santoni, Data Scientist

title: Data Management Support Analyst
description:
Who is Taco Bell?

Taco Bell Corp., a subsidiary of Yum! Brands, Inc. (NYSE: YUM), is the nation's leading Mexican-inspired quick service restaurant (QSR) brand. From breakfast to late night, Taco Bell serves made-to-order and customizable tacos and burritos, among other craveable choices, and is the first QSR restaurant to offer American Vegetarian Association (AVA)-certified menu items. Taco Bell and its more than 350 franchise organizations proudly serve over 42 million customers each week through nearly 7,000 restaurants across the nation, as well as through its mobile, desktop and delivery ordering services.

Overseas, Taco Bell has over 300 restaurants, with plans to add 2,000 more restaurants internationally within the next decade. The brand encourages its fans to "Live Más" and connects with them through sports, gaming and new music via its Feed The Beat® music program. Taco Bell also provides education opportunities and serves the community through its nonprofit organization, the Taco Bell® Foundation™, and connects fans with their passions through programs such as the Live Más Scholarship program. In 2016, Taco Bell was named as one of Fast Company's Top 10 Most Innovative Companies in the World.

About the Job:
Support and maintain restaurant level POS and Digital Channels (Kiosk, mobile, web and delivery) data files for all company and franchise restaurants, ensuring accurate data integrity in all downloads and updates.

The role requires accuracy and testing of all data entry prior to deployment to ensure successful downloads to all Restaurants and Sale Point Devices. This individual must have a proven track record of success with a strong sense of accountability, ownership and drive.

The Day-to-Day:
Manage the data needs for POS and Digital Channels in support of national and test initiatives as determined by the Brand Marketing calendar and Operations.
Follow field ready process in the testing of database files prior to downloading and updating the devices.
Analyze and audit the data and take necessary action to ensure data integrity.
Develop and maintain effective working relationships with internal and external customers and cross-functional teams to ensure requests and issues are resolved in a timely manner.
Provide internal and external project leadership in support of database maintenance and marketing initiatives.
Provide support after hours (nights and weekends) to field operations and service desk in the resolution of menu related issues (varied work hours)
Manage and prioritize work activities with minimal supervision to meet continuous deadlines, which directly impact field operations.
Support and update Digital Channels' menus
Create and implement continuous process improvements to enhance the team's efficiency.
Introduce/Develop tools and utilities to improve accuracy and organization within the team.
Is This You?

Minimum 3 years of experience in a technology role, preferably in the Quick Service Retail (QSR) Industry
Experience with enterprise data manager and reporting tools is preferred
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or equivalent experience preferred
Must be detail oriented
Strong customer service, communication and organizational skills
Strong problem solving and analytical skills with the ability to clearly communicate across all levels of the organization and field
Strong oral and written communication skills
Self-motivated with the ability to work independently
Ability to adapt to frequent changes
Strong working knowledge of MS Excel
Strong knowledge of SQL server and database queries
Why Taco Bell?

We truly believe that where you work matters, and we know a thing or two about what makes employees happy. Join us on our mission of feeding people's lives with más!

Work-Hard, Play-Hard:
On-site child care
On-site gym with fitness classes and personal trainer sessions
On-site dining center & lounge (yes, there is a Taco Bell Restaurant inside the building)
Free snacks, soda, coffee and more
Bagel & Donut Fridays
Game room w/ Sports Memorabilia
On-site dry cleaning and laundry services
On-site carwash
On-site salon services, including: massages, hair, nails, chiropractic and waxing treatments
Year round half-day Fridays
4 weeks of vacation per year plus Holidays
Tuition reimbursement
Virgin Pulse (exercise incentive program)
Discounts for life's adventures (ex: theme parks, Sprint, Verizon, AT&T, etc.)
Favorable Family Leave Act support and Adoption Assistance
Generous Parental Leave Policy

For five years running, we've been ranked by the San Diego Business Journal as one of the 100 Fastest Growing Private Companies in San Diego and listed on the Inc. 5000 List of America's Fastest Growing Private Companies. Since 1999, we have been in the forefront of the equipment leasing business, working with businesses in hundreds of communities and industries to expand and upgrade their business equipment. As we have grown, so too has our product line, and now we are one of the country's largest private lenders of small business loans. Our customers call on us to get working capital, merchant cash advances, credit card processing, and, of course, equipment leasing.

title: Data Analyst
description:
At Uber, we ignite opportunity by setting the world in motion. We take on big problems to help drivers, riders, delivery partners, and eaters get moving in more than 600 cities around the world.

We welcome people from all backgrounds who seek the opportunity to help build a future where everyone and everything can move independently. If you have the curiosity, passion, and collaborative spirit, work with us, and let’s move the world forward, together.
About the Role

The Data Analyst on the Community Operations (CommOps) Global Strategy & Planning (S&P) team is an analytical and technical problem solver, who is able to dive into unstructured environments to design solutions. You will own the creation, maintenance, and ongoing improvement of KPI scorecards / dashboards that impact the day-to-day work of thousands of employees throughout our global Centers of Excellence and Greenlight Hubs. You need to have the ability to collaborate with leaders across CommOps as you work to build scalable reporting solutions. You will have the opportunity to maintain and improve global COE / GLH data and various standardized queries. Lastly, you will show tremendous ownership by working across various teams in CommOps to further align metrics and reporting globally and communicating to the business stakeholders.
About the Team
The Global S&P A&I team is the central Analytics and Insights (A&I) team for CommOps at Uber. We have three broad purposes - (1) Own Uber's support data integrity and quality, and metrics definitions and reporting, (2) Inform CommOps leadership’s priorities by generating high-value analytical insights, (3) Support other global teams' A&I needs. Our projects are typically broad in scope, which means there is tremendous opportunity to make a huge impact on the business.

What You’ll Do

Build and own periodic reporting - Create, maintain and improve KPI scorecards / dashboards that are a critical operational component that allow managers to run our vast network of global Centers of Excellence and Greenlight Hubs
Root cause analysis of data issues flagged by regional and other stakeholders. Identify and implement short-term solutions in a timely manner, while helping define the long-term solution
Ensure data integrity across several data sources, reports, and dashboards
Build and maintain data pipelines
Optimize existing data and reporting processes
Collaborate with regional POCs to understand KPI and data requirements
Own change management as our business changes and new data sources are added, KPIs change, etc

What You’ll Need

BA/BS in Economics, Business, Engineering, Operations Research, or other quantitative focus
Minimum 2 years of work experience in a quantitative / reporting / analytical role
Excellent analytical thinking - you connect the dots between the data and operations and gut check every number you see
Excellent SQL, Excel and general programming / coding skills
Good knowledge of Python and/or R
Basic understanding of statistical techniques and ability to employ them in solving business problems
Ability to thrive under pressure and in challenging environments
Team player
Strong organization & project management skills. Able to structure a project from idea to design / prototype to implementation
Strong communication skills, both verbal and written

Bonus Points if

Masters in a quantitative field (e.g., analytics, statistics)
Experience in data visualization tools, such as Shiny or Tableau
Experience working with customer support data, contact management analytics or customer insights

title: Database Marketing Analyst
description:
The Database Marketing Analyst is responsible for helping pull data from the CRM database and create reports to help in the analyzing consumer behavior, as well optimizing existing and building out new database management approaches, constantly enhancing in-house database.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities
Leverage expert SQL programming skills to run extensive customer transaction data queries across large volumes of data, multiple data extensions, and campaign history. Develop and implement weekly reporting for the enterprise on customer segment performance, trends, and key behavior drivers.
Apply analytical and programming skills to mine the relational customer database for insights.
Develop expert knowledge of current DB architecture and ETL processes and recommend ongoing process improvements.
Employ expert knowledge of SQL, Tableau, and BI applications to design, execute, and ensure quality of weekly automated reports, dashboards and ad hoc requests for the marketing team and other stakeholders.
Demonstrate strong business and analytical acumen when reviewing data for inconsistencies or anomalies that could skew analytical results.
Leverage strong interpersonal skills with Marketing and other stakeholders in gathering information to determine specification requirements for data requests, reports, and ongoing utility.
Perform routine database audits that includes review of business rules, data validation and augmentation, merging and purging duplicate records, etc.
Work continuously with third party database vendors to enhance/optimize the data model to accelerate information, reporting, and insights while ensuring accuracy.
Use and support database applications and analytical tools such as Microsoft SQL, Tableau, Microstrategy, Cognos and SSRS

title: Data Analyst
description:
ABOUT DSC:
We're on a mission to help guys take care of their minds and bodies so they can be the best version of themselves. We started with razors way back in 2011, and now millions and millions of Members later, we’ve expanded into shave products, skin care, hair styling, with more to come. We’re always growing and reinventing, and we rely on killer talent to help us achieve our goal of owning the bathroom. If you’re a team-playing innovator, you’ll fit right in. A sense of humor helps, too.

ROLE SUMMARY:
Dollar Shave Club’s Digital Product Analytics team is seeking a Data Analyst who will be an exceptional addition to our analytics organization. As a Data Analyst at Dollar Shave Club, you will be responsible for turning customer actions into data, data into insights, and insights into key business decisions that steer the strategic direction of the company.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
Partner with Product and Engineering to proactively define what success means and ensure we’ll have the data in place to measure against it
Design and analyze A/B multivariate tests to drive KPI improvement
Leverage internal and external analytics tools (Looker, Adobe) and SQL (Redshift) to access, manipulate, and analyze complex data sets
Build data visualizations and cross-functional reporting that conveys key performance metrics, significant trends, and relationships across multiple data sources
Be a resource for product owners and key stakeholders regarding data questions
Translate business hypotheses into data capture requirements and validate tracking and measurement
Collaborate across multiple teams to understand business needs, analyze complex data, and clearly communicate recommendations
Monitor web analytics KPIs to ensure site traffic and conversion funnels are performant
QUALIFICATIONS:
2-4 years experience in an analytical role, preferably in e-commerce
Demonstrated analytical and problem-solving skills
Proficiency in SQL a must
Able to juggle multiple priorities at once, self-manage and self-prioritize
Able to articulate complex technical problems to a non-technical audience Excellent communication skills
Tableau experience a plus
-

title: Data Analyst - Games
description:
JOB DESCRIPTION

Universal Brand Development seeks a Data Analyst to join the high performance
Publishing team within the Games and Digital Platforms group. This position will be responsible for
creating business intelligence dashboards to help make data-informed decisions and to drive key
strategic recommendations for user acquisition, mobile game product optimization, and network/cross promotion management.

ESSENTIAL JOB RESPONSIBILITIES
Create dashboards, reports, and present data and insights via regular and ad-hoc reporting utilizing reporting/analysis platforms (i.e. Looker, SQL, Excel) to help teams understand and monitor the health and performance of their marketing campaigns or games
Work with marketing team to define key metrics, identify trends and opportunities across channels, campaigns and consumer segments, and provide solutions for driving profitable user acquisition campaigns
Analyze data on traffic sources and patterns in the impression to monetization funnel; provide actionable insights to marketing teams on campaign analysis, customer segmentation and profiling; expand real-time analytics practice for high profile campaigns and new product/ content launches
Document all marketing data standards and processes for accuracy and audit when necessary. Data fidelity is key.
Coordinate refining LTV methodology and maintaining LTV quality control
Translate business needs to technical requirements and AB-tests, and work with teams to ensure correct implementation to allow easy, precise analysis of the impact.
Identify and disseminate best practices across groups on how to interpret data and evaluate tests
Create models to forecast spend and revenue based on historical trends, and predictive models created by the data science team
Good understanding of statistical analysis, and preferred experience with statistical packages such as R, SPSS, SAS, Stata, etc.
Qualifications/Requirements
Basic Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in a technical or quantitative discipline (Mathematics, Economics, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, Business Intelligence), Master’s preferred
2+ years business analysis experience with hands-on experience with data analytics required
Relevant work experience in video games industry is highly preferred
Strong hands-on experience with SQL, data warehousing, data modeling, dashboards and reporting, involving very large datasets and multiple data sources, with ability to interpret data and produce meaningful insights
Superior knowledge of SQL and Excel with ability to turn raw data into actionable conclusions; programming experience and knowledge of Looker a plus
Knowledge of statistics and statistical models, such as power analysis, statistical significance, linear / logistic regression, clustering and factor analyses, machine learning and predictive analytics

Eligibility Requirements:
Interested candidates must submit a resume/CV online to be considered
Must have unrestricted work authorization to work in the United States
Must be covered by Solutions, NBCU’s Alternative Dispute Resolution Program
Sub-Business
Film Brand Development

Experienced

Glendale

California

United States
About Us
Are you a fan of The Fast and the Furious, Jurassic World, or Back to the Future? Have you ever dreamed about working on innovative games based on your favorite movies and TV shows? If so, The Universal Games and Digital Platforms group is looking for you! Join a diverse group of creative talent, crafting groundbreaking interactive experiences inspired by some of the world’s most valuable brands. Operating with a start-up mindset, the business unit is nimble, and explores new and emerging platforms, such as AR and VR, to stay at the forefront of innovation.They’re currently looking for even more movers and shakers, because this group is GROWING. Could you be the next member of the team that really is all ‘fun and games’?

title: Threat Intelligence Analyst
description:
Job Description – Threat Intelligence Analyst – R0029146

eBay is seeking an Information Security Threat Intelligence Analyst to join our highly visible Threat Management & Response Organization (TMR) to design and develop our threat intelligence program in support eBay’s eCommerce and Payments platforms. This position will perform intelligence collection/curation activities, and provide analysis using the Intelligence OODA Loop framework to identify emergent cyber threats to eBay.
Working within eBay’s TMR organization you will have the opportunity to build innovative solutions to identify and mitigate information-security threats. You will work collaboratively to creatively solve complex security problems in a heterogeneous environment. With your contributions, we’re building the best security operations center in the industry. Your skills, vision, tenacity, and passion will help us defend and respond daily to keep eBay’s critical information assets away from threats and hackers.
Candidates must have extensive experience working with various security methodologies and processes, advanced knowledge of TCP/IP protocols, extensive experience providing analysis and trending of security threats from various threat intelligence sources.

Core Job Functions Include:
Identify and assess internal and external cybersecurity risks that threaten the security or integrity of eBay’s eCommerce and payments platforms including all non-public information stored on systems.
Establish policies commensurate with eBay’s risk and complexity that addresses the concepts of threat information sharing through appropriate ISACs and other intelligence sharing bodies.
Modify control structures to use threat intelligence and build collaboration processes to identify and respond to information on threats and vulnerabilities.
Develop and formalize effective threat identification and assessment processes (Threat Knowledge), including maintaining procedures for obtaining, monitoring, assessing, classifying severity, and responding to evolving threats and vulnerabilities. Use this Threat Knowledge to drive risk assessments and response.
Develop, maintain, and update a repository of cybersecurity threat and vulnerability information that may be used in conducting risk assessments and provide updates to senior management, eBay board of directors, and eCI board of directors on cyber risk trends.
Conduct research and evaluate intelligence data - with specific emphasis on tactics, techniques, and procedures - focusing on threats facing eBay’s eCommerce and payments processing systems.
Correlate threat data from various sources and analyze network events to establish the identity and modus operandi of malicious users active in or posing potential threats to eBay.
Report security performance against established security metrics and compare to other similar businesses in the eCommerce and payments space.
Work closely within various Global Information Security teams and eBay’s Legal, and Risk teams to develop a fuller understanding of the intent, objectives, and activity of cyber threat actors.
Conduct complex cyber intelligence analysis, coordination, and interaction across a broad range of eBay, it’s adjacencies, and third-party ISAC partners.
Understand the trade-offs required to communicate the different levels of risk tolerance and risk exposures across the organization and balance this with risk investments
Coordinate with technology and business groups to assess, implement, and monitor business-related security risks/hazards.
Prepare assessments and cyber threat profiles of current events based on the sophisticated collection, research, and analysis of classified and open source information
Produces high-quality papers, presentations, recommendations, and findings for Senior Level Management and Enterprise Technology Leaders
Provides briefings and presentations to leadership supporting Information Security and Network Operations decision making
Provide situational awareness to executives and stakeholders of emerging threats and breaches in a timely fashion with appropriate guidance on impact to eBay, Inc.

To be successful in this position, you should be proficient with:
Communication – ability to articulate complex cyber threats to non-technical business partners. Proven competency in business writing and speaking for technical and executive audiences.
Teach – ability to train security concepts to other teams
Offensive Techniques – Penetration testing, IOCs, and exploits at all layers of the stack.
Logs Analysis - Comfortable with SEIM searching to gather and analyze logs to recreate incidents and hunt for threats.
System Forensics – Basic understanding of image acquisition techniques, memory forensics, and analysis
Networking Fundamentals - TCP/IP Protocols (HTTP, DNS, FTP, DHCP, ARP, etc.), and Wireshark/TCPDump.
Scripting – Should be familiar in scripting in at least one of the following: python, perl or a similar language.
Risk Analysis – Prior work experience analyzing threat and vulnerability data; classifying threats/vulnerabilities to determine severity and prioritize against existing system states, determining threats causing critical risk to business.

Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in Information Assurance, Information Security, Cyber Intelligence, or related field.
5+ years of experience in Cyber Threat Intelligence

Must have at least one (1) of the following certifications:
SANS GIAC: GCTI, ISC2: CISSP, NICCS: CCIP, EC Council: C|TIA

In addition, minimum of one (1) year of specialized experience in one or more of the following areas:
Security Assessment or Offensive Security
Application Security
Security Operations Center/Security Incident Response
Cyber intelligence Analysis

At eBay, your work makes a difference. We believe that we can build a better form of commerce that is enabled by people, supported by technology, and open to everyone – creating more opportunity for all.
