title: Data Analyst, Android Partner Engineering
description:
Qualifications
Minimum qualifications:
3 years of relevant work experience in data analysis or related field.
Experience working with large and multiple datasets/data warehouses.
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g. Tableau or Qlikview).
Project management experience.

Preferred qualifications:
Enthusiastic problem solver who has experience in structuring and executing complex analyses.
Ability to work closely with cross-functional stakeholders and consult successfully across organizational boundaries.
Developed business acumen, ability to draw insights and implications from complex datasets and make actionable recommendations.
Analytical, written/verbal communication, and interpersonal skills.
About the job

At Google, data drives all of our decision-making. As a part of the Business Intelligence Team, you'll be using data to inform business and product decisions across the company. When a feature on one of our products - from Google+ to Search to YouTube - gets tweaked, you’ll work with finance and engineering teams to measure the impact of that change. Using your technical skills and business acumen, you’ll build tools to automate reporting and dashboard updates so clients can see quickly and accurately how projects are performing. You’ll be involved from project inception to report design through to data delivery, ensuring that your reports are delivering high-quality and relevant data so that our business can grow intelligently.
The Android Partner Engineering (APE) team at Google works closely with the Android device ecosystem to extend the boundaries of what can be achieved with the Android platform. Whether working with device manufacturers, Carriers, or chipset manufacturers, APE team helps solve some of the toughest problems in delivering mobile technology that works for everybody. We work with teams throughout Google to develop solutions for strategic partners around the globe. We maintain crucial relationships with and build technical solutions for our long-term partners who are making Android into a world-changing platform.
APE’s Infrastructure’s vision is to enable a healthy Android ecosystem through analytics. The team analyzes massive data sets to provide information and insights to partners, various stakeholders and our senior leadership. You will be responsible for building the data infrastructure for data from various sources, ranging from Android Metrics to trixes, and creating a scalable data source for business reporting and analysis.
Google is and always will be an engineering company. We hire people with a broad set of technical skills who are ready to take on some of technology's greatest challenges and make an impact on millions, if not billions, of users. At Google, engineers not only revolutionize search, they routinely work on massive scalability and storage solutions, large-scale applications and entirely new platforms for developers around the world. From Google Ads to Chrome, Android to YouTube, Social to Local, Google engineers are changing the world one technological achievement after another.
Responsibilities

Gather reporting requirements for stakeholders and translate that into dashboards, reports, etc.
Build reporting infrastructure/pipelines for Internal and External reporting.
Work with Legal, Privacy and Product to be privacy complaint on external reporting.
Collaborate with Enginerring, Product and Business Development teams to deliver solutions.
Carry out ad hoc data analyses as needed.
Location



Mountain View, CA, USA

At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by emailing candidateaccommodations@google.com.
To all recruitment agencies: Google does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, Google employees or any other organization location. Google is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

title: Administrative Analyst
description:
American Specialty Health is searching for an experienced Administrative Analyst to support the Practitioner Contract Services initiatives. This role has a strong emphasis on quality for inbound and outbound correspondence.
You are invited to learn more about American Specialty Health's events on our events page.
Responsibilities
Supports administrative functions related to Practitioner/Fitness Records.
Ensures database is updated with Practitioner Status Change Requests (PSCR’s) and evaluates for quality assurance and timely submission; updates Practitioner Communications screen in PROMIS while maintaining a 3 day TAT.
Researches status of any practitioner changes in progress within 1 business day of request.
Processes term letters with 100% accuracy within 1 business day of Contract Determination Committee (CDC) decision.
Processes resignation letters with 100% accuracy, submits resignation data to PCS Phone Rep Coordinator for practitioner retention.
Receives and forwards malpractice declaration information to Practitioner Contract Administration department within 1 business day of request.
Processes State driven, ASH contract driven and/or individual health plan client driven Opt In’s/Opt Out’s within 1 business day of request.
Tracks receipt of signed Agreements where re-contracting of practitioners is necessary. Ensures updates to system are made and management is aware of return ratios.
Sends out health plan election forms to required contracted practitioners and forwards election forms to Practitioner Contract Administration department within a timely fashion, for data entry into the system.
Maintains health plan specific spreadsheets related to new health plan implementations in collaboration with Practitioner Recruitment Support Staff.
Contact practitioners as requested for network maintenance and to clarify questions regarding PSCR issues.
Participates in team meetings and performs other functions as requested by coordinator, supervisor and/or manager.
Prepares agendas and minutes for team meetings and distributes minutes to the team in a timely manner.
Ensures quality checks are completed on all administrative activities.
Represents ASH in an ethical, professional, and positive manner.
Maintains confidentiality of practitioner data.
Performs other duties and responsibilities as assigned.
Qualifications
High School diploma required.
Minimum two years computer experience including word processing, database management and spreadsheets.
Core Competencies
Demonstrated ability to interact in a positive, respectful manner and establish and maintain cooperative working relationships.
Ability to display excellent customer service to meet the needs and expectations of both internal and external customers.
Excellent listening and interpersonal communication skills to identify critical core competencies based on success factors and organizational environment.
Ability to effectively organize, prioritize, multi-task and manage time.
Demonstrated accuracy and productivity in a changing environment with constant interruptions.
Demonstrated ability to analyze information, problems, issues, situations and procedures to develop effective solutions.
Ability to exercise strict confidentiality in all matters.
Mobility
Primarily sedentary, able to sit for long periods of time.
Physical Requirements
Ability to speak, see and hear other personnel and/or objects. Ability to communicate both in oral and written form. Ability to travel within the facility. Capable of using a telephone and computer keyboard. Ability to lift up to 10 lbs.
Environmental Conditions
Usual office setting.

title: Senior Business Data Analyst- Digital
description:

National Funding is one of the leading providers of short term loans and equipment leasing for small businesses across the United States. For five years running, we've been ranked by the San Diego Business Journal as one of the 100 Fastest Growing Private Companies in San Diego and listed on the Inc. 5000 List of America's Fastest Growing Private Companies. As we have grown, so too has our product line, and now we are one of the country's largest private lenders of small business loans. Our customers call on us to get working capital, merchant cash advances, credit card processing, and, of course, equipment leasing.

title: Analyst
description:
FTX Games lives at the intersection of movies, television and games. We’ve been involved in some of the biggest games for the biggest movies and television shows of all time (The Hunger Games, Mission: Impossible, Narcos, etc.) and we’re growing. We need fun, smart people who share our passion for games and entertainment to join our team at our new headquarters in sunny San Diego.
FTX is currently seeking an Analyst to work with our data science, UA and product teams to drive analysis, research, and insights for optimizing performance across our portfolio of live titles.
RESPONSIBILITIES INCLUDE:
Support product team to understand and identify key product initiatives, low-cost opportunities, and high-return initiatives, from pre-launch to live service
Work closely with data science team to surface, qualify and understand key metrics including player retention and engagement
Work with the user acquisition team to understand and optimize campaigns
Be the subject matter expert for data visualizations and metrics-based storytelling, experience with Tableau a plus
Design and execute A/B tests that drive KPI improvements and clearly and concisely deliver results and actionable recommendations
Establish and assess KPI goals at the product and feature level to help guide product performance
Ensure that our data aggregation and analysis adheres to industry best practices
Participate in technical review of 3rd party tools, including: Analytics, Attribution, CRM, Mediation, Advertising and Monetization tools
Create tracking specifications and schema for future game and product releases
Build business cases to help drive portfolio decisions
QUALIFICATIONS
4+ years of directly relevant experience with a successful mobile game developer or publisher
Strong data analysis with proven capacity to run the right tests and iterate effectively
Analytical thinker who constantly questions states and values
Strong communication skills, to clearly and concisely convey testing design, results and recommendations
Experience using SQL for analysis from data mining and formatting to validating results
Very strong experience with Microsoft Excel with some exposure to R
Excels and thrives in fast-paced, ambiguous situations, proactively seeking answers and creating solutions
Ability to work with highly-confidential information
Ability to work well in a hierarchy and within a team
Works well in distributed teams
BS, quantitative or technical degree a plus (math, economics, engineering, or finance)
LOCATION
This position will be based in our new San Diego headquarters.

title: Data Analyst, Business Operations & International
description:
Data is central to Twitch’s decision-making process, and analysts are a critical component to evangelize data-driven decision making in all of our operations. As an analyst at Twitch, you will be in on the ground floor with the Business Operations & International team, shaping the way product performance is measured, defining what questions should be asked, and scaling analytics methods and tools to support our growing business, leading the way for high quality, high velocity decisions for your team.

For this role, we’re looking for an experienced data analyst who will assist our Business Operations & International team. The Business Operations & International team partners with Twitch’s product and business leaders to drive ad hoc strategic analyses, optimize business performance, and deliver best-in-class execution. From advising on our content acquisition strategy to evaluating new market and product opportunities, the team drives strategic recommendations with actionable insights. Working directly with the leads on the team, you will be responsible for guiding the team’s thought process when it comes to leveraging platform-level data to help answer large and complex strategic questions.
Responsibilities
Tackle complex and ambiguous analysis projects: resolve ambiguity as much as possible in all stages, comfortably flex among various tools to answer complicated questions, and accurately identify the trade-offs between speed and quality and apply or route work as necessary
Establish analytical framework for your team: partner with product and engineering teams to define measurement approaches, quantify and evaluate success, develop KPIs and guide tracking efforts for ongoing measurement and reporting
Supplement day-to-day operations with data - provide your team with ad hoc analyses, and operational analyses through automated reports and dashboards and self-service reporting tools that accurately reflect the health of their business and help them track their progress towards their goals
Be an effective mentor for your team & the company through your domain and process expertise, and your broad understanding of our data structure and stores, increasing the data literacy of your team
Maintain a culture of high quality output and exceptional customer service: effectively communicate at all levels, ensure that work gets done well and on time, respond effectively to unexpected obstacles and reallocate resources as necessary
Requirements
Expert SQL skills-your ability to tap into our data pipeline will be key to your success
Proven track record of using data to generate insight and drive business results
Fluency in data analysis and communication around data, including time series analysis, experimentation, data visualization, and defining KPI strategy for your business
Strong written and verbal communication skills
2+ years of industry experience in a relevant field
Bonus Points
Technical background with some programming experience
Statistics and hypotheses testing experience or knowledge is always a plus
You know a lot about online communities, games, and Twitch
Perks
Medical, Dental, Vision & Disability Insurance
401(k)
Maternity & Parental Leave
Flexible PTO
Commuter Benefits
Amazon Employee Discount
Monthly Contribution & Discounts for Wellness Related Activities & Programs (e.g., gym memberships, off-site massages, etc.)
Breakfast, Lunch & Dinner Served Daily
Free Snacks & Beverages
Twitch is the world’s leading video platform and community for gamers, with more than 100 million visitors per month. We connect gamers from around the world by allowing them to broadcast, watch, and chat with each other. Twitch’s live and on-demand video platform forms the backbone of a distribution network for video game broadcasters including pro players, tournaments, leagues, developers and gaming media organizations. Twitch is leading a revolution in gaming culture, turning gameplay into an immersive video experience. Learn more at http://twitch.tv.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at Twitch. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. title: Data Quality Curator
description:
$20 an hour
Part-time, Contract
Job Description
We are looking for detail-oriented data entry/data quality individuals to assist us in tagging, cataloging, and verifying massive amounts of data. At Goodwater, our data is critical to decision-making, both within the firm and for the two dozen companies that we support. We look to our data quality analysts and curators to ensure that we're making the best decisions based on sound and comprehensive data.
This is a contract position. This is a remote position. Full-time / Part-time available.
What you will be responsible for:
Ensure that our information on companies is complete and up-to-date.
Research, catalog, and organize new consumer tech companies for the investment team.
Verify accuracy and completeness of key insights generated by our platform.
Work with analysts to research and compile information during diligence.
Track data quality progress and work with the firm to ensure that we're meeting our quality goals.
What makes you right for this role:
Are task-oriented; focus more on how much you can check off and how quickly versus the amount of work.
Are very detail-oriented; have a good eye for spotting inconsistencies and can exercise good judgment about where things should go.
Demonstrate a detective-like ability to find verifiable information across the web.
Love learning and thrive in an environment that is collaborative, iterative, and gets a lot done.
Excel at creating and improving processes to make repeatable work faster and produce better results.
What makes us right for you:
You will have a unique opportunity to learn about startups and the tech industry.
We value data and place a premium on acquiring, curating, and making decisions from it. Your role is foundational to our values.
About Goodwater Capital
The mission of Goodwater Capital is to empower exceptional entrepreneurs who are changing the world. We are 100% focused on early-stage consumer tech, an area that we define simply as apps and services adopted directly by consumers. Goodwater is founded on the belief that we are experiencing an explosion of new consumer-driven opportunities in communications, community, and commerce. We are excited to see great entrepreneurs pioneering powerful new platforms to serve consumers across a broad range of industries including local services, marketplaces, health care, education, financial services, and wearables… just to name a few. Goodwater is focused on Series A and Series B consumer tech investments, and our chief investment criterion is simple — a product or service that early customers LOVE. Goodwater was founded in 2014 and manages nearly $400M across two venture capital funds. We are actively investing and building a growing portfolio of exciting consumer audience, commerce, and service companies.

title: Data Analyst
description:
Chime is dedicated to helping our members lead healthy financial lives. That’s why we offer an award-winning bank account that doesn’t charge unnecessary fees, gives members early access to their paychecks, and helps them save money automatically. Hundreds of thousands of people use the Chime mobile app and debit card to make purchases, track spending, save for the future, and more. Our members love Chime and use it daily.

We believe that the big banks fail to help their members achieve financial health - and in many cases work against it, charging hundreds of dollars in hidden fees and pushing products that drive people into debt. We don’t think it needs to be this way, so we’re out to beat them.

We have one of the most experienced management teams in Fintech and just raised a $70M Series C funding round, led by Menlo Ventures, to fuel our growth. If you’re looking to join a small but fast-growing company with a beloved, daily-use product and an authentic mission that puts people first, we want to meet you.

Chime is a technology and data-driven finance startup. Our Data Analysts play a pivotal role in the company by mining vast amounts of data to deflect fraudsters, deliver an awesome member experience and launch better products.

What You'll Do

In this role, you'll analyze data to drive better decision making and create reporting for key business functions with a focus on Member Services and Risk. Specifically, you'll:
Define and implement metrics reporting & dashboards for key business functions (Member Services, Risk Operations, and general business intelligence).
Work closely with the Member Services and Risk Operations team to develop data driven insights to drive operational improvements and create predictive models to optimize customer happiness and minimize fraud.
Work with Data Architects on improving data sources by implementing standardized calculations and variables.
Partner with Product to build and refine products; help manage internal/external analytic platforms and tools.

Qualifications

5+ years of experience in an analytics, data science, or business operations role. Masters Degree with a quantitative focus is plus.
You have a solid understanding of SQL and can use or a willingness to learn R/Python. Experience working in Looker is a plus.
A track record of defining and leading data intensive analytic projects to success.
You are collaborative and are able to effectively communicate across a variety of business functions and levels.
Understanding of financial services, financial products, and the associated risk.

A few of the perks of working at Chime:

Competitive salary and equity based on experience, with medical and dental benefits.
Free snacks and drinks, plus catered Wednesday lunches.
Flexible vacation policy.
Monthly happy hours and company events.
Dog-friendly office.
A challenging and fulfilling opportunity to join one of the most experienced teams in FinTech and help create a completely new kind of bank.

Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records. Chime is proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

title: Entry Level Research Analyst I Biomedtracker - Pharma Intelligence
description:
The Research Analyst I is broadly responsible for supporting daily content operations, ensuring the quality and integrity of the Biomedtracker database, providing research support to clients and supporting consulting/ad-hoc projects as necessary. These objectives are achieved through a solid understanding of the standard operating procedures and business rules of the database and various pharmaceutical intelligence sources, collecting key drug and trial data, conducting additional research and devising basic database search strategies for clients, and performing basic data analysis.
This entry-level position will be based out of our San Diego office within the La Jolla/UTC area. The ideal candidate will be comfortable working with a large, intricate database and heavy data entry on a daily basis. They will be effective in researching and interpreting extensive drug information through various online sources. They must possess the ability to multi-task and prioritize their own work to complete tasks on time.
Entry Level Research Analyst I Biomedtracker - Pharma Intelligence | San Diego, CA
The Research Analyst I is broadly responsible for supporting daily content operations, ensuring the quality and integrity of the Biomedtracker database, providing research support to clients and supporting consulting/ad-hoc projects as necessary. This entry-level position will be based out of our San Diego office within the La Jolla/UTC area. Support Research Analyst team in maintaining a real-time and accurate database
Collect and track day-to-day market driven events pertaining to drugs and companies in the biotech/pharma industry and enter the data into our internal content management system
Provide clients with timely, coherent and accurate research support
Apply knowledge of the regulatory process, pharmaceutical drug development and clinical trials to provide highest quality data and support

Impeccable attention to detail and accuracy
Strong internet research skills
Ability to use sound logic to edit, manipulate and analyze different types of data
Good organizational, time management and priority setting skills, and the flexibility to multi-task in a fast-paced environment
Ability to think critically, work independently and follow instructions
Ability to work collaboratively within a team both in the office and off site
Working knowledge of Microsoft Excel, Word and PowerPoint
Excellent written and verbal English skills

title: Quality Analyst (Entry Level)
description:
Space technology connects millions of people around the world and we’re accelerating tomorrow’s breakthroughs to help our customers stay ahead in an ever-changing world. At Lockheed Martin Space, we are motivated by innovation and integrity. We believe that by applying the highest standards of business ethics and forward-thinking thinking, everything is within our reach – and yours as a Lockheed Martin Space employee. Space values your skills, training, and education. Come and experience your future!

Lockheed Martin Space in Sunnyvale, CA entry level Quality Analyst opportunity to work within the Special Programs organization supporting the Vital Records Department. Special Programs has a consistent track record of stable programs with highly evolving technical requirements that drives subcontract changes on a regular basis. A significant number of future leaders have been developed with a wide variety of engagement programs and relevant work to develop individual potential.
Roles and responsibilities you will be involved with include:
Perform analysis on all completed assembly, process, test, mechanical, electrical, and electro-mechanical quality records to validate data accuracy, acceptability and completeness.
Document all discrepancies and engages with engineering and manufacturing to disposition non-conformance's.
Develop and provide recommendations to resolve discrepancies and corrective action for recurring non-conformance's.
Ensure that corrective measures meet acceptable quality standards.
The quality analyst is responsible for facilitating the end item data package customer review process and shall engage manufacturing, engineering, customer, vendor and subcontractor representatives to ensure that program requirements are met. You will also be responsible for handling the quality records control process to assure adequate accountability and trace-ability. The analyst shall develop, write and implement procedures applicable to the vital records organization. You will also support all Quality Assurance processes in accordance with program quality assurance plan, company policies, and procedures. You will excel as a self starter and possess strong decision-making abilities.

Benefits of Employment:
To promote the sharing of ideas, Lockheed Martin strives for an inclusive work environment that supports differences and big-picture thinking.
Our employees play an active role in strengthening the quality of life where we live and work by volunteering more than 850,000 hours annually. Here are some of the benefits you can enjoy:
Medical
Dental
401k
Paid time off
Work/life balance
Career development
Mentorship opportunities
Rewards & recognition
Learn more about Lockheed Martin’s comprehensive benefits package:
https://www.lockheedmartinjobs.com/working-here#benefits

Bachelors degree from an accredited college in a related discipline, or equivalent experience/combined education
Data records management experience
Strong critical thinking and analytical skills
Proficient with Microsoft Office suite and basic computer skills
Strong written and oral communication skills and ability to collaborate in a team environment
Self starter with the ability to work autonomously
TS/SCI w/ Poly clearance required
US Citizenship required
Desired Skills:
Knowledge and experience with Quality Planning and Records Management requirements and processes with work experience in a document management environment.
SAP & ERP experience
Understanding of test procedure, work instruction, data package review and approval process

job.Qualifications

Join us at Lockheed Martin, where your mission is ours. Our customers tackle the hardest missions. Those that demand extraordinary amounts of courage, resilience and precision. They’re dangerous. Critical. Sometimes they even provide an opportunity to change the world and save lives. Those are the missions we care about.

title: Digital Marketing Analyst
description:
National Pen is looking for an enthusiastic and passionate Digital Marketing Analyst to accelerate the growth of our ecommerce business utilizing Google Analytics (GA 360). In this role, you’ll work closely with the Channel Managers to provide valuable insight into how we measure, analyze, and attribute our digital marketing efforts. You will be expected to cull actionable insights from the data and work with the business leaders to implement and monitor your suggestions. Create dashboards and ad hoc reports supporting your analysis using Google Data Studio

Outstanding communication skills with both technical and non-technical colleagues

title: Data Analyst
description:
Verity Health System offers a dynamic environment for individuals dedicated to careers in health care - whether you seek a clinical or administrative role. Created in December 2015, the new Verity Health System team is working to revitalize our facilities to create a more welcoming, healing environment for our patients. We are investing in new technology to advance our delivery of safe, quality patient care. If you welcome the challenge of re-inventing healthcare for the patients we serve at our Verity Health hospitals and through our Verity Medical Foundation, this could be the opportunity for you. With more than 8,000 employees and physicians, Verity Health is a non-profit, non-religious health care system with 1,650 inpatient beds, six active emergency rooms and host of medical specialties including: orthopedics, transplant surgery, cardiology, maternal/child health and wound care, among other specialties. We are committed to the Verity Values of Caring, Respect, and Integrity, Passion and Stewardship and the goal of serving our communities for generations to come.
Opened as Mary's Help Hospital in 1912, Seton Medical Center, a 357 licensed bed facility serves the highly diverse 1.5 million residents of San Francisco and San Mateo counties with a comprehensive range of inpatient and outpatient services. Its sister hospital is Seton Coastside, a 116-bed skilled nursing facility located in the coastal town of Moss Beach. Seton Coastside offers the only 24-hour Standby Emergency Department along the 55-mile coastal stretch between Daly City and Santa Cruz.


GENERAL PURPOSE:
The Data Analyst shall assist with the coordination of the functions involved in Quality Assurance, Risk Management, Patient Safety and Infection Control. Duties include database management, coordination of special projects and reports for the Director of Quality and Risk Management. The position supports analytics and data management across multiple clinical services and systems to create actionable data output through various software solutions. This position requires advanced technical knowledge of database applications; data visualization software, SQL Management Studio, Excel (macros, templates, and pivot tables), and other techniques for automating tasks and productivity. Also provides technical and administrative assistance to the Quality Review and Infection Control nurses and Risk Manager as needed.


MAJOR JOB OBJECTIVES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Quality Management Support:
Provide computer support in creating graphs for various Performance Improvement projects.
Pull data reports from various databases such as Premier Connect, Press Ganey, AHA Survey, Quality Net, NHSN-SAMS, ARCIS, 3M, OSHPD-CCORP, NCDR,Q-Centrix, RmPro and the metrics utilized by these systems.
Perform data uploads, data validation, run reports and provide data maintenance for STS, ICD and CathPCI databases.
Coordinate and pull data for physician peer review and ongoing physician performance evaluations (OPPE).
Coordinate annual hospital surveys such as AHA and Leapfrog.
Provide computer support to Quality & Risk Management Director as needed.
Coordinate the collection of the Core Measures Data to Premier.


Infection Control Support:
Provide computer support in creating graphs for various projects for the infection Control Nurse/MD.
Provide Premier/Pathfinder data to the Infection Control Nurse as needed.
Other Computer/Database Support to other Departments
Provide support for the Patient Satisfaction Program.


QUALIFICATIONS:
Education/Requirements:
Bachelor's Degree or Higher in health or analytics-related field (informatics, epidemiology, economics, statistics, or other field emphasizing analytics).
2 years of experience with Microsoft Word, Excel (pivot tables, graphs, formulas), Access, PowerPoint.
One or more years of experience with statistical analysis software.
One or more years of experience with T-SQL (Microsoft SQL Server) in a healthcare setting.
Excellent oral and written communications skills.
Demonstrable technical experience with query software for accessing and retrieving data from a T-SQL database, and spreadsheet tools for creating, analyzing and managing large data stores. Comprehends complexities of data architecture.
Strong familiarity with Microsoft Office applications, including Microsoft Word, Excel, Access and PowerPoint. Knowledge of macros, pivot tables, query design, and other techniques for automating tasks and increasing productivity.
Ability to work independently with minimal supervision and also as a strong team member.
Ability to prioritize, plan work and function in a fast-paced, multi-project environment and under deadline pressure to multiple stakeholders.
Ability to work with a large variety of computer programs and databases
Desire to make an impact in health care with a thirst for complex challenges.
Knowledge of SPC Graphs and Data Interpretation
Knowledge of medical/clinical terminology preferred but not mandatory.

title: Data Analyst
description:
At Blend, we’re dedicated to improving lending. We’re an enterprise technology company, but our product affects the most important purchase most people will make in their lifetime—their home. For homebuyers, our product offers a clear, guided path to a new home. For lenders, we provide modern, easy-to-use tools that let employees spend their time helping customers instead of doing repetitive, manual tasks. By aligning and modernizing this archaic industry, we believe everybody wins and we’re just getting started.

The Data Analytics team is responsible for advancing Blend’s core business by identifying and collaborating with the product team to help drive understanding, growth, and the success of existing and future products. In partnering with the product team (Product Management, Design, Engineering) you will ensure Blend is bringing the best quality products to market. Analytics also works closely with Data Engineering to build insights, craft user narratives, and help define the product vision.

Founded in 2012 by former Palantir leaders, we’re currently backed by Founders Fund, Andreessen Horowitz and other prominent investors, and growing quickly.
Responsibilities
Use data to inform and influence product roadmaps and business decisions
Develop deep analytical insights around product use and customer experiences across varied data sets and products
Explore product and customer experience data, develop objectives and metrics, ensure product priorities are data-driven, and balance short-term and long-term goals
Partner with Product Managers and other internal business stakeholders to scope, measure, and drive product development. Help quantify the impact of qualitative insights
Work closely with Data Engineering to author and develop core data sets that empower analyses
Help build a data-driven product culture by driving awareness and understanding of metrics with dashboards and reports
Requirements
Experience writing production datasets in SQL or building data tools for ETL
Familiarity with a scientific computing language, such as Python
Understanding of fundamental probability and statistical concepts, such as hypothesis testing, maximum likelihood, and basic regression
Interest or experience in machine learning techniques (such as regression, decision tree, and segmentation) is helpful, but not required. A proven track record of using analysis to drive key decisions and influence change
Demonstrated ability to structure complex problems, derive insights from data, and communicate with diverse teams.
Come do the best work of your life here at Blend.

Blend is an equal opportunity employer that values diversity, inclusion and belonging. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

title: Lab and Study Research Data Analyst
description:
The Lab and Study Research Data Analyst (RDA) assists with data analysis for a BioScience laboratory using Next-Generation Sequencing (NGS), also known as massively parallel sequencing, techniques to effectively capture a large amount of microbial genomic information.

The Lab and Study RDA assists with sample library preparation and cataloging; develops data analysis tools to help investigator analyze and interpret data; analyzes information and identifies opportunities and needs for innovative solutions for the analysis and management of molecular profiling data in relevant databases. The Lab and Study RDA accurately records work performed including results and methodology; calculates, compiles and analyzes data obtained from work performed.

PROCTOR FOUNDATION FOR RESEARCH IN OPHTHALMOLOGY
The F.I. Proctor Foundation for Research in Ophthalmology at UCSF is committed to engaging in research activities and providing state-of-art patient care that address infectious and inflammatory disease that cause blindness. The mission is the prevention of blindness worldwide through research and teaching focused on infectious and inflammatory eye disease.

ABOUT UCSF
The University of California, San Francisco (UCSF) is a leading university dedicated to promoting health worldwide through advanced biomedical research, graduate-level education in the life sciences, health professions and excellence in patient care. It is the only campus in the 10-campus UC system dedicated exclusively to the health sciences.

description:
Under general direction of the Director of Admissions & Operations, as a member of the Admissions Data Management team, this individual is responsible for performing a variety of technical duties which require knowledge of methods and procedures in support of the campus' competitive recruitment and admission selection process. It also includes the development of the various electronic data collection tools, which include the electronic web application that drives the automated selection and formal admission decisions for the campus. This individual works closely with the VP for Marketing & Enrollment Development, the Director of Multimedia Communications and the Director of Outreach and Recruitment team to support the day-to-day technical and communication initiatives.

About Us
Cal Poly is a nationally ranked, four-year, comprehensive public university. Founded in 1901, the 6,000-acre campus is nestled in the foothills of San Luis Obispo, along California's scenic central coast and midway between Los Angeles and San Francisco. With a budget of $168.5 million, the university has a student enrollment exceeding 17,000 students and employs more than 2,000 faculty and staff members. Cal Poly is part of the 23-campus California State University system.

At California Polytechnic State University, San Luis Obispo, we believe that cultivating an environment that embraces and promotes diversity is fundamental to the success of our students, our employees and our community. Bringing people together from different backgrounds, experiences and value systems fosters the innovative and creative thinking that exemplifies Cal Poly's values of free inquiry, cultural and intellectual diversity, mutual respect, civic engagement, and social and environmental responsibility.

Cal Poly's commitment to diversity informs our efforts in recruitment, hiring and retention. California Polytechnic State University is an affirmative action/equal opportunity employer.

title: Digital Marketing Analyst
description:
National Pen is looking for an enthusiastic and passionate Digital Marketing Analyst to accelerate the growth of our ecommerce business utilizing Google Analytics (GA 360). In this role, you’ll work closely with the Channel Managers to provide valuable insight into how we measure, analyze, and attribute our digital marketing efforts. You will be expected to cull actionable insights from the data and work with the business leaders to implement and monitor your suggestions. This is a direct hire position with Benefits, PTO, 401K plus much more!
Responsibilities
Create dashboards and ad hoc reports supporting your analysis using Google Data Studio
Monitor trends to identify funnel drop-off points using Custom GA Reports and Google Sheets
Work with Channel Managers to identify tracking opportunities on the website
Facilitate any changes to analytics tagging by working with front-end engineering team to test and deploy new tags
Track Assisted Conversions for Paid Media campaigns
Synthesize quantitative data (GA) with the qualitative data (Full Story) to identify areas of improvement
Monitor and analyze Lifetime Value of all digital campaigns using in-house reporting
Analyze Brand and Non Brand keyword performance for SEO
Ensure data integrity for the Web Analytics dataset
Qualifications
5+ years of experience in web analytics with ecommerce focus
5+ years of exposure to digital marketing efforts (including Paid Media, SEO, or Email Marketing)
Deep subject matter expertise with Google Analytics (and GA 360)
Thorough understanding of Google Tag Manager
Basic SQL knowledge
Strong mathematical and problem-solving skills
Comfortable working with Web Analytics data outside of the GA interface (using R or Python)
Familiarity with A/B testing tools, including Monetate
Proven ability to turn data into actionable recommendations to achieve business goals
Outstanding communication skills with both technical and non-technical colleagues

title: Data Analyst
description:
As a Data Analyst, you will be the analytical data partner for our game studios. You will work closely with Game Designers & Product Managers to transform subjective discussions about product into concise analytic questions that deliver actionable answers. You will take a leadership role in managing studio relationships, mentoring junior analysts & shaping the evolution of our analytics infrastructure. This is a high visibility role that will have a direct impact on the success of some of our biggest titles.

What you’ll be doing:
Working with game teams to measure and optimize performance of titles in beta and after worldwide launch.
Using state of the art big data tools such as Hive, Presto and Redshift, to sift through billions of rows of data to answer challenging business questions.
Helping design and analyze AB and multivariate experiments.
Using Tableau to build dashboards that allow game teams to self-serve custom data for their titles.
Collaborating with game team to define telemetry of titles.
Continuously learning new technologies that advance analytic function at Glu.

You’ll be a great fit if you have:
3+ years of experience as an analyst, data scientist, or related quantitative role.
High proficiency with SQL, especially in distributed environments (Hive/Presto).
Experience in UNIX and Python.
An understanding of statistical analysis and familiarity with core statistical functions.

Extra bonus points if you have:
A passion for gaming.
Experience with Hadoop, HP Vertica, and other big data technologies.
Experience with modern programming languages (e.g. Python, JavaScript)
Experience with statistical packages such as R or SAS.
Predictive analytics or machine learning experience.

If all of this sounds exciting to you, then we think you might be someone who would succeed here on the team! We would love for you to apply, so we can discuss your valuable skills and how we can benefit from each other!

title: Prime Vendor Analyst- Palo Alto, CA
description:
Prime Vendor Analyst- Palo Alto, CA
(Job Number: OUT010299)
Primary LocationUS-CA-SM - California

Analyze business and financial results to support the sales organization.
Present findings and recommendations to sales management to solve problems and issues related to sales opportunities. Plan and prepare business, financial and data analysis and reports.
Create, maintain, and develop relationships with the customer, Medline contacts and vendor community. Lead various committees on behalf of customer (ex. value analysis committee).
Serve as initial point of contact for customers’ new and existing vendors. Meet with vendors to discuss products, pricing and terms. Present findings to key contacts in the customer’s procurement team.
Measure the trends, efficiencies and effectiveness of sales and resource allocation and utilization. Prepare and analyze sales forecast, sales results, budget variances, and quarterly business presentations.
Support sales team by managing contract terms, assisting with brand conversions, and tracking all savings and projects. Make presentations regarding project updates, business results, committee findings, etc.
Review pricing to determine items that are priced outside of the normal predetermined range for typical customers of that market type. Ensure new pricing rules are first reviewed and evaluated for their impact for final implementation.
Evaluate 3rd party industry pricing data being marketed and sold to Medline customers to understand what information is being provided and implications to the Company.
Provide issue resolution in the following areas (not limited to): inventory surplus, backorders, outstanding invoices. Initiate and partner with the internal teams. Communicate resolution in a timely manner.
Host weekly meetings with supply chain, materials services, and Medline Sales teams.
Collaborate with Sales, IS and Finance to develop, create and maintain reporting requirements and ensure systems provide accurate and timely data.

Medline offers a business casual, entrepreneurial work environment with strong growth potential; a competitive compensation package; a complete benefits package including medical/dental/vision/life insurance; and a 401(k) with company match and much more!




Education
Bachelor’s degree.
Will be considered: High school diploma and at least 5 years of experience in sales analysis and support.
Relevant Work Experience
At least 2 years of experience in sales analysis and support.
Additional
Experience diagnosing, isolating, and resolving complex issues and recommending and implementing strategies to resolve problems
Experience analyzing and reporting data in order to identify issues, trends, or exceptions to drive improvement of results and find solutions.
Experience providing customer service to internal and external customers, including meeting quality standards for services, and evaluation of customer satisfaction.
Intermediate level skill in Microsoft PowerPoint (for example: applying a theme, formatting character spacing, inserting a picture, changing slide layout and theme colors, adding transitions, customizing slide numbers, changing chart style and/or formatting font).
Advanced level skill in Microsoft Excel (for example: using AVERAGE function, merging and centering cells, printing centered page and/or creating a pivot table).
Willingness to travel for business related needs (i.e. training, accounts meetings, development, etc).

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:

Relevant Work Experience
Previous analytics experience in the healthcare industry.
Previous inventory or supply chain analytics experience.

title: Database Marketing Analyst
description:
The Database Marketing Analyst is responsible for helping pull data from the CRM database and create reports to help in the analyzing consumer behavior, as well optimizing existing and building out new database management approaches, constantly enhancing in-house database.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities
Leverage expert SQL programming skills to run extensive customer transaction data queries across large volumes of data, multiple data extensions, and campaign history. Develop and implement weekly reporting for the enterprise on customer segment performance, trends, and key behavior drivers.
Apply analytical and programming skills to mine the relational customer database for insights.
Develop expert knowledge of current DB architecture and ETL processes and recommend ongoing process improvements.
Employ expert knowledge of SQL, Tableau, and BI applications to design, execute, and ensure quality of weekly automated reports, dashboards and ad hoc requests for the marketing team and other stakeholders.
Demonstrate strong business and analytical acumen when reviewing data for inconsistencies or anomalies that could skew analytical results.
Leverage strong interpersonal skills with Marketing and other stakeholders in gathering information to determine specification requirements for data requests, reports, and ongoing utility.
Perform routine database audits that includes review of business rules, data validation and augmentation, merging and purging duplicate records, etc.
Work continuously with third party database vendors to enhance/optimize the data model to accelerate information, reporting, and insights while ensuring accuracy.
Use and support database applications and analytical tools such as Microsoft SQL, Tableau, Microstrategy, Cognos and SSRS

title: Data Warehouse Database Analyst
description:
Works with users throughout the organization defining requirements for databases, dashboards, and reports. Serves as the primary liaison between users and developers and is able to translate requests into programming specifications. Works independently on data modeling and report design for simple to moderately complex projects. Works in conjunction with business analysts, application developers, documentation/testing specialists, and implementation/support staff on complex projects. Documents databases, programs, and workflows.

Experience:

Typically requires 5 years experience with business analysis or data warehouse solutions.

Educational Requirements:

Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related field

License/Certification/Registration Requirements: N/A

Physical Demands:

None

title: Data Analyst
description:
$45,000 - $55,000 a year
Founded in 1945, the San Diego County Taxpayers Association seeks a full-time Data Analyst to join our team to support the President & CEO, Operations Director, and Policy Analyst.
This position also requires experience, discretion, and the flexibility and agility to juggle multiple competing projects and priorities at any one time, while meeting tight deadlines. Excellent organization, immaculate attention to detail, and quantitative skills are required. Occasional nights and weekends may be necessary.
The SDCTA Data Analyst, under the supervision of the Operations Director and the Policy Analyst, will:
Develop, test, and implement a database infrastructure
Perform data cleansing, merging, calculations, and analysis
Compile data from multiple sources into a usable format for a variety of projects
Develop methods and processes used for data extraction and long-term performance analysis
Handle and standardize large datasets, transforming them into meaningful reporting deliverables
Review and abstract relevant data from files and databases
Code data elements
Create summary charts and tables
Ensure databases are monitored, reconciled and data input completed necessary to enable analysis
Develop quantitative and qualitative research designs and methods for studies
Assist in research and establishment of project metrics
Record project metrics in detail and update as they change
Develop instructions and record thorough notes to create a process operational manual for data collection and analysis
Present findings to staff, offering data-driven recommendations to increase efficiency
Cultivate academic and other partnerships to develop and manage a trusted database of municipal and related data with which researchers could perform data analyses
Provide semi-weekly updates and presentations to Staff
Assist with administrative and meeting support duties as assigned
Prepare and coordinate needed materials for meetings and take meeting minutes
Policy analysis and research support as needed
Event planning and execution support as needed
Membership management support as needed
Other duties as assigned
Skills and Qualifications:
Demonstrated experience with data manipulation and analysis
Experience working with data analytics-driven solutions
Strong interest and curiosity in public policy and discussion in San Diego County (working knowledge of regional databases a plus)
Ability to gather and interpret information and to develop, recommend, and implement solutions
Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to build positive relationships and to work well independently
High personal work standards
High level of professionalism and ability to work well with internal and external stakeholders and board members
Ability to handle highly confidential information with discretion
Fast and accurate typing and data processing skills
Self-starter and self-motivated professional who is able to handle and prioritize several tasks and meet deadlines
Experience with Google Office Suite, Microsoft Office, and Salesforce
Preferred Qualifications:
Bachelor's Degree in a Quantitative Field
Experience with statistical software such as Stata
Benefits include:
Salary range $45,000 - $55,000 based on experience
Paid health, dental and insurance plans for employee, as well as Paid Time Off and 401k.
Job Type: Full-time

title: Market Data Analyst
description:
The Data Analytic Consultant provides support in making strategic data-related decisions by analyzing, manipulating, tracking, internally managing and reporting data. These positions function both as a consultant and as a high-level data analyst. The position works with clients to develop the right set of questions/hypotheses, using the appropriate tools/skills to derive the best information to address customer needs.


Essential Responsibilities:
Assists in issue identification and design of analytic approaches.
Employs specified analytical methods and tools to access data to provide reportable information from KP information systems.
Provides support and point of contact for department clients requesting routine information, data summaries and or reports.
Applies specified analytical methods including assessing the significance of observed changes, identifying associations among measured quantities, forecasting trends, etc.
Contributes to written reports and presentation materials describing project or task objectives, methods, data, and results.
Implements specified QA procedures to ensure accuracy of project data, results and written reports & presentation materials.

title: Data Analyst
description:
Part-time, Temporary
This is an exciting opportunity to work with a talented data team and continue growing a career in analytics. Duarte is looking for a team player who wants to dig into raw data, learn new tools, and help drive the business forward through actionable insights. This role will have exposure to teams across the company. Add additional data connections in Domo for company-wide use and answer ad hoc Domo questions.

This is a temporary part-time position.

THE QUALIFICATIONS

1 year work experience using SQL
Highly analytical and quantitative, with strong attention to detail
Bachelor's degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Business, Computer Science or quantitative focused study
Experience with front-end database access tools and/or Business Intelligence tools preferred
Highly analytical and quantitative, with strong attention to detail

title: Production Data Analyst
description:
Formulate mathematical approaches and gather data to solve key business problems Enhance performance by applying advanced mathematical modeling, simulation, data analytics, optimization techniques, and data visualization Develop and automate reports, iteratively build and prototype dashboards to provide insights at scale, solving for analytical needs Collaborate with cross-functional stakeholders to understand their business needs, formulate and complete end-to-end analysis that includes data gathering, analysis, ongoing scaled deliverables and presentations Experience using one or more programming languages (e.g. Python, Java, C++) Experience with statistical software (R, SAS, etc.) Experience pulling data from data sets and using statistics to arrive at an answer Experience in communicating technically, at a level appropriate for the audience Comfortable in a creative environment Strong data visualization skills Strong communication skills to liaise with executives Machine Learning highly preferred Bachelor’s degree with emphasis on coursework of a quantitative natures (e.g. Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Data Sciences)
It’s the magic of immersing yourself in a motion picture masterpiece, or a new track from your favorite band, or the spectacle of a live Broadway show. It’s hard to define and even harder to create, but that’s what we do at The Walt Disney Studios. Ours is a culture of innovation, collaboration and creativity. We raise the bar, then step over it, blazing trails through the production and distribution of world-class entertainment around the globe. If you want to help tell compelling, enduring stories through movies, music or stage plays, then we want to hear from you. The Walt Disney Studios encompasses the creation, production, promotion, sales, acquisition and domestic and international distribution of live-action and animated motion pictures, home entertainment releases, live stage plays, and music and soundtrack recordings. The Production Data and Analytics team is responsible for developing a strategy and vision for cross-functional and complex data analysis projects. This team aggregates data across multiple CG-animated productions and transform it into meaningful insights that inform decision making at both the operational and executive levels. The analyst will play a vital role in building the next generation of statistical models, metrics, and visualizations for our studio. They will be working with large, complex data sets in order to solve difficult, non-routine analysis problems. 605380

title: Jr. Financial Analyst (Research Accounting)
company: Sanford Burnham Prebys Medical Discovery Institute
description:
Sanford Burnham Prebys Medical Discovery Institute (SBP) is an independent nonprofit research organization that blends cutting-edge fundamental research with robust drug discovery to address unmet clinical needs in the areas of cancer, neuroscience, immunity, and metabolic disorders. The Institute invests in talent, technology, and partnerships to accelerate the translation of laboratory discoveries that will have the greatest impact on patients. Recognized for its world-class NCI-designated Cancer Center and the Conrad Prebys Center for Chemical Genomics, SBP employs about 1,000 scientists and staff in San Diego (La Jolla), Calif., and Orlando (Lake Nona), Fla. For more information, visit us at SBPdiscovery.org. The Institute can also be found on Facebook at facebook.com/SBPdiscovery and on Twitter @SBPdiscovery.

Summary
The Junior Financial Analyst will be working on the Research Accounting team. Under specific direction, this entry-level position assists the Research Accounting department with various financial management responsibilities in collaboration with and support of faculty and their laboratories. The Research Accounting team partners with faculty to provide financial planning and analysis along with compliance management to ensure that sponsored research projects are managed according to institutional and sponsor policy requirements.

Duties and Responsibilities
Prepares timely and accurate internal and external financial reports, journal entries, invoices, forecasts and personnel effort allocations, expense approvals, receivable and account reconciliations as well as account and budget set-up
Assists with the interim and annual audits by providing requested documents and preparing schedules in addition to developing and maintaining spreadsheets to track various data and deliverables
Supports a small junior level faculty portfolio


Required Skills

Required Experience
Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting, Finance or Business Administration or a related field, or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience from which comparable knowledge, skills and abilities have been attained
Candidates with previous experience in customer service or client communication experience preferred
Candidates proficient in Microsoft Excel preferred


Other Knowledge, Skills and/or Abilities
Ability to organize and prioritize tasks with a strong use of initiative and precise attention to financial detail
Ability to meet deadlines and manage time effectively with the highest degree of accuracy while working in an environment of fluctuating priorities and frequent interruptions
Ability to recognize problematic issues and resolve them through self-correction and/or self-resourcefulness
Possess excellent customer service skills with the ability to interact in a positive, professional and courteous manner
Possess excellent verbal and written communication and presentation skills with the ability to compose effective business correspondences
Work independently as well as in a team environment
Ability to be flexible and willing to perform other tasks as assigned
Be responsible, organized, and a problem solver
Possess strong attention to detail, analytical, time management, organizational, communication, and interpersonal skills
Professional proficiency in Microsoft Office, with strong Excel skills and the ability to compile, manipulate and optimize data
Embody the Institute’s core values of Commitment, Collaboration, Communication, Community and Compassion

title: Senior Business Data Analyst- Digital
description:
Are you?

Excited to influence business decisions with data- driven insights?
Awesome with Google Analytics, AdWords, and SQL?
Looking to collaborate with stakeholders as a strategic thought partner?
If the above describes YOU, keep reading for more details about this opportunity:

Based out of La Jolla, California, National Funding, an innovator and leader in the financial technology industry, is seeking a Senior Business Data Analyst focused on our digital marketing channels. National Funding has experienced double digit growth for many years and that growth is expected to continue. Our new Senior Business Data Analyst will contribute to that growth by delivering insights and recommendations that drive business decisions in our digital marketing strategy.

How you will make an impact:
Partner with Marketing Managers, Sales, and executives as a strategic thought partner to deliver key insights from web tracking metrics
Study website behavior patterns to analyze and optimize business results and user experience
Synthesize data from multiple sources, developing assumptions where needed, to drive customer insights and strategy development
Coordinate with external partners and business stakeholders to develop actionable dashboards which present the end to end funnel metrics, contributing to the development of hypotheses and actions
Collaborate with Marketing to measure impact of website strategy across all campaign channels and to refine strategy driven by data-based insights
Work with stakeholders to develop learning plans with recommendations of analytics approaches, including A/B testing
Ensure site tagging is implemented properly to provide visibility to impact and value of various initiatives and releases
An ideal candidate looks like this:
5-8 years of experience in web analytics decision support and website optimization
Deep subject matter expertise with Google Analytics and SQL; experience with Google AdWords, Google Webmaster tools and Google Tag Manager a plus
Solid understanding of Paid Search, SEO, and other digital marketing channels such as Affiliate, Social, and Display
Strong analytical and problem solving skills
Experience with Tableau (or similar data visualization tools such as Spotfire, PowerBI, QlikView, etc.)
Proven ability to tell stories with data and instill confidence in recommendations to motivate stakeholders to take action
Outstanding communication skills with both technical and non-technical colleagues
Prefer candidates with experience with CRM systems (Salesforce)
Prefer candidates with experience in Finance, Mortgage, Banking
Why National Funding?

Positive, energetic, passionate, business casual environment
Fantastic benefits package including medical, dental, vision, life, LTD, FSA, 401(k) with an employer match and PTO
Numerous employee events throughout the year including our annual traditions such as a Day at the Del Mar Racetrack, Del Mar Mud Run, Bring Your Kid to Work Day, Holiday Party, Employee and Family Picnic, sporting events, and more
National Funding is one of the leading providers of short term loans and equipment leasing for small businesses across the United States. For five years running, we've been ranked by the San Diego Business Journal as one of the 100 Fastest Growing Private Companies in San Diego and listed on the Inc. 5000 List of America's Fastest Growing Private Companies. Since 1999, we have been in the forefront of the equipment leasing business, working with businesses in hundreds of communities and industries to expand and upgrade their business equipment. As we have grown, so too has our product line, and now we are one of the country's largest private lenders of small business loans. Our customers call on us to get working capital, merchant cash advances, credit card processing, and, of course, equipment leasing.

title: Research Data Analyst 2
description:
$53,600 - $82,600 a year
On behalf of the Coastal Data Information Program (CDIP) and Southern California Coastal Ocean Observing System (SCCOOS), work on research data reporting assignments that are of moderate diversity in scope. Exercise judgment within generally defined practices and policies in selecting methods and techniques for obtaining solutions. Under the guidance of CDIP's management, work on oceanographic data analysis and data product development, program communications, and outreach and education activities. Contribute to the technical development of proposals. Support field work through SCUBA diving and instrument deployments and recoveries.
Ability to assist in the operation of small boats in the open ocean.
Knowledge of small boat operations safety requirements.
QUALIFICATIONS
A Bachelor's Degree in ocean engineering; or equivalent experience/training.
Working knowledge of and experience with data visualization and analysis software and/or programming languages such as Matlab, R, or Python. Experience with Unix.
Experience with data mining of NetCDF files, manipulation and visualization of time series, spectral parameters and geospatial information.
Demonstrated familiarity with Arc GIS or similar geospatial software.
Experience creating and/or modifying web-hosted data products, apps, dashboards, and interfaces.
Demonstrated ability to become certified for scientific diving.
Ability to assist in the operation of small boats in the open ocean, demonstrated knowledge of boat safety requirements and safe operation of small vessel.
Demonstrated familiarity with web frameworks such as Django and Bootstrap.
Working knowledge of research function. Knowledge of interdisciplinary studies and ocean and earth sciences for guiding data product planning and management.
Working skills in statistical analysis, systems programming, database design and data security measures.
Demonstrated working skills in analysis and consultation.
Demonstrated working knowledge of data-driven decision-making.
SPECIAL CONDITIONS
Job offer is contingent upon a satisfactory clearance based on background check results.
Ability to become certified for scientific diving.

title: Vans Business Analyst (North America)
description:
Vans: Be a Part of the Original

“It was never about waving the brand like a flag, it was always about the people” – Paul Van Doren
Vans is the original action sports footwear company rooted in authenticity and creativity. Founded in 1966, Vans has thrived on a legacy of impacting our greater community through Vans’ four pillars: action sports, music, art and street culture. We are constantly inspired by the expressive creators within our company and community as they bring new and innovative perspectives to help shape and transform the future of our business.

At Vans our culture sets us apart and it influences everything we do. Everything we do supports creativity and we are driven by our five values. We are determined . We are connected to our consumers and to each other. We are inclusive . We are expressive and Fun . And most of all, we are a family.

Vans is a subsidiary of VF, the world’s largest apparel and footwear company comprised of over 30 brands. We are the leading drivers of retail as our global footwear, apparel and accessory brand is available in 170 countries worldwide. As we continue to expand, we take great measures in developing and growing our people.

Vans is founded on a culture of learning. We take great pride in our ability to facilitate learning opportunities by providing the resources and tools necessary to support each individual’s pursuit of growth to achieve future goals. In order to prioritize career growth within our company, Vans offers courses on topics such as leadership, communication, collaboration and technical skills to ensure our employees are self-motivated and developing to the pace of our rapidly growing business.

By joining the Vans family, you will be immersed into an environment of incredibly supportive and collaborative people. We work very hard across a multitude of large initiatives to bring the Van Doren spirit to life. We live for what we do.

Vans Business Analyst– North America: Become the Newest Member of the Vans Family: In this role, your primary responsibilities as Business Analyst are to assist the Product Merchandising department with reporting and analysis to drive regional sales growth and track product efficiency during all product merchandising cycles. This process includes data collection and validation, managing and troubleshooting the database, and preparing weekly, monthly, and seasonal sales/ product merchandising recaps. The Business Analyst is responsible for the reporting of wholesale booking using Cognos and Tableau reporting tools. We are looking for a visionary with a stream of innovative ideas that will transform the action sports industry .

How You Will Make a Difference:

Perform weekly, monthly and seasonal reports to support the Apparel Product Merchandising team and Strategic Accounts team during all stages of the product merchandising cycle.
Assist Product Merchandising Director with the line review and brief reports.
Responsible for setting up new product, channel, and strategic account reports for the region.
Assist Product Merchandising Director with seasonal projections by style/color.
Responsible for Ad hoc analysis using reporting tools which could include Pivotlink, Cognos, CTI, Leapfile, Filezilla, Tableau and Think-Cell reporting.
Responsible for distribution of Product Merchandising reports to merchandising team.
Responsible for development of best practices in the business analyst role as it relates to Vans' developing wholesale business.
Execute action oriented analysis of product performance including but not limited to, product efficiency analysis, and product adoption rate metrics.
Build relationships with similar roles in other coalition brands to develop best practices and leverage VF resources.

Skills:

Ability to think strategically and act tactically.
Strong interpersonal communication, presentation and problem solving skills.
Comfortable in self-starter environment.
Basic computer skills – Microsoft Office, PowerPoint/Keynote.
Exercises strong interpersonal skills across internal and external partners.
Ability to work in an open environment with product team and cross-functional partners.
Computer proficiency including specific job-required applications.
Follows through with all tasks, assignments and job duties in a timely manner.

Special Physical and/or Mental Requirements:
Business travel may be required up to 5-10%.
Bend, lift, open and move product and related office items varying in weight from 1 to 25 lbs, depending on need.

description:

Competitive benefits

title: Customer Service Data Analyst
Data Analyst
description:
About the Role

Figure is a financial technology company leveraging blockchain, AI, and analytics to deliver innovative home equity release solutions and other products that help improve the financial lives of our customers. We are building a blockchain protocol to fundamentally transform how financial products are originated and transacted.

Join a culture and environment that encourages you do your best work - a place to be inspired and appreciated, to push the envelope, and team up on challenges that matter most to our customers. Surround yourself with the spirit of innovation, challenge the status quo and work with a talented team who holds one another capable to reach team goals.

This is an amazing opportunity to be part of a startup focused on solving real problems with blockchain. You will be part of a team with proven leaders who have created billions of dollars in value in the Fintech space. Join us!

About the Role

The Data Analyst is a key team member supporting the business with reports and analytics to make quality, data-driven decisions. The Analyst will use advanced data modeling, predictive modeling and analytical techniques to interpret key findings from company data. We are looking for a driven, data loving, team player that will jump in and thrive in a startup environment.

What you'll do

Partner closely with data and business teams and support them with high quality reporting and analytics
Be a champion for data accuracy and consistent reporting
Mine and analyze data from company databases to drive optimization and improvement of product development, marketing techniques and business strategies.
Use both descriptive and predictive modeling to increase and optimize customer experiences, revenue generation, underwriting as well as other business outcomes.
Develop and manage our company's A/B testing framework and drive towards data-founded conclusions.
What we're looking for

5+ years of experience manipulating, processing and extracting value from large, complex datasets… all while making insights easy to consume for a general audience.
Working knowledge of data mining principles: predictive analytics, mapping, collecting data from multiple data systems on premises and cloud-based data sources.
Strong SQL skills, ability to perform effective querying involving multiple tables and subqueries.
Advanced Tableau coding skills with a track record of developing visualizations that drive and optimize business outcomes.
Strong R and/or Python (preferred) coding skills.
Understanding of and experience using analytical concepts and statistical techniques: hypothesis development, designing tests/experiments, analyzing data, drawing conclusions, and developing actionable recommendations for business units.
Experience and knowledge of statistical modeling techniques: GLM multiple regression, logistic regression, log-linear regression, variable selection, etc.
Excellent communication skills for coordinating across teams
A Master's (or equivalent experience) in Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, or other quantitative field preferred
Ability to thrive and succeed in a startup environment
Benefits to you

Competitive salary based on experience and skills
Firm-wide 25% bonus target
Competitive stock options package as an early member of the team
A flexible paid time off and vacation policy
Comprehensive health, vision, dental insurance
And much more to come!
Figure will not sponsor work visas for this position. In compliance with federal law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States and to complete the required employment eligibility verification form upon hire.
