title: Business Data Analyst
description:
The next big thing in data is you!

Western Digital is the world’s largest data storage solutions provider. Our innovative storage solutions are at the heart of many of the world's largest data centers, and embedded in advanced smartphones, tablets, and PCs. Whether marketed under the WD, HGST or SanDisk brands, our storage solutions power the markets and companies that shape our lives—enabling possibilities for the cloud, enterprise and sophisticated infrastructures everywhere.

As a WDC Business Data Analyst in the Global Customer Care Organization, you will be tasked with setting data requirements, mining data, analyzing it, and generating ongoing reports based on the business needs. You must be data-driven with excellent analytical and communication skills as well as high attention to details.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Query data from multiple data sources from our CRM (Oracle and Salesforce) and other business applications.
Create and maintain various databases, data mining tools, and macros. Ability to write macros to automate reports is a plus.
Analyze and interpret results using various statistical techniques
Provide daily, weekly, monthly, and quarterly reports based on the various business requirements across Call Center, RMA and Service operations
Identify and interpret patterns and trends you see in the result and share the outcome with the management team along with recommendations on next steps
Define business requirements, data reporting needs, and new process improvement opportunities
Work with cross functional teams to understand their needs of reporting

QUALIFICATIONS:

REQUIRED:
Minimum 3+ years of experience as a business data analyst
BS or BA in Engineering, Computer Science, Business or relevant industry experience is required
Advanced skills in Excel and PowerPoint is a MUST
Experience in reporting automation using Excel or other programming technologies.
Experience in building visualizations or dashboards using Spotfire or Tableau

PREFERRED:
Experience with at least one major CRM is required, preferably Oracle
Understanding of reporting data warehouses, data integration and SQL programming is a plus
Experience in working with services operations or customer support operations data analysis

SKILLS:
Proven analytical skills and technical expertise with data models and data mining
Must be data-driven analytical thinker, and able to look at data sets from various points of view
Must be a quick learner who’s able to adapt to changes in priorities
Must have advanced excel skills
High attention to details

ABOUT WESTERN DIGITAL
The future. It’s on you. You & Western Digital.

We’ve been storing the world’s data for more than 50 years. Once, it was the most important thing we could do for data. Now we’re helping the world capture, preserve, access and transform data in a way only we can.

The most game-changing companies, consumers, professionals, and governments come to us for the technologies and solutions they need to capture, preserve, access, and transform their data.

But we can’t do it alone. Today’s exceptional data challenges require your exceptional skills. It’s You & Us. Together, we’re the next big thing in data.

Western Digital® data-centric solutions are found under the G-Technology™, HGST, SanDisk®, Tegile™, Upthere™, and WD® brands.

Western Digital is an equal opportunity employer.
Western Digital does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, ancestry, religion (including religious dress and grooming standards), sex (including pregnancy, childbirth or related medical conditions, breastfeeding or related medical conditions), gender (including a person’s gender identity, gender expression, and gender-related appearance and behavior, whether or not stereotypically associated with the person’s assigned sex at birth), age, national origin, sexual orientation, medical condition, marital status (including domestic partnership status), physical disability, mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, protected medical and family care leave, Civil Air Patrol status, military and veteran status, or other legally protected characteristics. We also prohibit harassment of any individual on any of the characteristics listed above. Our non-discrimination policy applies to all aspects of employment. We comply with the laws and regulations set forth in the "Equal Employment Opportunity is the Law" poster.

Federal and state laws require employers to provide reasonable accommodation to qualified individuals with disabilities. Please tell us if you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job or to perform your job. Examples of reasonable accommodation include making a change to the application process or work procedures, providing documents in an alternate format, using a sign language interpreter, or using specialized equipment. If you need any accommodation or assistance with our career site, please contact us at staffingsupport@wdc.com.

title: Data Analyst
description:
Tastemade is a global community of food lovers & travelers!

Who are we?

Would you consider yourself a food & travel lover? Do you get excited about bringing people together over a great meal? Does the idea of working at a company that is changing the way the world makes, watches and engages with video make you giddy? If you answered yes to all of these questions, then keep reading!

Tastemade is a global community of food lovers & travelers on a mission to connect the world through video. In just a few years our community has grown to over 200 million people watching our videos across a huge range of channels, devices and apps, from the web to Apple TV, Facebook, and Snapchat.

We are looking for passionate people who want to change the world and make a difference. People that are driven to disrupt the status quo and not looking for just another job.

Tastemade is seeking a Data Analyst to focus specifically on our Programming (Social Media) Analytics. The ideal candidate for this role lives and breathes data. You believe that truth and performance can be elicited from meticulously crafted analytical approaches.

What You’ll do:
Work directly on our programming team to drive a deep understanding of content performance and insights to inform future strategies, with the ability to make data and insights digestible to a wider team
Provide ad-hoc reporting on editorial performance and be the source of truth for all programming performance questions
Work directly with platform leads on Facebook, Instagram, Snapchat, YouTube, AppleTV, and others - to help them make informed decisions
Work with our ad sales teams (including research, brand strategy, account executives, and account managers) in order to deliver learnings across both editorial and branded content
Work across all platforms and analyze data across our 3 billion+ monthly views and 200 million+ monthly viewers from multiple sources
Work across multiple tools and platform analytics to deliver regular reports
What You’ll Bring:
Bachelor’s Degree
2 - 3 yrs experience in a related role.
Deep understanding of social media performance metrics required, especially as it relates to video
In-depth experience working with a variety of social insights & analytics platforms required (such as Facebook Business / Ads Manager, Tubular, CrowdTangle)
Strong analytical skills with the ability to turn data into trends & insights
Extremely important to be able to be a self-starter who is resourceful, collaborative, and able to run with something given minimal direction.
Must be comfortable working in a fast-paced, start-up environment.
Ability to communicate effectively with internal and external partners, and be a knowledgeable and strong representation of Tastemade.
Strong organization and time management skills
Perks:
Competitive salary
Stock options
Flexible vacation days and paid holidays
Medical, Dental, Vision, LTD, Life EAP, and 401K benefits
Apple iMac, MacBook or equivalent hardware
A stellar work environment – fun, casual, and fast-paced
Colleagues who are fellow food & travel lovers!

title: Database Marketing Analyst
description:
The Database Marketing Analyst is responsible for helping pull data from the CRM database and create reports to help in the analyzing consumer behavior, as well optimizing existing and building out new database management approaches, constantly enhancing in-house database.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities
Leverage expert SQL programming skills to run extensive customer transaction data queries across large volumes of data, multiple data extensions, and campaign history. Develop and implement weekly reporting for the enterprise on customer segment performance, trends, and key behavior drivers.
Apply analytical and programming skills to mine the relational customer database for insights.
Develop expert knowledge of current DB architecture and ETL processes and recommend ongoing process improvements.
Employ expert knowledge of SQL, Tableau, and BI applications to design, execute, and ensure quality of weekly automated reports, dashboards and ad hoc requests for the marketing team and other stakeholders.
Demonstrate strong business and analytical acumen when reviewing data for inconsistencies or anomalies that could skew analytical results.
Leverage strong interpersonal skills with Marketing and other stakeholders in gathering information to determine specification requirements for data requests, reports, and ongoing utility.
Perform routine database audits that includes review of business rules, data validation and augmentation, merging and purging duplicate records, etc.
Work continuously with third party database vendors to enhance/optimize the data model to accelerate information, reporting, and insights while ensuring accuracy.
Use and support database applications and analytical tools such as Microsoft SQL, Tableau, Microstrategy, Cognos and SSRS

title: Research Analyst
description:
$2,500 - $3,000 a month
This is an entry level professional position to provide research and data analysis support to the firm's senior consultants. We are a small firm in a specialized field with no formal training program. We are looking for highly motivated self starters with the ability to learn quickly and work in a team environment. Strong written, verbal, and mathematical skills necessary. Interact with school district clients, write correspondences, complete research, and produce reports based on research. Travel within the state of California required. Bachelors degree required. Experience with financial, demographic, and/or Adobe Suite software preferred. Opportunity for advancement.
ALMA Strategies (ALMA) is affiliated with School Facilities Consultants (SFC), both are full service companies and assist school districts, community colleges, local agencies, architects, and developers in all aspects of school facility planning and financing.
The firm specializes in:
Facility Planning
Demographic Analysis
Project/Program Management
Educational Planning
Financial Implementation Plans
State and Federal Funding Programs
Job Type: Full-time
Salary: $2,500.00 to $3,000.00 /month
Education:
Bachelor's (Required)

title: Marketing Data Analyst
description:
Contract
FocusKPI, Inc. is looking for a Marketing Data Analyst to work for our client in Sunnyvale, CA. This is a full-time contract position.
Responsibilities
Execute audience targeting logic (list pulls) for campaigns supporting LinkedIn’s Consumer acquisition and customer programs using distributed SQL variants (Apache Hive, Presto).
Author and maintain Hive query logic for audience targeting variables and automated list pulls.
Evaluate and prioritize project requests and enhance their intake process.

description:
Temporary, Contract
About Us
We are a growing company with a solid customer base, excellent compensation and benefits, and a collaborative yet flexible work environment. If you enjoy challenging projects, using new technologies to deliver innovative business solutions, and you're interested in working for an entrepreneurial company, we may have a home for you.

We are looking for Data Analyst to join our CX solutions team. At PTP, we value aptitude and creativity as well as experience. We are a diverse organization and are looking for bright, passionate and committed professionals who strive to be the best at what they do.

title: Threat Intelligence Analyst
description:
Job Description – Threat Intelligence Analyst – R0029146

eBay is seeking an Information Security Threat Intelligence Analyst to join our highly visible Threat Management & Response Organization (TMR) to design and develop our threat intelligence program in support eBay’s eCommerce and Payments platforms. This position will perform intelligence collection/curation activities, and provide analysis using the Intelligence OODA Loop framework to identify emergent cyber threats to eBay.
Working within eBay’s TMR organization you will have the opportunity to build innovative solutions to identify and mitigate information-security threats. You will work collaboratively to creatively solve complex security problems in a heterogeneous environment. With your contributions, we’re building the best security operations center in the industry. Your skills, vision, tenacity, and passion will help us defend and respond daily to keep eBay’s critical information assets away from threats and hackers.
Candidates must have extensive experience working with various security methodologies and processes, advanced knowledge of TCP/IP protocols, extensive experience providing analysis and trending of security threats from various threat intelligence sources.

Core Job Functions Include:
Identify and assess internal and external cybersecurity risks that threaten the security or integrity of eBay’s eCommerce and payments platforms including all non-public information stored on systems.
Establish policies commensurate with eBay’s risk and complexity that addresses the concepts of threat information sharing through appropriate ISACs and other intelligence sharing bodies.
Modify control structures to use threat intelligence and build collaboration processes to identify and respond to information on threats and vulnerabilities.
Develop and formalize effective threat identification and assessment processes (Threat Knowledge), including maintaining procedures for obtaining, monitoring, assessing, classifying severity, and responding to evolving threats and vulnerabilities. Use this Threat Knowledge to drive risk assessments and response.
Develop, maintain, and update a repository of cybersecurity threat and vulnerability information that may be used in conducting risk assessments and provide updates to senior management, eBay board of directors, and eCI board of directors on cyber risk trends.
Conduct research and evaluate intelligence data - with specific emphasis on tactics, techniques, and procedures - focusing on threats facing eBay’s eCommerce and payments processing systems.
Correlate threat data from various sources and analyze network events to establish the identity and modus operandi of malicious users active in or posing potential threats to eBay.
Report security performance against established security metrics and compare to other similar businesses in the eCommerce and payments space.
Work closely within various Global Information Security teams and eBay’s Legal, and Risk teams to develop a fuller understanding of the intent, objectives, and activity of cyber threat actors.
Conduct complex cyber intelligence analysis, coordination, and interaction across a broad range of eBay, it’s adjacencies, and third-party ISAC partners.
Understand the trade-offs required to communicate the different levels of risk tolerance and risk exposures across the organization and balance this with risk investments
Coordinate with technology and business groups to assess, implement, and monitor business-related security risks/hazards.
Prepare assessments and cyber threat profiles of current events based on the sophisticated collection, research, and analysis of classified and open source information
Produces high-quality papers, presentations, recommendations, and findings for Senior Level Management and Enterprise Technology Leaders
Provides briefings and presentations to leadership supporting Information Security and Network Operations decision making
Provide situational awareness to executives and stakeholders of emerging threats and breaches in a timely fashion with appropriate guidance on impact to eBay, Inc.

To be successful in this position, you should be proficient with:
Communication – ability to articulate complex cyber threats to non-technical business partners. Proven competency in business writing and speaking for technical and executive audiences.
Teach – ability to train security concepts to other teams
Offensive Techniques – Penetration testing, IOCs, and exploits at all layers of the stack.
Logs Analysis - Comfortable with SEIM searching to gather and analyze logs to recreate incidents and hunt for threats.
System Forensics – Basic understanding of image acquisition techniques, memory forensics, and analysis
Networking Fundamentals - TCP/IP Protocols (HTTP, DNS, FTP, DHCP, ARP, etc.), and Wireshark/TCPDump.
Scripting – Should be familiar in scripting in at least one of the following: python, perl or a similar language.
Risk Analysis – Prior work experience analyzing threat and vulnerability data; classifying threats/vulnerabilities to determine severity and prioritize against existing system states, determining threats causing critical risk to business.

Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in Information Assurance, Information Security, Cyber Intelligence, or related field.
5+ years of experience in Cyber Threat Intelligence

Must have at least one (1) of the following certifications:
SANS GIAC: GCTI, ISC2: CISSP, NICCS: CCIP, EC Council: C|TIA

In addition, minimum of one (1) year of specialized experience in one or more of the following areas:
Security Assessment or Offensive Security
Application Security
Security Operations Center/Security Incident Response
Cyber intelligence Analysis

At eBay, your work makes a difference. We believe that we can build a better form of commerce that is enabled by people, supported by technology, and open to everyone – creating more opportunity for all.





This website uses cookies to enhance your experience. By continuing to browse the site, you agree to our use of cookies

View our privacy policy

View our accessibility info

eBay Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, and disability, or other legally protected status. If you are unable to submit an application because of incompatible assistive technology or a disability, please contact us at talent@ebay.com. We will make every effort to respond to your request for disability assistance as soon as possible.

title: Data Analyst - San Francisco
description:
Overview
Milestone Technologies, Inc. is a leading IT Managed Services and IT Professional Services solutions provider headquartered in the Bay Area and serving clients globally. Our unique approach to IT Managed Services includes Contact Center Services, Internal IT Support, Data Center Operations, Workforce Solutions, and IT Professional Services.

Responsibilities
Proficient in all Tableau platforms including desktop, server and web-based.
Design, build, maintain & deploy complex reports in Tableau.
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets using standard statistical tools and techniques.
Consult with and advise senior management and multiple clients on strategies to improve reporting techniques through automation and the creation of dashboards.
Generate monthly reporting and ad-hoc analysis to support leadership decision-making.
Gather and document requirements from cross-functional teams and projects, and align on visualization expectations.
Build best practices of integrating financial and operational data for a variety of data sources; including: MS Excel, SQL, internal forecasting and planning tools.
Create dynamic dashboards using parameters, filters, calculated fields and applying level of details functionality.
Qualifications
Expertise in designing and presenting data using best practices in data visualization.
Ability to present to variety of internal and external stakeholders.
Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Knowledge of best practices and experience optimizing Tableau for performance by optimizing queries, extracts and logic.
Experience performing administrative tasks in Tableau Server in a production environment.
Experience with connecting and blending multiple data sources.
Strong analytical and critical thinking skills.
Minimum Qualifications
3 years experience in data analytics.
Systems: Proficient with Tableau, Python, MS Excel, SQL (Oracle, Hive, MySQL) and other analytical applications.
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Math, Engineering, Business and/or equivalent specialized education and experience in Data Science, Statistics, Data Analysis or related field.

title: Marketing Data Analyst
description:
This is a really exciting time to join Verve’s performance marketing team. This is a new role for Verve and an opportunity to shape the Marketing strategy and develop our Los Angeles office to achieve a high, fast and sustainable growth.
In the next 12 months you will:
Be leading the data driven mindset within the acquisition team for Verve: You will become an expert in Data analysis and insights for advocate and customer acquisition, always focussing on the company ROAS, revenue growth and scalability.
Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality
Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems
As Marketing Analyst Leader, you will Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports including actionable insights to the marketing team in order to improve the campaign results
Using your mathematical skills, you will be creating a bidding algorithm to shape our digital advertising bidding strategy
You will combine your communication skills with the insights gathered to report actionable insights and strategy to other department of the business.
You will be ruthlessly data-driven, ensuring the development and implementation of best practice in the tracking and storage of customer data, and support the use of this data in providing training to the teams member
Requirements
You are:
An experienced analyst, with 3+ years of paid advertising data management, ideally in either marketplace, retail or travel
A start-up enthusiast, with demonstrable experience in a high growth start-up environment
Highly analytical, data-driven and with a ROAS solution-oriented mindset.
Proficient in SQL & excel and willing to teach others
Benefits
Verve is building a platform which enables our global network of advocates to sell products and services they love to their friends in exchange for unique experiences and rewards. We‘ve established a beachhead in live entertainment and work with some of the biggest events in the world, and are rapidly expanding our festival and event portfolio across the U.S., UK, Europe, and Australasia. As we continue to expand rapidly within this market, we’re also developing and launching exciting new technology for events to connect directly with their biggest fans. At Verve we believe in a culture of freedom and ownership.
We empower you to own the value you create and impact on our future success. And we believe that to act as an owner you should be empowered to work in the way that enables you to deliver the best results – how and when you do is up to you. You choose your hours, where you work, the meetings you attend and the amount of holiday to take in order to create the most value and be at your best.

title: Project Analyst
description:
Contract
Position: Project Analyst
Location: San Diego, California
Employee Type: Contract
Manages Others: Yes
Reports To: Project Manager
Overview
We are looking for a Project Analyst with life sciences industry experience to work with the Project Manager and client representatives on conducting research projects, preparing and revising project documents, reports and presentations, and performing analytical tasks to ensure that the projects are supporting client goals and objectives. Additionally, the Project Analyst will serve as the liaison between the Project Manager and stakeholders, gather, analyze and communicate requirements, as well as gather critical data and support the project team with budget tracking.
Responsibilities / Essential Functions
Create, manage and disburse project-related reports.
Maintain project assets, communications and related database(s)
Evaluate and monitor the overall project progress.
Review and report on the project’s budget and finances to key stakeholders.
Routinely perform complete or component analysis.
Notify the entire project team about abnormalities or variances.
Provide regular project updates, reports and presentations.
Analyze, manage and mitigate risks associated with the project.
Position Requirements
Bachelor of Science degree in Engineering or technical field.
PMP preferred, but not required.
Life science industry experience is preferred, but not required.
Understanding of risk management policies and procedures.
Experience of managing budgets for large projects.
Ability to effectively communicate using multiple forms of communication.
Strong interpersonal and communications skills, both verbal and written.
Ability to demonstrate initiative and assertiveness, the ability to plan and manage work in an efficient manner.
Ability to work well under stress and time pressures.
Ability to travel to other client sites, if necessary.
Ability to work on weekends, if necessary.
Job Type: Contract
Experience:
Budgeting: 3 years (Preferred)
Education:
Bachelor's (Preferred)
License:
PMP (Preferred)

title: Data Analyst - Ads Platform
description:
Data is central to Twitch’s decision-making process and analysts play a critical role in evangelizing data-driven decision making in all of our products and operations. As a Data Analyst at Twitch, you will be in on the ground floor with the Twitch Ads team, shaping the way success is measured, defining what questions should be asked, and scaling analytics methods and tools to support our growing business. Ultimately, you are paving the way for high quality, high-velocity decisions and you will be responsible for identifying opportunities to improve the value of Twitch advertising for our customers.

For this role, we're looking for an experienced analyst who will be responsible for data analysis, dashboard/report building, metrics reviews, inform investments, guidance on success/failure metrics and ad hoc analysis. You will help improve the advertising experience for Twitch viewers, enable streamers to improve their monetization through ads, help advertisers generate more value from Twitch advertising, and identify opportunities to grow Twitch advertising revenue. Analytically-minded and extremely detail-oriented, you will have a passion for learning and intellectual curiosity that will lead you to ask questions beyond their daily tasks.
Responsibilities
Identify opportunities for growth: analyze viewer engagement and supply/demand dynamics of Twitch advertising and uncover bottlenecks; find specific opportunities or levers to increase the value of Twitch advertising for our customers and the company
Create analytical frameworks to measure team success: partner with cross-functional teams to define success metrics, create approaches to track the data and troubleshoot errors, quantify and evaluate the data, and then develop a common language for all colleagues to understand these KPIs
Prioritize and execute in the face of ambiguity: distill ambiguous problems, adapt your tools to answer complicated questions, and identify the trade-offs between speed and quality of different approaches
Evangelize data knowledge and insights: manage communications with your stakeholders and other teams, collaborate with both technical and non-technical colleagues to complete data projects, and ensure all parties can use the insights to further improve
Maintain a customer-centric focus: strive to be a domain and product expert through data, develop trust among your peers and stakeholders, and ensure that your team has access to data to make decisions
Support data processes: provide the team with ad-hoc analyses, automated dashboards, and self-service reporting tools so that everyone gets a good sense of the state of the business
Requirements
2+ years of domain experience in a consumer internet business, or in a high-velocity, high-growth product or business unit
Expert SQL skills, as the ability to tap into Twitch’s data pipeline will be key to success
Proven track record of using data to generate insight and drive business results
Fluency in data analysis and communication around data, including time series analysis, experimentation, data visualization, and defining KPI strategy for your business
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Sound business judgment; strategic and analytical capabilities
Ability to prioritize and multitask; ability to adapt to a fast moving environment
Excellent team player with ability to maintain strong internal and external relationships
Bachelor’s degree
Bonus Points
Experience with digital advertising, publishing and/or video
You are a Twitch user yourself
Perks
Medical, Dental, Vision & Disability Insurance
401(k)
Maternity & Parental Leave
Flexible PTO
Commuter Benefits
Amazon Employee Discount
Monthly Contribution & Discounts for Wellness Related Activities & Programs (e.g., gym memberships, off-site massages, etc.)
Breakfast, Lunch & Dinner Served Daily
Free Snacks & Beverages
Twitch is the world’s leading video platform and community for gamers, with more than 100 million visitors per month. We connect gamers from around the world by allowing them to broadcast, watch, and chat with each other. Twitch’s live and on-demand video platform forms the backbone of a distribution network for video game broadcasters including pro players, tournaments, leagues, developers and gaming media organizations. Twitch is leading a revolution in gaming culture, turning gameplay into an immersive video experience. Learn more at http://twitch.tv.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at Twitch. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

#LI-ML1

title: Data Analyst, Product
description:
About sweetgreen:
sweetgreen is on a mission to build healthier communities by connecting people to real food. We passionately believe that real food should be convenient and accessible to everyone. Every day in each sweetgreen, our 4,000+ team members make food from scratch, using fresh ingredients and produce delivered that morning. And in our local communities, we're committed to leaving people better than we found them. We're in the business of feeding people, and we're out to change what that means.

We are building our data services team to deliver thoughtfully designed, data-driven customer experiences and first-class internal operations.

We are seeking a Data Analyst to provide critical strategic support to our Product Management, Engineering, and IT teams as we undergo a digital metamorphosis. The opportunity to facilitate a fast-growing company's consumption of internal and external data – all for the mission of feeding more people better food – should excite you. You will use your comprehensive analytical skill set to guide our technical teams in their consumption of quality data-driven insights, helping to deliver our strategic goals.

Responsibilities:
This Data Analyst is responsible for providing data tools and analysis-based insight that drive the success of our technology department. From simple topline reporting to thoughtful design of org-spanning A/B testing systems, you will create data solutions that uncover actionable business insight and shepherd the business through its data epoch. This role is for you if you love collaboration, excel at end-to-end analysis, and have the business acumen and technical skills to line up the two.

Wrangle data from disparate sources to develop in-depth understanding of our internal and external customers, identify areas of opportunity, and execute projects to produce increased customer fanaticism
Provide internal stakeholders with data-driven stories that support strategic decision making
Work collaboratively across the company to build data tools (aggregated views, automated reports, ad hoc analyses, etc) that provide actionable insight
Help create a high-functioning and healthy data ecosystem
Demonstrate database technical proficiency in the areas of performance, reliability, and functionality
Develop data models for applications, metadata tables, views or related database structures
Collaborate with product and program managers, data platform engineers, analysts, leadership, and cross-functional stakeholders to understand business requirements
Desired Experience:
3+ years in quantitative analysis roles; experience with predictive modeling a plus
3+ years conducting clickstream analyses, A/B testing, and segmentation
3+ years using statistical scripting languages software (Python or R preferred)
3+ years heavy use of SQL (Amazon Redshift a plus)
3+ years Tableau experience, or similar BI tool
Ability to think strategically about business, product, and technical challenges
Interest and dedication to the healthy food revolution a huge plus
What you'll get:
Competitive pay + bonus plan granted based on performance
Health, dental + vision insurance
Flexible PTO, because we respect the need for work/life harmony
An opportunity to make a real impact on the people around you, both by growing them and by connecting them to real food
To live the sweetlife and celebrate your passion + purpose
A collaborative family of people who live our core values and have your back
A clear career path with opportunities for development, both personally and professionally
Our annual Impact Retreat offsite
Free sweetgreen swag
Complimentary sweetgreen
Come join the sweetlife!

sweetgreen provides equal opportunities for everyone that works for us and everyone that applies to join our team, without regard to sex or gender, gender identity, gender expression, age, race, religious creed, color, national origin, ancestry, pregnancy, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, marital status, sexual orientation, any service, past, present, or future, in the uniformed services of the United States (military or veteran status), or any other consideration protected by federal, state, or local law.

sweetgreen participates in the federal government's E-Verify program to determine employment eligibility. To learn more about the E-Verify program, please click here ( https://www.uscis.gov/e-verify ).

title: Digital Marketing Analyst
description:
National Pen is looking for an enthusiastic and passionate Digital Marketing Analyst to accelerate the growth of our ecommerce business utilizing Google Analytics (GA 360). In this role, you’ll work closely with the Channel Managers to provide valuable insight into how we measure, analyze, and attribute our digital marketing efforts. You will be expected to cull actionable insights from the data and work with the business leaders to implement and monitor your suggestions. This is a direct hire position with Benefits, PTO, 401K plus much more!
Responsibilities
Create dashboards and ad hoc reports supporting your analysis using Google Data Studio
Monitor trends to identify funnel drop-off points using Custom GA Reports and Google Sheets
Work with Channel Managers to identify tracking opportunities on the website
Facilitate any changes to analytics tagging by working with front-end engineering team to test and deploy new tags
Track Assisted Conversions for Paid Media campaigns
Synthesize quantitative data (GA) with the qualitative data (Full Story) to identify areas of improvement
Monitor and analyze Lifetime Value of all digital campaigns using in-house reporting
Analyze Brand and Non Brand keyword performance for SEO
Ensure data integrity for the Web Analytics dataset
Qualifications
5+ years of experience in web analytics with ecommerce focus
5+ years of exposure to digital marketing efforts (including Paid Media, SEO, or Email Marketing)
Deep subject matter expertise with Google Analytics (and GA 360)
Thorough understanding of Google Tag Manager
Basic SQL knowledge
Strong mathematical and problem-solving skills
Comfortable working with Web Analytics data outside of the GA interface (using R or Python)
Familiarity with A/B testing tools, including Monetate
Proven ability to turn data into actionable recommendations to achieve business goals
Outstanding communication skills with both technical and non-technical colleagues

Provide situational awareness to executives and stakeholders of emerging threats and breaches in a timely fashion with appropriate guidance on impact to eBay, Inc.

To be successful in this position, you should be proficient with:
Communication – ability to articulate complex cyber threats to non-technical business partners. Proven competency in business writing and speaking for technical and executive audiences.
Teach – ability to train security concepts to other teams
Offensive Techniques – Penetration testing, IOCs, and exploits at all layers of the stack.
Logs Analysis - Comfortable with SEIM searching to gather and analyze logs to recreate incidents and hunt for threats.
System Forensics – Basic understanding of image acquisition techniques, memory forensics, and analysis
Networking Fundamentals - TCP/IP Protocols (HTTP, DNS, FTP, DHCP, ARP, etc.), and Wireshark/TCPDump.
Scripting – Should be familiar in scripting in at least one of the following: python, perl or a similar language.
Risk Analysis – Prior work experience analyzing threat and vulnerability data; classifying threats/vulnerabilities to determine severity and prioritize against existing system states, determining threats causing critical risk to business.

Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in Information Assurance, Information Security, Cyber Intelligence, or related field.
5+ years of experience in Cyber Threat Intelligence

Must have at least one (1) of the following certifications:
SANS GIAC: GCTI, ISC2: CISSP, NICCS: CCIP, EC Council: C|TIA

In addition, minimum of one (1) year of specialized experience in one or more of the following areas:
Security Assessment or Offensive Security
Application Security
Security Operations Center/Security Incident Response
Cyber intelligence Analysis

title: Data Systems Analyst
description:
The Data Systems Analyst applies data and information system management concepts, department and campus methodologies, policies and procedures to provide database and data analytic and visulization tools that support the university’s research and medical education mission. Works on data and information management problems of moderate scope and complexity applying analyses of data and information requirements to deliver data analytic, research and reporting tools. Conducts needs assessment and gathers knowledge of business processes, and program operation and accredidation reporting requirements by collaborating closely with subject matter experts. Using data model and data normalizing techniques to compile and validate data from various data sources. Assist with data hosting and data warehouse management. Develop and maintain simple to moderately complex databases. Develop and maintain data visualization dashboards such as Tableau and/or Qlikview for end user and departmental needs. Assists and provides support to various medical education departments to implement and use applications and information systems. Implements and adheres to HIPAA privacy guidelines, UC data governance and information security policies.

Please Note:The position is located in Fresno, CA.

MEDICINE / FRESNO / ITS
About the Department: The Information Technology Services (ITS) department provides comprehensive technology support to the UCSF Fresno campus including core system infrastructure, enterprise systems, education technology, medical education support, AV and digital media services.

About UCSF Fresno: UCSF Fresno Medical Education Program is a branch campus of UCSF. Established in 1975, UCSF Fresno is focused on improving health in California’s San Joaquin Valley through excellence in teaching and patient care, innovative clinical research and community partnerships. UCSF Fresno is the largest physician-training program between Sacramento and Los Angeles. Programs and affiliations of the UCSF School of Medicine, Nursing, Pharmacy and Dentistry are administered by UCSF Fresno.

ABOUT UCSF
The University of California, San Francisco (UCSF) is a leading university dedicated to promoting health worldwide through advanced biomedical research, graduate-level education in the life sciences and health professions, and excellence in patient care. It is the only campus in the 10-campus UC system dedicated exclusively to the health sciences.

title: Project Controls Analyst
description:
Job Description Summary


Job Description
BD is the #1 global leader in Medication Management and the $2.3B Medication Management Solutions Business Unit is headquartered in San Diego. This business unit focuses on delivering solutions that span from the hospital to the home. Major customers of MMS products include hospitals and pharmacies. Increasingly, ambulatory surgical centers, physicians’ offices, clinics and long-term care facilities will look to MMS solutions for needs that are unmet today.

Medication Management Solutions include Alaris® infusion technologies, as well as Pyxis® medication dispensing technologies with ADE surveillance system, Patient Event Advisor helps to reduce costs, improve care coordination and streamline medication use from our HealthSight™ integrated platform. Data can also be integrated from proprietary devices to help with efforts to protect medication types at all points of care.

Medication Management Solutions leverages Enterprise Software to allow healthcare providers to have access to better surveillance and analytics: The platform standardizes and simplifies systems and healthcare data across the enterprise to help improve decision making, efficiency and cost.

We are recruiting highly driven Project Controls Analysts with a desire to pursue a career in professional project management. Project Controls Analysts have accountability to work with Program Managers who are leading complex new product development projects to manage project cost and schedule, including budget, forecast, commitments, accruals, Work-In-Place, milestones, WBS, critical path, progress, risks, contingency, and KPI’s.

Depending on the skills and work experience of the candidate, the trajectory of the position can evolve into a project manager position. The Project Analyst Role is considering the starting position within BD’s professional program management career path.

Key Responsibilities:
Collaborate with program, portfolio and functional management teams to develop improve product development predictability
Manage project cost and schedule, including budget, forecast, commitments, accruals, Work-In-Place, milestones, WBS, progress, critical path, risks, contingency, and KPI’s
Work with Program and Functional Managers to forecast and reconcile resource and budget allocations for active development projects
Update and progress the project schedule while maintaining logic to the master control schedule
Coordinates and tracks multiple key projects and tasks.
Maintains resource loaded and fully linked project schedules that can be utilized to analyze resource allocations, completion dates and critical path
Manage the project change control process and maintain the schedule baseline and current budget to reflect approved changes
Provide monthly project status report (cost, schedule and risk mitigation)
Conduct accrual analysis and coordinate with payment processing teams to track the status of vendor payments
Execute the project completion close out process, including closing contracts, finalizing schedule, and reconciling schedule/cost performance against baseline
Ensure effective and efficient regular formal and informal communications with the Program and Portfolio Management and NPD Core Teams using a variety of tools and channels
Ensures compliance with the company's global innovation and product development processes

Minimum Qualifications:
Education and Experience:
Requires a Bachelor of Science degree in an engineering field with a minimum of 2–years relevant experience managing and analyzing cost and schedule for multi-project hardware and software product development core teams.
MBA with a strong focus on technology commercialization is a plus
Experience managing cross functional new product development core teams in Med Tech industries with capital hardware and IaaS / SaaS software solutions is preferred
Project Management Professional (PMP) certification a plus

Skills and Knowledge:
Minimum of 2 years’ experience developing, managing and analyzing cost and schedule on multi-project hardware and software product development core teams
Knowledge with Microsoft Project, Excel, PowerPoint and Planview
Experience communicating financial status and schedule details from multiple businesses to project managers
Demonstrated ability to successfully influence people and teams at all levels without direct authority
Proven success building employee engagement; creating, communicating and building understanding of a shared project vision
Highly motivated, dynamic and customer-centric individual who thrives in a challenging and changing environment
Demonstrated strategic agility with strong analytical decision-making skills
Sound business acumen and financial performance knowledge
Exceptional critical thinking and change management skills
Demonstrated prioritization and problem-solving skills.
Demonstrated ability to manage conflicts and ambiguity to drive clarity and deliver results.
Demonstrated results and solutions-orientation as achieved through optimized processes and execution.
Ability to champion and execute customer-centric approaches, ideas, methods, and processes.
Experience navigating self and teams in cross-functional environments and/or matrix organizations.
Requires polished presentation skills to executive leadership level - representing self and Portfolio Group with an executive presence.
Must possess exceptional written and oral communication skills.
Knowledge of and experience in structured product development processes.
Effective meeting management and group facilitation skills.

Demonstrates mastery of the following competency areas:
Innovative Ideas & Approaches - ability to generate novel ideas for defining, implementing and bringing to market new portfolio management solutions
Project & Cross-Functional Leadership - possesses the skills, knowledge and aptitude to engage, influence, and direct all functions involved in business case development
Optimized Execution and Performance - advances long-term growth while consistently meeting or exceeding near-term business performance expectations.
Personal Effectiveness - ability to work effectively within project teams and cross-functional organizations.
Commercial Excellence - ability to effectively apply business, financial and commercial knowledge to successfully support the delivery of our new product development investments.


#LI-TECH

USA CA - San Diego TC Bldg C&D

title: Data Analyst
description:
San Francisco, CA

Marketing

FULL-TIME

MoneyLion is a leading mobile finance platform that empowers consumers to take control of their financial lives through free spending, saving and credit tracking tools, and smarter credit products. Founded in 2013 by a team of leading technologists and financiers, MoneyLion uses superior analytics and machine learning-based risk technology to gain a 360-degree view of its users’ personal finances, enabling better underwriting and the development of tailored financial product offers. With its built-in system of social endorsements, loyalty points and rewards, MoneyLion endorses good financial behavior and habit building.
WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR

We’re looking for Data Analysts to join our analytics team to help us take a data-driven approach to growth. We are looking for someone to work on analytics of the MoneyLion Rewards Program. This will entail a deep understanding of the MoneyLion rewards program and taking a hands-on approach to tracking, experimentation, and optimization. For details about our rewards program, please click here
RESPONSIBILITIES

Work directly with a Product Manager on the MoneyLion Rewards Program
Be an organizational expert on our tracking tools; educate and evangelize a data-driven approach throughout the user experience
Continue to develop our in-house marketing analytics tools
Implement and analyze A/B tests to optimize marketing efforts and understand key drivers
Perform ad-hoc data studies based on requirements from management
Work with the senior management team to support decisions with data
REQUIREMENTS

2+ years analytical experience
Experience working with databases (e.g. MongoDB,PostgreSQL, ElasticSearch, etc)
Knowledge of R, Python
Experience using and integrating with third-party RESTful APIs and tools (e.g. Mixpanel, Google Analytics,Taplytics, etc)
At MoneyLion, we feel passionately that everyone should have a clear path to better financial products. We use data to offer better financial products to all Americans. By rewarding financial responsibility, providing top-notch customer assistance and offering insightful financial education tips we aim to positively impact our customers and enable them to better their financial health. MoneyLion is headquartered in New York with offices in San Francisco and Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia. For more information, visit www.moneylion.com.

MoneyLion is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion in all aspects of recruiting and employment. We leverage the diverse backgrounds, perspectives and experiences of our workforce to create opportunities for our people and our business.

title: Data Scientist – New College Grad
description:
Company Overview
At Proofpoint, we have a passion for protecting people, data, and brands from today’s advanced threats and compliance risks. We hire the best people in the business to:
Build and enhance our proven security platform
Blend innovation and speed in a constantly evolving cloud architecture
Analyze new threats and offer deep insight through data-driven intel
Collaborate with customers to help solve their toughest security challenges
We are singularly devoted to helping our customers protect what matters most. That’s why we’re a leader in next-generation cybersecurity—and why more than half of the Fortune 100 trust us as a security partner.
The Role
Would you like to apply cutting edge data science techniques to help protect the world against cyber threats? At Proofpoint, we work with unique data sets and craft peta byte scale solutions to help protect some of the most targeted people especially in fortune 500 companies. One of the things that makes our problem space so challenging is that dynamic nature of the threat landscape. We need to outsmart the threat actors and be two steps ahead of the game. This is where static rule based systems can’t keep up with the sheer number of threat features we deal with and we need smarter machine learning solutions to help tackle the problem. As a member of our team, you will be part of the design and development of new game changing solutions that would have a real impact on the next generation security solutions at Proofpoint.
What You Bring to the Team
Good understanding of machine learning algorithms, tools and platforms
Experience in at least one of these Toolkits: numpy, scipy, scikit-learn, tensorflow, pytorch, keras, genism, vowpal wabbit, etc.
Understanding of programming fundamentals
Python proficiency
Self-starter and intellectual curiosity
Great communication skills, ability to explain predictive analytics to non-technical audience
Proficiency in data exploration techniques and tools
Why Proofpoint
As a customer focused and driven-to-win organization with leading edge products, there are many exciting reasons to join the Proofpoint team. We believe in hiring the best the brightest and cultivating a culture of collaboration and appreciation. As we continue to grow and expand globally, we understand that hiring the right people and treating them well is key to our success! We are a multi-national company with locations in 10 countries, with each location contributing to Proofpoint’s amazing culture!
#LI-DNP

title: Data and Business Analytics Specialist
description:
Contract
The Office of Inclusive Excellence drives UCI's commitment to equity, diversity, and inclusion. This commitment is fundamental to advancing the campus' mission as a public research university. To this end, the office provides institutional accountability, mounts training and education, conducts responsive research, and builds and sustains partnerships with universities and colleges that share this commitment.
The mission is to establish UCI as national leader and global model of inclusive excellence, where all faculty, graduate and undergraduate students expect equity, support diversity, and practice inclusion.

Under general direction, the Principal Research Analyst I performs the highest level of data management, statistical analysis, and business decision guidance and reporting for the Office of Inclusive Excellence (OIE) as a Data and Business Analytics Specialist. Responsible for data collection, analysis and reporting, and curating and disseminating business analytics on institutional effectiveness regarding faculty and graduate student diversity, equity, and inclusion, related strategic plan metrics, program benchmarking, program evaluation, and other institutional indicators on campus climate, structural diversity, partnership connections, and UCI member inclusion. Incumbent develops and manages datasets from multiple campus and national sources, conducts analyses and presents on descriptive statistics, and on cross-sectional and longitudinal analyses. Organizes data reviews for planning and programmatic activities and decision making, develops desired reports for inclusive excellence accountability, and designs and disseminates meaningful analytics and infographics. Additionally, the incumbent designs all aspects of projects (e.g., data collection, analyses, interpreting results, and developing reports and other means for disseminating evidence and scholarship). The incumbent uses a variety of approaches and methods (quantitative, qualitative, mixed-methods) for timely project completion to best meet diverse OIE data reporting needs: presents oral, written, and visual data for website, partner affinity groups, annual accountability, and program planning. Addresses professional development through ongoing and relevant training, reports priorities and achievements via campus-based productivity tools such as ACHIEVE, and remains current on cutting edge and innovative analytical approaches, tools and resources to in order to best assess diversity, equity, and inclusion related to UCI climate and individual member productivity. Supports projects as assigned to contribute analytical integrity and skills.

The University of California, Irvine is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer advancing inclusive excellence. title: Threat Intelligence Analyst
description:
Job Description – Threat Intelligence Analyst – R0029146

eBay is seeking an Information Security Threat Intelligence Analyst to join our highly visible Threat Management & Response Organization (TMR) to design and develop our threat intelligence program in support eBay’s eCommerce and Payments platforms. This position will perform intelligence collection/curation activities, and provide analysis using the Intelligence OODA Loop framework to identify emergent cyber threats to eBay.
Working within eBay’s TMR organization you will have the opportunity to build innovative solutions to identify and mitigate information-security threats. You will work collaboratively to creatively solve complex security problems in a heterogeneous environment. With your contributions, we’re building the best security operations center in the industry. Your skills, vision, tenacity, and passion will help us defend and respond daily to keep eBay’s critical information assets away from threats and hackers.
Candidates must have extensive experience working with various security methodologies and processes, advanced knowledge of TCP/IP protocols, extensive experience providing analysis and trending of security threats from various threat intelligence sources.

Core Job Functions Include:
Identify and assess internal and external cybersecurity risks that threaten the security or integrity of eBay’s eCommerce and payments platforms including all non-public information stored on systems.
Establish policies commensurate with eBay’s risk and complexity that addresses the concepts of threat information sharing through appropriate ISACs and other intelligence sharing bodies.
Modify control structures to use threat intelligence and build collaboration processes to identify and respond to information on threats and vulnerabilities.
Develop and formalize effective threat identification and assessment processes (Threat Knowledge), including maintaining procedures for obtaining, monitoring, assessing, classifying severity, and responding to evolving threats and vulnerabilities. Use this Threat Knowledge to drive risk assessments and response.
Develop, maintain, and update a repository of cybersecurity threat and vulnerability information that may be used in conducting risk assessments and provide updates to senior management, eBay board of directors, and eCI board of directors on cyber risk trends.
Conduct research and evaluate intelligence data - with specific emphasis on tactics, techniques, and procedures - focusing on threats facing eBay’s eCommerce and payments processing systems.
Correlate threat data from various sources and analyze network events to establish the identity and modus operandi of malicious users active in or posing potential threats to eBay.
Report security performance against established security metrics and compare to other similar businesses in the eCommerce and payments space.
Work closely within various Global Information Security teams and eBay’s Legal, and Risk teams to develop a fuller understanding of the intent, objectives, and activity of cyber threat actors.
Conduct complex cyber intelligence analysis, coordination, and interaction across a broad range of eBay, it’s adjacencies, and third-party ISAC partners.
Understand the trade-offs required to communicate the different levels of risk tolerance and risk exposures across the organization and balance this with risk investments
Coordinate with technology and business groups to assess, implement, and monitor business-related security risks/hazards.
Prepare assessments and cyber threat profiles of current events based on the sophisticated collection, research, and analysis of classified and open source information
Produces high-quality papers, presentations, recommendations, and findings for Senior Level Management and Enterprise Technology Leaders
Provides briefings and presentations to leadership supporting Information Security and Network Operations decision making
Provide situational awareness to executives and stakeholders of emerging threats and breaches in a timely fashion with appropriate guidance on impact to eBay, Inc.

To be successful in this position, you should be proficient with:
Communication – ability to articulate complex cyber threats to non-technical business partners. Proven competency in business writing and speaking for technical and executive audiences.
Teach – ability to train security concepts to other teams
Offensive Techniques – Penetration testing, IOCs, and exploits at all layers of the stack.
Logs Analysis - Comfortable with SEIM searching to gather and analyze logs to recreate incidents and hunt for threats.
System Forensics – Basic understanding of image acquisition techniques, memory forensics, and analysis
Networking Fundamentals - TCP/IP Protocols (HTTP, DNS, FTP, DHCP, ARP, etc.), and Wireshark/TCPDump.
Scripting – Should be familiar in scripting in at least one of the following: python, perl or a similar language.
Risk Analysis – Prior work experience analyzing threat and vulnerability data; classifying threats/vulnerabilities to determine severity and prioritize against existing system states, determining threats causing critical risk to business.

Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in Information Assurance, Information Security, Cyber Intelligence, or related field.
5+ years of experience in Cyber Threat Intelligence

Must have at least one (1) of the following certifications:
SANS GIAC: GCTI, ISC2: CISSP, NICCS: CCIP, EC Council: C|TIA

In addition, minimum of one (1) year of specialized experience in one or more of the following areas:
Security Assessment or Offensive Security
Application Security
Security Operations Center/Security Incident Response
Cyber intelligence Analysis

At eBay, your work makes a difference. We believe that we can build a better form of commerce that is enabled by people, supported by technology, and open to everyone – creating more opportunity for all.

Summary
The Health Services Data analyst is responsible for providing complex data extraction, data analysis, data manipulation, report generation, and interface design as needed for various departments within Sharp Rees-Stealy Medical group. The analyst will identify, analyze and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets, and identify problematic areas and conduct research to determine the best course of action to correct the data.

Specific duties include:
Generating routine and ad hoc reports according to production schedule
Data validation
Developing and maintaining databases and data systems necessary for projects and department functions
Performing basic statistical analyses for projects and reports
Developing graphs, reports and presentations of project results
Creating and presenting quality dashboards
The Health Services Data Management team is an experienced group of seven dedicated to support data-driven decision-making and translating clinical information needs into meaningful reports. It is a great place to learn, make a difference in the healthcare environment and have fun while delivering quality results and success to Sharp Rees-Stealy Medical Group.
With 400 primary and specialty care physicians providing care at 20 facilities throughout the region, Sharp Rees-Stealy Medical Group is one of the largest, most comprehensive medical groups in San Diego County, and is recognized for excellence in patient satisfaction and clinical care. For patient convenience and improved coordination of care, Sharp Rees-Stealy offers services like laboratory, radiology, physical therapy and urgent care within each clinic or nearby.
Sharp Rees-Stealy has also opened two remarkable state-of-the-art medical office buildings. One located in Downtown San Diego and the other in Sorrento Mesa. Both will provide their communities with leading edge care for decades to come.
Sharp HealthCare is proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, gender identity, transgender status, sexual orientation, protected veteran status or any other protected class.

title: Customer Quality Analyst
description:
Job Summary
The Customer Quality Coordinator is responsible for implementing and maintaining a customer’s unique product quality management system. This activity includes: Documenting the customer’s expectations/requirements, Training suppliers on requirements, Tracking and reporting adherence to program, managing product conversions, acting as a liaison between customer, onsite teams, VWR operations, & suppliers. Uses analytical methods and tools to provide business leaders data in order to understand, predict, improve, and/or control operations and processes. Must be cognizant of and adhere to Standard Operating Procedures and regulatory requirements.
MAJOR JOB DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES (List in order of importance)

Manages customer specific Product Change Control program.
Manages time sensitive customer specific projects.
Relationships: Facilitates and/or leads quality excellence teams.
Responsible for data management, analyzing performance, identifying problems, and developing recommendations that support operations management.
Clarifies and resolves complex business issues by breaking them down into meaningful components to determine root cause. Manages data through data mining, data modeling, data analysis, cost/benefit analysis, process mapping, and/or problem analysis.
Writes, speaks, and presents clearly across a variety of settings. Adjusts communication style by articulating technical concepts to non-technical groups.
Audits and risk notification for evaluation by Senior customer management.
Manages custom reporting through data mining, data modeling, data analysis, cost/benefit analysis, process mapping and/or problem analysis.
Publishes consumption and spending reports Weekly/Monthly/Quarterly.
Collects and implements Global Customer Forecasts.
Coordinates global team efforts to reduce dead and at risk inventories.
Invoice review and pricing audits.
May require traveling to customer sites.
Perform other duties as assigned.


QUALIFICATIONS (Education/Training, Experience and Certifications)

High school diploma or GED required; BS degree in Supply Chain, Logistics, Business, or Mathematics or equivalent experience preferred
2 - 5 years experience in quality management/purchasing/or account management
Previous experience indirectly managing associates is preferred
Training and courses in statistics, inside sales and cross referencing experience a plus
Valid Driver’s License


KNOWLEDGE SKILLS AND ABILITIES (Those necessary to perform the job competently)

Conform to all customer requirements for background checks, health and safety issues, security clearances and medical checkups.
Detailed knowledge of Information Access and System ESS; Intermediate Microsoft Office Knowledge with proficiency in Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Advanced understanding of Microsoft Access
Visual Basic programming skills a plus
Excellent customer service skills; display a professional can do attitude
Intermediate purchasing and inventory knowledge
High regard for safety, quality and adherence to protocols, policies and procedures
Must be flexible, adaptable, and multi-task oriented
Ability to self-manage and self-motivate; forward thinking
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Proficient in trouble shooting
Strong communication skills to interact with both customers and various departments within VWR
Understanding of, and ability to administer VWR’s policies consistently
Ability to make sound business decisions with limited consultation with manager


ENVIRONMENTAL WORKING CONDITIONS & PHYSICAL EFFORT (Under Typical Positions)
The work environment characteristics and physical effort described here are representative of those an associate encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions
Typically works in an office environment with adequate lighting and ventilation and a normal range of temperature and noise level.

Work assignments are diversified. Examples of past precedent are used to resolve work problems. New alternatives may be developed to resolve problems.

A frequent volume of work and deadlines impose strain on routine basis.

Minimal physical effort is required. Work is mostly sedentary but does require walking, standing, bending, reaching, lifting or carrying objects that may weigh up to 50lbs.


DISCLAIMER:
The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by employees assigned to this classification. They are not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required of employees assigned to this position.
Avantor is proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

We do not discriminate in hiring on the basis of sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religious creed, national origin, physical or mental disability, protected Veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law.

Requests for accommodation will be considered on a case-by-case basis. Please note that only inquiries concerning a request for reasonable accommodation will be responded to from this email address.

title: Threat Intelligence Analyst
description:
Job Description – Threat Intelligence Analyst – R0029146

eBay is seeking an Information Security Threat Intelligence Analyst to join our highly visible Threat Management & Response Organization (TMR) to design and develop our threat intelligence program in support eBay’s eCommerce and Payments platforms. This position will perform intelligence collection/curation activities, and provide analysis using the Intelligence OODA Loop framework to identify emergent cyber threats to eBay.
Working within eBay’s TMR organization you will have the opportunity to build innovative solutions to identify and mitigate information-security threats. You will work collaboratively to creatively solve complex security problems in a heterogeneous environment. With your contributions, we’re building the best security operations center in the industry. Your skills, vision, tenacity, and passion will help us defend and respond daily to keep eBay’s critical information assets away from threats and hackers.
Candidates must have extensive experience working with various security methodologies and processes, advanced knowledge of TCP/IP protocols, extensive experience providing analysis and trending of security threats from various threat intelligence sources.

Core Job Functions Include:
Identify and assess internal and external cybersecurity risks that threaten the security or integrity of eBay’s eCommerce and payments platforms including all non-public information stored on systems.
Establish policies commensurate with eBay’s risk and complexity that addresses the concepts of threat information sharing through appropriate ISACs and other intelligence sharing bodies.
Modify control structures to use threat intelligence and build collaboration processes to identify and respond to information on threats and vulnerabilities.
Develop and formalize effective threat identification and assessment processes (Threat Knowledge), including maintaining procedures for obtaining, monitoring, assessing, classifying severity, and responding to evolving threats and vulnerabilities. Use this Threat Knowledge to drive risk assessments and response.
Develop, maintain, and update a repository of cybersecurity threat and vulnerability information that may be used in conducting risk assessments and provide updates to senior management, eBay board of directors, and eCI board of directors on cyber risk trends.
Conduct research and evaluate intelligence data - with specific emphasis on tactics, techniques, and procedures - focusing on threats facing eBay’s eCommerce and payments processing systems.
Correlate threat data from various sources and analyze network events to establish the identity and modus operandi of malicious users active in or posing potential threats to eBay.
Report security performance against established security metrics and compare to other similar businesses in the eCommerce and payments space.
Work closely within various Global Information Security teams and eBay’s Legal, and Risk teams to develop a fuller understanding of the intent, objectives, and activity of cyber threat actors.
Conduct complex cyber intelligence analysis, coordination, and interaction across a broad range of eBay, it’s adjacencies, and third-party ISAC partners.
Understand the trade-offs required to communicate the different levels of risk tolerance and risk exposures across the organization and balance this with risk investments
Coordinate with technology and business groups to assess, implement, and monitor business-related security risks/hazards.
Prepare assessments and cyber threat profiles of current events based on the sophisticated collection, research, and analysis of classified and open source information
Produces high-quality papers, presentations, recommendations, and findings for Senior Level Management and Enterprise Technology Leaders
Provides briefings and presentations to leadership supporting Information Security and Network Operations decision making
Provide situational awareness to executives and stakeholders of emerging threats and breaches in a timely fashion with appropriate guidance on impact to eBay, Inc.

To be successful in this position, you should be proficient with:
Communication – ability to articulate complex cyber threats to non-technical business partners. Proven competency in business writing and speaking for technical and executive audiences.
Teach – ability to train security concepts to other teams
Offensive Techniques – Penetration testing, IOCs, and exploits at all layers of the stack.
Logs Analysis - Comfortable with SEIM searching to gather and analyze logs to recreate incidents and hunt for threats.
System Forensics – Basic understanding of image acquisition techniques, memory forensics, and analysis
Networking Fundamentals - TCP/IP Protocols (HTTP, DNS, FTP, DHCP, ARP, etc.), and Wireshark/TCPDump.
Scripting – Should be familiar in scripting in at least one of the following: python, perl or a similar language.
Risk Analysis – Prior work experience analyzing threat and vulnerability data; classifying threats/vulnerabilities to determine severity and prioritize against existing system states, determining threats causing critical risk to business.

Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in Information Assurance, Information Security, Cyber Intelligence, or related field.
5+ years of experience in Cyber Threat Intelligence

Must have at least one (1) of the following certifications:
SANS GIAC: GCTI, ISC2: CISSP, NICCS: CCIP, EC Council: C|TIA

In addition, minimum of one (1) year of specialized experience in one or more of the following areas:
Security Assessment or Offensive Security
Application Security
Security Operations Center/Security Incident Response
Cyber intelligence Analysis

At eBay, your work makes a difference. We believe that we can build a better form of commerce that is enabled by people, supported by technology, and open to everyone – creating more opportunity for all.





This website uses cookies to enhance your experience. By continuing to browse the site, you agree to our use of cookies

View our privacy policy

eBay Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, and disability, or other legally protected status. If you are unable to submit an application because of incompatible assistive technology or a disability, please contact us at talent@ebay.com. We will make every effort to respond to your request for disability assistance as soon as possible.
