title: Data Analyst
description:
Who We Are

We are passionate about bringing delicious foods from around the world to conscious consumers here in North America and Australia. We do this in the most sustainable way, directly working with farmers in different regions of the globe, and taking into account our impact on every step of the supply chain. Our certified “green” office is located in the Dogpatch in San Francisco, one of the burgeoning foodie neighborhoods in the foodie capital! In the past years, Alter Eco has experienced tremendous growth, and we are proud to be one of the newly established public benefit corporations in the USA. Learn more about us at www.alterecofoods.com.

Position Summary

The Sales Data Analyst’s primary responsibility is to support strategic decision making for the company by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing appropriate internal and external data sets. S/he will report to the demand planning & innovation manager and provide analysis to the functional areas of the company including Sales, Marketing and Operations in support of the overall business objectives.

The Ideal Candidate will have:
BS / BA required, degree in statistics, finance, math, economics or another analytical field.
1-3 years of experience in data analysis in a fast-paced environment.
Advanced Excel skills and ERP experience.
Experience working with SPINS and IRI data a plus.
Experience in a consumer products company strongly preferred.
Strong analytical aptitude with the ability to analyze/interpret data.
Excellent oral and written communication skills and the ability to work with people at all organizational levels.
Flexibility and adaptability to the demands of a fast-paced environment with multiple tasks and priorities.
Ability to find errors in large data sets and identify significant data amid large volumes of routine information.
Process-oriented to work on improvements.
Strong work ethic with a desire to get the job done & the willingness to learn.
A personal connection to the mission of the company.
If this sounds like you, we look forward to your application.

title: Senior Business Data Analyst- Digital
description:
Are you?

Excited to influence business decisions with data- driven insights?
Awesome with Google Analytics, AdWords, and SQL?
Looking to collaborate with stakeholders as a strategic thought partner?
If the above describes YOU, keep reading for more details about this opportunity:

Based out of La Jolla, California, National Funding, an innovator and leader in the financial technology industry, is seeking a Senior Business Data Analyst focused on our digital marketing channels. National Funding has experienced double digit growth for many years and that growth is expected to continue. Our new Senior Business Data Analyst will contribute to that growth by delivering insights and recommendations that drive business decisions in our digital marketing strategy.

How you will make an impact:
Partner with Marketing Managers, Sales, and executives as a strategic thought partner to deliver key insights from web tracking metrics
Study website behavior patterns to analyze and optimize business results and user experience
Synthesize data from multiple sources, developing assumptions where needed, to drive customer insights and strategy development
Coordinate with external partners and business stakeholders to develop actionable dashboards which present the end to end funnel metrics, contributing to the development of hypotheses and actions
Collaborate with Marketing to measure impact of website strategy across all campaign channels and to refine strategy driven by data-based insights
Work with stakeholders to develop learning plans with recommendations of analytics approaches, including A/B testing
Ensure site tagging is implemented properly to provide visibility to impact and value of various initiatives and releases
An ideal candidate looks like this:
5-8 years of experience in web analytics decision support and website optimization
Deep subject matter expertise with Google Analytics and SQL; experience with Google AdWords, Google Webmaster tools and Google Tag Manager a plus
Solid understanding of Paid Search, SEO, and other digital marketing channels such as Affiliate, Social, and Display
Strong analytical and problem solving skills
Experience with Tableau (or similar data visualization tools such as Spotfire, PowerBI, QlikView, etc.)
Proven ability to tell stories with data and instill confidence in recommendations to motivate stakeholders to take action
Outstanding communication skills with both technical and non-technical colleagues
Prefer candidates with experience with CRM systems (Salesforce)
Prefer candidates with experience in Finance, Mortgage, Banking
Why National Funding?

Positive, energetic, passionate, business casual environment
Fantastic benefits package including medical, dental, vision, life, LTD, FSA, 401(k) with an employer match and PTO
Numerous employee events throughout the year including our annual traditions such as a Day at the Del Mar Racetrack, Del Mar Mud Run, Bring Your Kid to Work Day, Holiday Party, Employee and Family Picnic, sporting events, and more
National Funding is one of the leading providers of short term loans and equipment leasing for small businesses across the United States. For five years running, we've been ranked by the San Diego Business Journal as one of the 100 Fastest Growing Private Companies in San Diego and listed on the Inc. 5000 List of America's Fastest Growing Private Companies. Since 1999, we have been in the forefront of the equipment leasing business, working with businesses in hundreds of communities and industries to expand and upgrade their business equipment. As we have grown, so too has our product line, and now we are one of the country's largest private lenders of small business loans. Our customers call on us to get working capital, merchant cash advances, credit card processing, and, of course, equipment leasing.

title: Data Analyst
description:
Scoot’s mission is to bring Electric Vehicles for Everyone. In doing so, we hope to have a massive impact on global climate emissions by creating an unmatched urban mobility solution that can impact the daily lives of people in cities. In our first city of San Francisco, we launched a first-of-its-kind shared scooter network that has transformed the way tens of thousands of locals get around the city. Our next phase includes expanding our mission around the world with new cities and new vehicles.

Our team is comprised of incredibly diverse skill sets from electrical engineers, to performance marketers, to fleet mechanics, and designers. All of us are unified by a passion for our mission, our tenacity at getting there, and our desire to have a bunch of fun while we do.

About the role:
Our team is growing and we’re looking for an experienced data analyst. You’ll dive into some of the company’s most challenging business questions and help shape the future of sustainable transportation.
As a Data Analyst, you will:
Work with business partners to identify and define KPIs in alignment with company goals
Build and maintain a set of reports and dashboards to track company performance
Analyze data to challenge assumptions and uncover new business and product opportunities
Clearly communicate insights to stakeholders so that they can be acted upon
Relevant experience and mindset:
2+ years of relevant experience working with data to solve problems and drive business goals
Comfortable writing SQL to gather, clean, and structure data for analysis
Experience building reports and dashboards with relevant tools (Looker, Mode, Tableau, etc.)
Ability to teach and mentor others on the effective use of data to solve problems
Bonus: Experience using R or Python to analyze and visualize data
Bonus: Experience working on problems related to transportation and logistics
What Scoot offers:
Competitive compensation and meaningful equity
Company-paid medical, dental and vision insurance
Unlimited scooting
An amazing culture, team, and mission of which you will be an essential part
The most-fun chance you will ever get to help save the planet


Scoot isn't like other startups. We are a truly mission-driven, friendly, and fun place to work where engineers, mechanics, marketers and managers collaborate to achieve our goal of Electric Vehicles for Everyone. The same motto we share with our riders - Be Seen, Be Safe, Be Nice - applies to how we work with each other.

-
Scoot is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Diversity in our team has been and will continue to be essential to succeeding at our mission to provide Electric Vehicles for Everyone.

title: Records Examiner - Analyst Supporting FBI
description:
Focused on delivering unsurpassed services in support of law enforcement and homeland security, FSA, a rapidly growing joint venture owned by trusted solutions providers Engility and AECOM, has a vacancy for a Records Examiner/Analyst. In this role, you will be supporting the overall mission of the Federal Bureau of Investigation . This position supports Special Agents, Attorneys and Paralegals in the Asset Forfeiture Section.

The FBI investigates a broad range of criminal violations, integrating the use of asset forfeiture into its overall strategy to eliminate targeted criminal enterprises. The FBI has successfully used asset forfeiture in White Collar Crime, Organized Crime, Drug, Violent Crime and Terrorism investigations.

A Records Examiner/Analyst will provide Data Analyst tasks and executes the following duties:

Review Data and information from multiple sources
Establish case/project files
Enter and retrieve data from data bases
Prepare and format management reports
Manipulate, transfer, compute and print information
Create and manipulate spreadsheets
Prepare and correct reports and correspondence using word processing software
Conduct validation and verification of case files and case data system
The Records Examiner / Analyst may serve as the contractor's supervisor in small offices. The Records Examiner / Analyst shall have the ability to:

Be responsible for the day to day supervision of contractor assignments
Provide on-site supervision for Contractor workforce
Provide on-the-job training for new personnel
Ensure Contractor personnel meet periodic training requirements
Schedule Contractor employees
Provide on-site quality assurance and quality control of work performed by Contractor personnel
NOTE: Candidates with an active Top Secret clearance strongly preferred.

A Records Examiner/Analyst must meet the following qualifications:

A four year undergraduate degree is preferred
Must have one year's experience in a field related to law enforcement (e.g. law firm, court, military, police or sheriff's department)
Attention to detail and the ability to read and follow directions is very important
Good oral and written communications skills are highly desirable
Must possess a demonstrated ability to analyze documents to extract information
Ability to review and analyze data and information from multiple sources
Ability to establish case/project files
Ability to enter and retrieve data from data bases
Ability to prepare and format management reports
Ability to manipulate, transfer, and compute and print information
Ability to create and manipulate spreadsheets
Ability to prepare and correct reports and correspondence using word processing software
Ability to obtain and maintain a Top Secret Security Access
This position requires U.S. Citizenship and a 7 (or 10) year minimum background investigation.

Forfeiture Support Associates (FSA), LLC is proud to be an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer. We recruit, employ, train, compensate, and promote qualiﬁed persons in all job titles without regard to age, ancestry, color, gender, HIV status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, race, religion, sex, sexual orientation (including gender expression and identity), veteran status, family leave status or any protected group status as deﬁned by applicable law.

title: Sales Data Analyst
description:
$60,000 - $70,000 a year
Sales Data Analyst
Summary
LoudPack Farms (“LoudPack”) is a grower, manufacturer, packer and shipper in the medicinal and recreational cannabis industry, offering best-in-class products for its clients and customers. With its state-of-the-art cultivation and manufacturing facilities in Greenfield, California, and corporate offices in Los Angeles and New York City, LoudPack is poised to become a global leader in the emerging cannabis industry. We are a fun and exciting company to work for who truly values our employees and offers industry-leading wages and benefits.
We are looking for an experienced Sales Data Analyst to join our team. The Sales Data Analyst position is a great opportunity for a professional analyst with a strong analytically driven background. This position requires complex analysis skills and will be primarily responsible for reporting on sales performance. Strong drive and self-motivated work ethic

title: Project Controls Analyst
description:
Job Description Summary


Job Description
BD is the #1 global leader in Medication Management and the $2.3B Medication Management Solutions Business Unit is headquartered in San Diego. This business unit focuses on delivering solutions that span from the hospital to the home. Major customers of MMS products include hospitals and pharmacies. Increasingly, ambulatory surgical centers, physicians’ offices, clinics and long-term care facilities will look to MMS solutions for needs that are unmet today.

Medication Management Solutions include Alaris® infusion technologies, as well as Pyxis® medication dispensing technologies with ADE surveillance system, Patient Event Advisor helps to reduce costs, improve care coordination and streamline medication use from our HealthSight™ integrated platform. Data can also be integrated from proprietary devices to help with efforts to protect medication types at all points of care.

Medication Management Solutions leverages Enterprise Software to allow healthcare providers to have access to better surveillance and analytics: The platform standardizes and simplifies systems and healthcare data across the enterprise to help improve decision making, efficiency and cost.

We are recruiting highly driven Project Controls Analysts with a desire to pursue a career in professional project management. Project Controls Analysts have accountability to work with Program Managers who are leading complex new product development projects to manage project cost and schedule, including budget, forecast, commitments, accruals, Work-In-Place, milestones, WBS, critical path, progress, risks, contingency, and KPI’s.

Depending on the skills and work experience of the candidate, the trajectory of the position can evolve into a project manager position. The Project Analyst Role is considering the starting position within BD’s professional program management career path.

Key Responsibilities:
Collaborate with program, portfolio and functional management teams to develop improve product development predictability
Manage project cost and schedule, including budget, forecast, commitments, accruals, Work-In-Place, milestones, WBS, progress, critical path, risks, contingency, and KPI’s
Work with Program and Functional Managers to forecast and reconcile resource and budget allocations for active development projects
Update and progress the project schedule while maintaining logic to the master control schedule
Coordinates and tracks multiple key projects and tasks.
Maintains resource loaded and fully linked project schedules that can be utilized to analyze resource allocations, completion dates and critical path
Manage the project change control process and maintain the schedule baseline and current budget to reflect approved changes
Provide monthly project status report (cost, schedule and risk mitigation)
Conduct accrual analysis and coordinate with payment processing teams to track the status of vendor payments
Execute the project completion close out process, including closing contracts, finalizing schedule, and reconciling schedule/cost performance against baseline
Ensure effective and efficient regular formal and informal communications with the Program and Portfolio Management and NPD Core Teams using a variety of tools and channels
Ensures compliance with the company's global innovation and product development processes

Minimum Qualifications:
Education and Experience:
Requires a Bachelor of Science degree in an engineering field with a minimum of 2–years relevant experience managing and analyzing cost and schedule for multi-project hardware and software product development core teams.
MBA with a strong focus on technology commercialization is a plus
Experience managing cross functional new product development core teams in Med Tech industries with capital hardware and IaaS / SaaS software solutions is preferred
Project Management Professional (PMP) certification a plus

Skills and Knowledge:
Minimum of 2 years’ experience developing, managing and analyzing cost and schedule on multi-project hardware and software product development core teams
Knowledge with Microsoft Project, Excel, PowerPoint and Planview
Experience communicating financial status and schedule details from multiple businesses to project managers
Demonstrated ability to successfully influence people and teams at all levels without direct authority
Proven success building employee engagement; creating, communicating and building understanding of a shared project vision
Highly motivated, dynamic and customer-centric individual who thrives in a challenging and changing environment
Demonstrated strategic agility with strong analytical decision-making skills
Sound business acumen and financial performance knowledge
Exceptional critical thinking and change management skills
Demonstrated prioritization and problem-solving skills.
Demonstrated ability to manage conflicts and ambiguity to drive clarity and deliver results.
Demonstrated results and solutions-orientation as achieved through optimized processes and execution.
Ability to champion and execute customer-centric approaches, ideas, methods, and processes.
Experience navigating self and teams in cross-functional environments and/or matrix organizations.
Requires polished presentation skills to executive leadership level - representing self and Portfolio Group with an executive presence.
Must possess exceptional written and oral communication skills.
Knowledge of and experience in structured product development processes.
Effective meeting management and group facilitation skills.

Demonstrates mastery of the following competency areas:
Innovative Ideas & Approaches - ability to generate novel ideas for defining, implementing and bringing to market new portfolio management solutions
Project & Cross-Functional Leadership - possesses the skills, knowledge and aptitude to engage, influence, and direct all functions involved in business case development
Optimized Execution and Performance - advances long-term growth while consistently meeting or exceeding near-term business performance expectations.
Personal Effectiveness - ability to work effectively within project teams and cross-functional organizations.
Commercial Excellence - ability to effectively apply business, financial and commercial knowledge to successfully support the delivery of our new product development investments.


#LI-TECH





Primary Work Location
USA CA - San Diego TC Bldg C&D

Additional Locations


Work Shift

title: Database Marketing Analyst
description:
The Database Marketing Analyst is responsible for helping pull data from the CRM database and create reports to help in the analyzing consumer behavior, as well optimizing existing and building out new database management approaches, constantly enhancing in-house database.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities
Leverage expert SQL programming skills to run extensive customer transaction data queries across large volumes of data, multiple data extensions, and campaign history. Develop and implement weekly reporting for the enterprise on customer segment performance, trends, and key behavior drivers.
Apply analytical and programming skills to mine the relational customer database for insights.
Develop expert knowledge of current DB architecture and ETL processes and recommend ongoing process improvements.
Employ expert knowledge of SQL, Tableau, and BI applications to design, execute, and ensure quality of weekly automated reports, dashboards and ad hoc requests for the marketing team and other stakeholders.
Demonstrate strong business and analytical acumen when reviewing data for inconsistencies or anomalies that could skew analytical results.
Leverage strong interpersonal skills with Marketing and other stakeholders in gathering information to determine specification requirements for data requests, reports, and ongoing utility.
Perform routine database audits that includes review of business rules, data validation and augmentation, merging and purging duplicate records, etc.
Work continuously with third party database vendors to enhance/optimize the data model to accelerate information, reporting, and insights while ensuring accuracy.
Use and support database applications and analytical tools such as Microsoft SQL, Tableau, Microstrategy, Cognos and SSRS

title: Data Analyst
description:
Position Summary
511 Operator plays a pivotal role in collecting and disseminating traffic and transit emergency and non-emergency information assisting in congestion management in the San Francisco Bay Area along with Santa Cruz and San Joaquin county. The timeliness and quality of the information is a key in this role as thousands of travelers depend on this information. The operator shall utilize software (Traffic and Transit Reporting and Management System (TRAMS)) to disseminate information on multiple dissemination channels inclusive of web portal, phone, social media and dynamic message signs.
This opportunity would be a great fit for someone who is data/quality centric and thrives in a fast-paced environment. Position works on a shift basis, and the hours may vary; and staff availability during emergencies is an important consideration for this position.
Responsibilities
The TIC Operators are responsible for collecting, monitoring and posting of the traffic and transit information. The traffic incident information from California Highway Patrol CAD and Lane Closure System automatically gets logged into the Traffic and Transit Reporting and Management System (TRAMS), the Operator is responsible to ensure the incident details are readable and can be understood by the travelers. Transit Incident Information is received from a variety of media including e-mails, tweets and other sources, and is entered into the system for dissemination on both the phone and web. Other duties include detecting scheduled and unscheduled traffic/transit and incident management events, congestion and travel time imbalances in the geographical coverage area with monitoring and/or surveillance systems.
Job Requirements
Obtain and post incident status information to and from multiple agencies
Monitor traffic/transit status, construction information, scheduled events and active events
Produce daily shift, equipment malfunction, activity and phone logs
Periodic system checks of the dissemination channels and the information being disseminated
Support during the emergencies
Participate in the regular operations training

title: Digital Marketing Analyst
description:
National Pen is looking for an enthusiastic and passionate Digital Marketing Analyst to accelerate the growth of our ecommerce business utilizing Google Analytics (GA 360). In this role, you’ll work closely with the Channel Managers to provide valuable insight into how we measure, analyze, and attribute our digital marketing efforts. You will be expected to cull actionable insights from the data and work with the business leaders to implement and monitor your suggestions. This is a direct hire position with Benefits, PTO, 401K plus much more!
Responsibilities
Create dashboards and ad hoc reports supporting your analysis using Google Data Studio
Monitor trends to identify funnel drop-off points using Custom GA Reports and Google Sheets
Work with Channel Managers to identify tracking opportunities on the website
Facilitate any changes to analytics tagging by working with front-end engineering team to test and deploy new tags
Track Assisted Conversions for Paid Media campaigns
Synthesize quantitative data (GA) with the qualitative data (Full Story) to identify areas of improvement
Monitor and analyze Lifetime Value of all digital campaigns using in-house reporting
Analyze Brand and Non Brand keyword performance for SEO
Ensure data integrity for the Web Analytics dataset
Qualifications
5+ years of experience in web analytics with ecommerce focus
5+ years of exposure to digital marketing efforts (including Paid Media, SEO, or Email Marketing)
Deep subject matter expertise with Google Analytics (and GA 360)
Thorough understanding of Google Tag Manager
Basic SQL knowledge
Strong mathematical and problem-solving skills
Comfortable working with Web Analytics data outside of the GA interface (using R or Python)
Familiarity with A/B testing tools, including Monetate
Proven ability to turn data into actionable recommendations to achieve business goals
Outstanding communication skills with both technical and non-technical colleagues

title: Data Analyst Intern
description:
Internship
PlayStation isn't just the Best Place to Play —it's also the Best Place to Work. We've thrilled gamers since 1994, when we launched the original PlayStation. Today, we're recognized as a global leader in interactive and digital entertainment. The PlayStation brand falls under Sony Interactive Entertainment, a wholly-owned subsidiary of Sony Corporation.

This internship is for Summer 2019.

Sony Interactive Entertainment is looking for a Data Analyst Intern to become part of IT Applications team who manages the SIE Intranet, develops custom applications and workflows for revenue-generating business units, and trains SIE staff on the use of our IT applications such as Confluence, JIRA, Slack, Box & Google Apps for Work. Ideal candidates will have a strong desire to build both in-depth technical skills and an ability to develop exemplary client-facing skills. Candidate will implement, and maintain leading-edge analytic systems, taking complicated problems and building simple frameworks. Identify trends and opportunities for growth through analysis of complex data sets and generate forward looking insights for the business.

Responsibilities:
Evaluate organizational methods and provide source-to-target mappings and information-model specification documents for data sets.
Work closely with IT teams and maintain focus on their analytical needs, including identifying critical metrics and KPIs, and deliver actionable insights to relevant decision-makers.
Create best-practice reports based on data mining, analysis, and visualization.
Create and maintain rich interactive visualizations through data interpretation and analysis integrating reporting components from multiple data sources.
Evaluate internal systems for efficiency, problems, and inaccuracies, developing and maintaining protocols for handling, processing, and cleaning data.
Develop and maintain databases by acquiring data from primary and secondary sources, and build scripts that will make our data evaluation process more flexible or scalable across data sets.
Respond to requests for ad hoc analysis and investigate data inconsistencies.
Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics or related
1+ year experience mining data as a data analyst and visualizing using Tableau
At least 1 year of full-time professional experience working extensively with databases such as RedShift, and/or MySQL
Proficient with Python or R as well as Excel
Proven analytic skills, including mining, evaluation, analysis, and visualization
Technical writing experience in relevant areas, including queries, reports, and presentations
Strong SQL or Excel skills with the ability to learn other analytic tools
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Sony is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All persons will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, pregnancy, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, legally protected physical or mental disability, covered veteran status, status in the U.S. uniformed services, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, genetic information or membership in any other legally protected category.

We strive to create an inclusive environment, empower employees and embrace diversity. We encourage everyone to respond.

We sincerely appreciate the time and effort you spent in contacting us and we thank you for your interest in PlayStation.

title: Threat Intelligence Analyst
description:
Job Description – Threat Intelligence Analyst – R0029146

eBay is seeking an Information Security Threat Intelligence Analyst to join our highly visible Threat Management & Response Organization (TMR) to design and develop our threat intelligence program in support eBay’s eCommerce and Payments platforms. This position will perform intelligence collection/curation activities, and provide analysis using the Intelligence OODA Loop framework to identify emergent cyber threats to eBay.
Working within eBay’s TMR organization you will have the opportunity to build innovative solutions to identify and mitigate information-security threats. You will work collaboratively to creatively solve complex security problems in a heterogeneous environment. With your contributions, we’re building the best security operations center in the industry. Your skills, vision, tenacity, and passion will help us defend and respond daily to keep eBay’s critical information assets away from threats and hackers.
Candidates must have extensive experience working with various security methodologies and processes, advanced knowledge of TCP/IP protocols, extensive experience providing analysis and trending of security threats from various threat intelligence sources.

Core Job Functions Include:
Identify and assess internal and external cybersecurity risks that threaten the security or integrity of eBay’s eCommerce and payments platforms including all non-public information stored on systems.
Establish policies commensurate with eBay’s risk and complexity that addresses the concepts of threat information sharing through appropriate ISACs and other intelligence sharing bodies.
Modify control structures to use threat intelligence and build collaboration processes to identify and respond to information on threats and vulnerabilities.
Develop and formalize effective threat identification and assessment processes (Threat Knowledge), including maintaining procedures for obtaining, monitoring, assessing, classifying severity, and responding to evolving threats and vulnerabilities. Use this Threat Knowledge to drive risk assessments and response.
Develop, maintain, and update a repository of cybersecurity threat and vulnerability information that may be used in conducting risk assessments and provide updates to senior management, eBay board of directors, and eCI board of directors on cyber risk trends.
Conduct research and evaluate intelligence data - with specific emphasis on tactics, techniques, and procedures - focusing on threats facing eBay’s eCommerce and payments processing systems.
Correlate threat data from various sources and analyze network events to establish the identity and modus operandi of malicious users active in or posing potential threats to eBay.
Report security performance against established security metrics and compare to other similar businesses in the eCommerce and payments space.
Work closely within various Global Information Security teams and eBay’s Legal, and Risk teams to develop a fuller understanding of the intent, objectives, and activity of cyber threat actors.
Conduct complex cyber intelligence analysis, coordination, and interaction across a broad range of eBay, it’s adjacencies, and third-party ISAC partners.
Understand the trade-offs required to communicate the different levels of risk tolerance and risk exposures across the organization and balance this with risk investments
Coordinate with technology and business groups to assess, implement, and monitor business-related security risks/hazards.
Prepare assessments and cyber threat profiles of current events based on the sophisticated collection, research, and analysis of classified and open source information
Produces high-quality papers, presentations, recommendations, and findings for Senior Level Management and Enterprise Technology Leaders
Provides briefings and presentations to leadership supporting Information Security and Network Operations decision making
Provide situational awareness to executives and stakeholders of emerging threats and breaches in a timely fashion with appropriate guidance on impact to eBay, Inc.

To be successful in this position, you should be proficient with:
Communication – ability to articulate complex cyber threats to non-technical business partners. Proven competency in business writing and speaking for technical and executive audiences.
Teach – ability to train security concepts to other teams
Offensive Techniques – Penetration testing, IOCs, and exploits at all layers of the stack.
Logs Analysis - Comfortable with SEIM searching to gather and analyze logs to recreate incidents and hunt for threats.
System Forensics – Basic understanding of image acquisition techniques, memory forensics, and analysis
Networking Fundamentals - TCP/IP Protocols (HTTP, DNS, FTP, DHCP, ARP, etc.), and Wireshark/TCPDump.
Scripting – Should be familiar in scripting in at least one of the following: python, perl or a similar language.
Risk Analysis – Prior work experience analyzing threat and vulnerability data; classifying threats/vulnerabilities to determine severity and prioritize against existing system states, determining threats causing critical risk to business.

Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in Information Assurance, Information Security, Cyber Intelligence, or related field.
5+ years of experience in Cyber Threat Intelligence

Must have at least one (1) of the following certifications:
SANS GIAC: GCTI, ISC2: CISSP, NICCS: CCIP, EC Council: C|TIA

In addition, minimum of one (1) year of specialized experience in one or more of the following areas:
Security Assessment or Offensive Security
Application Security
Security Operations Center/Security Incident Response
Cyber intelligence Analysis

At eBay, your work makes a difference. We believe that we can build a better form of commerce that is enabled by people, supported by technology, and open to everyone – creating more opportunity for all.





This website uses cookies to enhance your experience. By continuing to browse the site, you agree to our use of cookies

View our privacy policy

View our accessibility info

eBay Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, and disability, or other legally protected status. If you are unable to submit an application because of incompatible assistive technology or a disability, please contact us at talent@ebay.com. We will make every effort to respond to your request for disability assistance as soon as possible.

title: Contract - Data Entry Analyst
description:
Enters data from a source document into a computer system. Verifies entries for accuracy and completeness. May convert data from one electronic system to another. Performs audits of own work or that of others to ensure conformance with established procedures. May work with stand alone data systems or enterprise wide tools supporting activities such as marketing lead tracking, fulfillment, manufacturing, and equipment maintenance or materials transactions.

Job Duties & Responsibilities:
Examines and audits data for discrepancies, corrects errors, and reconciles data to ensure accuracy at various stages of data processing.
Keeps track of received data and source documents.
Prepares and sorts source documents, and identifies and interprets data to be entered.
Contacts originators of source documents to resolve questions, inconsistencies, or missing data.
Compiles, sorts, and verifies accuracy of data to be entered.
Keeps record of work completed.
Reviews error reports and enters corrections into computer.
Transmits entered information into database.
Files or routes source documents after entry.
Provides routine office support such as making copies, faxing, answering phones, prepares correspondence for mailing, and delivering and picking up correspondence.
Education: High School graduate or equivalent.

Travel: 0-10%

Physical Demands: This is a typical office job, with no special physical requirements or unusual work environment.
#DICE

Itron is an Equal Opportunity, Affirmative Action Employer. Qualified applicants are considered without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, citizenship, sexual orientation, marital status, pregnancy, medical condition, veteran status, disability, genetic information, gender identity or other characteristics protected by law. If you require an accommodation in order to apply to this position, please contact your local recruiting representative at 1-800-635-5461 or email Accessibility@itron.com.

title: Data Analyst
description:
GreatSchools is the leading national nonprofit empowering parents to unlock educational opportunities for their child. We are looking for a Data Analyst to help us extract, transform and load educational data for display on our website. If you love working with data and want to use your talents to help tens of thousands of parents every day find the right school for their child then this position is for you.
This position reports to the Senior Director, Engineering. It is a full time, exempt position located in Oakland, CA. We are an equal opportunity employer and encourage diversity in our workplace — education is a universal concern and we need people from all backgrounds to help parents navigate their options.
Responsibilities
Key player in the data pipeline. Take raw data supplied by state DOEs, etc, and transform it for internal and external consumption.
Become proficient in our data schemas — where and how data is stored, and why. This includes starting to understand the complex interplay between data and web/feed code.
Gain an understanding of our data tools, pipelines and processes. Use this with support from Engineering to implement small-scale tool and process enhancements that support increased automation and quality control of data loading.
Perform thorough quality assurance analysis before and after loading data and participate in quality assurance on the work of other members of the data team.
Support Engineering in solving data architecture problems.
Support Data Science in implementing scalable processes e.g. creating new database infrastructure, writing scalable R code, etc.
Assist in size and difficulty assessment for acquired data loads.
Participate in code reviews.
Qualifications
Hands on experience with SQL.
Hands on experience with a programming/statistical computing language.
Ability to apply a detail-oriented, critical eye to data quality.
Able to prioritize work, manage multiple projects and work within tight deadlines.
Good communicator and strong contributor to team projects.
How to apply
Please submit a cover letter, including salary requirements, along with your résumé. Your cover letter should include reasons why you want to work at GreatSchools. Resumes without cover letters will not be considered. No phone calls, please.

title: Data Analyst
description:
Who we are

Fueled by a fundamental belief that having access to financial services creates opportunity, PayPal (NASDAQ: PYPL) is committed to democratizing financial services and empowering people and businesses to join and thrive in the global economy. Our open digital payments platform gives PayPal’s 254 million active account holders the confidence to connect and transact in new and powerful ways, whether they are online, on a mobile device, in an app, or in person. Through a combination of technological innovation and strategic partnerships, PayPal creates better ways to manage and move money, and offers choice and flexibility when sending payments, paying or getting paid. Available in more than 200 markets around the world, the PayPal platform, including Braintree, Venmo and Xoom, enables consumers and merchants to receive money in more than 100 currencies, withdraw funds in 56 currencies and hold balances in their PayPal accounts in 25 currencies.
When applying for a job you are required to create an account, if you have already created account - click Sign In.
Creating an account will allow you to follow the progress of your applications.

Note:
Provide full legal first Name/Family Name
DO: Capitalize first letter of First and Last Name. Example: John Smith
DON'T: Capitalize entire First and/or Last Name. Example: JOHN SMITH
NOTE: Use correct grammar for Names with multiple cases. Example: McDonald or O'Connell
Provide full address details
Resume is required
Multiple attachments can be uploaded including Resume and Cover Letter for each application


Job Description Summary:
Simility, a PayPal Service, is an end-to-end fraud management platform helping large merchants, banks, and other Fortune 1000 companies manage fraud and risk. Our systems helps enterprises detect fraudulent events real time and help protect these enterprises from online threats. We do so by creatively harnessing the power of data, machine learning and humans and be on the cutting edge of fraud detection techniques and algorithms. Simility welcomes big thinkers and passionate team players, who are ready to take their career to the next level.
Job Description:
Simility’s Data Analysts (DAs) are comprehensive product experts who collaborate with customers and internal teams to ensure that their customers are successful in their deployments. They continually build upon and apply their technical knowledge and skills across the product suite at every level of the customer engagement.
The successful DA will exhibit and build upon the deep expertise to ensure that they can not only have a successful deployment but an extremely satisfied customer. DA team members also spend their time working on projects that affect many parts of the organization, including process improvements, coding custom scripts, recommending tools, etc for the success of Simility .
Primary Responsibilities:
Help understand the main customer issues around fraud and compliance
Understand the nature of the data that is going to be provided and work with the customer to create and finalize a data schema that meets their needs
Perform univariate and bivariate analysis on data sets to detect anomalies and clean up
Help populate the tables with data and do data regressions to understand the key parameters that may be indicative of fraud
Further a naly s e data to identify fraud patterns and optimize the system to flag these patterns
Train the customer on using the Simility platform including the ability to write custom rules, triggers, etc.
Provide feedback from customers to the product development team in an effort to continually improve the product
Lead and participate in special projects/initiatives: innovate and implement large-scale quality improvements to processes and/or systems by conducting data analysis and making recommendations, troubleshooting technical issues, and refining processes around customer support

Subsidiary:
PayPal
Travel Percent:
0
Primary Location:
San Jose, California, United States of America


Additional Locations:






We're a purpose-driven company whose beliefs are the foundation for how we conduct business every day. We hold ourselves to our One Team Behaviors which demand that we hold the highest ethical standards, to empower an open and diverse workplace, and strive to treat everyone who is touched by our business with dignity and respect. Our employees challenge the status quo, ask questions, and find solutions. We want to break down barriers to financial empowerment. Join us as we change the way the world defines financial freedom.


Paypal provides equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. In addition, PayPal will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities.

title: Project Controls Analyst
description:
Job Description Summary


Job Description
BD is the #1 global leader in Medication Management and the $2.3B Medication Management Solutions Business Unit is headquartered in San Diego. This business unit focuses on delivering solutions that span from the hospital to the home. Major customers of MMS products include hospitals and pharmacies. Increasingly, ambulatory surgical centers, physicians’ offices, clinics and long-term care facilities will look to MMS solutions for needs that are unmet today.

Medication Management Solutions include Alaris® infusion technologies, as well as Pyxis® medication dispensing technologies with ADE surveillance system, Patient Event Advisor helps to reduce costs, improve care coordination and streamline medication use from our HealthSight™ integrated platform. Data can also be integrated from proprietary devices to help with efforts to protect medication types at all points of care.

Medication Management Solutions leverages Enterprise Software to allow healthcare providers to have access to better surveillance and analytics: The platform standardizes and simplifies systems and healthcare data across the enterprise to help improve decision making, efficiency and cost.

We are recruiting highly driven Project Controls Analysts with a desire to pursue a career in professional project management. Project Controls Analysts have accountability to work with Program Managers who are leading complex new product development projects to manage project cost and schedule, including budget, forecast, commitments, accruals, Work-In-Place, milestones, WBS, critical path, progress, risks, contingency, and KPI’s.

Depending on the skills and work experience of the candidate, the trajectory of the position can evolve into a project manager position. The Project Analyst Role is considering the starting position within BD’s professional program management career path.

Key Responsibilities:
Collaborate with program, portfolio and functional management teams to develop improve product development predictability
Manage project cost and schedule, including budget, forecast, commitments, accruals, Work-In-Place, milestones, WBS, progress, critical path, risks, contingency, and KPI’s
Work with Program and Functional Managers to forecast and reconcile resource and budget allocations for active development projects
Update and progress the project schedule while maintaining logic to the master control schedule
Coordinates and tracks multiple key projects and tasks.
Maintains resource loaded and fully linked project schedules that can be utilized to analyze resource allocations, completion dates and critical path
Manage the project change control process and maintain the schedule baseline and current budget to reflect approved changes
Provide monthly project status report (cost, schedule and risk mitigation)
Conduct accrual analysis and coordinate with payment processing teams to track the status of vendor payments
Execute the project completion close out process, including closing contracts, finalizing schedule, and reconciling schedule/cost performance against baseline
Ensure effective and efficient regular formal and informal communications with the Program and Portfolio Management and NPD Core Teams using a variety of tools and channels
Ensures compliance with the company's global innovation and product development processes

Minimum Qualifications:
Education and Experience:
Requires a Bachelor of Science degree in an engineering field with a minimum of 2–years relevant experience managing and analyzing cost and schedule for multi-project hardware and software product development core teams.
MBA with a strong focus on technology commercialization is a plus
Experience managing cross functional new product development core teams in Med Tech industries with capital hardware and IaaS / SaaS software solutions is preferred
Project Management Professional (PMP) certification a plus

Skills and Knowledge:
Minimum of 2 years’ experience developing, managing and analyzing cost and schedule on multi-project hardware and software product development core teams
Knowledge with Microsoft Project, Excel, PowerPoint and Planview
Experience communicating financial status and schedule details from multiple businesses to project managers
Demonstrated ability to successfully influence people and teams at all levels without direct authority
Proven success building employee engagement; creating, communicating and building understanding of a shared project vision
Highly motivated, dynamic and customer-centric individual who thrives in a challenging and changing environment
Demonstrated strategic agility with strong analytical decision-making skills
Sound business acumen and financial performance knowledge
Exceptional critical thinking and change management skills
Demonstrated prioritization and problem-solving skills.
Demonstrated ability to manage conflicts and ambiguity to drive clarity and deliver results.
Demonstrated results and solutions-orientation as achieved through optimized processes and execution.
Ability to champion and execute customer-centric approaches, ideas, methods, and processes.
Experience navigating self and teams in cross-functional environments and/or matrix organizations.
Requires polished presentation skills to executive leadership level - representing self and Portfolio Group with an executive presence.
Must possess exceptional written and oral communication skills.
Knowledge of and experience in structured product development processes.
Effective meeting management and group facilitation skills.

Demonstrates mastery of the following competency areas:
Innovative Ideas & Approaches - ability to generate novel ideas for defining, implementing and bringing to market new portfolio management solutions
Project & Cross-Functional Leadership - possesses the skills, knowledge and aptitude to engage, influence, and direct all functions involved in business case development
Optimized Execution and Performance - advances long-term growth while consistently meeting or exceeding near-term business performance expectations.
Personal Effectiveness - ability to work effectively within project teams and cross-functional organizations.
Commercial Excellence - ability to effectively apply business, financial and commercial knowledge to successfully support the delivery of our new product development investments.


#LI-TECH





Primary Work Location
USA CA - San Diego TC Bldg C&D

Additional Locations


Work Shift

title: Project Analyst
description:
Contract
Position: Project Analyst
Location: San Diego, California
Employee Type: Contract
Manages Others: Yes
Reports To: Project Manager
Overview
We are looking for a Project Analyst with life sciences industry experience to work with the Project Manager and client representatives on conducting research projects, preparing and revising project documents, reports and presentations, and performing analytical tasks to ensure that the projects are supporting client goals and objectives. Additionally, the Project Analyst will serve as the liaison between the Project Manager and stakeholders, gather, analyze and communicate requirements, as well as gather critical data and support the project team with budget tracking.
Responsibilities / Essential Functions
Create, manage and disburse project-related reports.
Maintain project assets, communications and related database(s)
Evaluate and monitor the overall project progress.
Review and report on the project’s budget and finances to key stakeholders.
Routinely perform complete or component analysis.
Notify the entire project team about abnormalities or variances.
Provide regular project updates, reports and presentations.
Analyze, manage and mitigate risks associated with the project.
Position Requirements
Bachelor of Science degree in Engineering or technical field.
PMP preferred, but not required.
Life science industry experience is preferred, but not required.
Understanding of risk management policies and procedures.
Experience of managing budgets for large projects.
Ability to effectively communicate using multiple forms of communication.
Strong interpersonal and communications skills, both verbal and written.
Ability to demonstrate initiative and assertiveness, the ability to plan and manage work in an efficient manner.
Ability to work well under stress and time pressures.
Ability to travel to other client sites, if necessary.
Ability to work on weekends, if necessary.
Job Type: Contract
Experience:
Budgeting: 3 years (Preferred)
Education:
Bachelor's (Preferred)
License:
PMP (Preferred)

title: Digital Marketing Analyst
description:
National Pen is looking for an enthusiastic and passionate Digital Marketing Analyst to accelerate the growth of our ecommerce business utilizing Google Analytics (GA 360). In this role, you’ll work closely with the Channel Managers to provide valuable insight into how we measure, analyze, and attribute our digital marketing efforts. You will be expected to cull actionable insights from the data and work with the business leaders to implement and monitor your suggestions. This is a direct hire position with Benefits, PTO, 401K plus much more!
Responsibilities
Create dashboards and ad hoc reports supporting your analysis using Google Data Studio
Monitor trends to identify funnel drop-off points using Custom GA Reports and Google Sheets
Work with Channel Managers to identify tracking opportunities on the website
Facilitate any changes to analytics tagging by working with front-end engineering team to test and deploy new tags
Track Assisted Conversions for Paid Media campaigns
Synthesize quantitative data (GA) with the qualitative data (Full Story) to identify areas of improvement
Monitor and analyze Lifetime Value of all digital campaigns using in-house reporting
Analyze Brand and Non Brand keyword performance for SEO
Ensure data integrity for the Web Analytics dataset
Qualifications
5+ years of experience in web analytics with ecommerce focus
5+ years of exposure to digital marketing efforts (including Paid Media, SEO, or Email Marketing)
Deep subject matter expertise with Google Analytics (and GA 360)
Thorough understanding of Google Tag Manager
Basic SQL knowledge
Strong mathematical and problem-solving skills
Comfortable working with Web Analytics data outside of the GA interface (using R or Python)
Familiarity with A/B testing tools, including Monetate
Proven ability to turn data into actionable recommendations to achieve business goals
Outstanding communication skills with both technical and non-technical colleagues

title: CRM Data Analyst
description:
About sweetgreen:
sweetgreen is on a mission to build healthier communities by connecting people to real food. We passionately believe that real food should be convenient and accessible to everyone. Every day in each sweetgreen, our 3,500 team members make food from scratch, using fresh ingredients and produce delivered that morning. And in our local communities, we're committed to leaving people better than we found them. We're in the business of feeding people, and we're out to change what that means.

We are building our data science team to deliver thoughtfully designed, data-driven customer experiences and first-class internal operations.

We are seeking a CRM Data Analyst to provide critical support to the quantitative marketing arm of the business as we undergo a wholesale digital transformation. The opportunity to facilitate a fast-growing company's consumption of internal and external data – all for the mission of feeding more people better food – should excite you. You will use your comprehensive analytical skillset to guide the CRM team in its consumption of quality data-driven insights, helping to deliver our strategic goals.

Responsibilities:
The CRM Data Analyst is responsible for providing data tools and analysis-based insight that drive the efficacy of our CRM team. From simple list pulls to predictive revenue attribution modeling, you will create data solutions that uncover actionable business insight and contribute a quantitative skillset to the foundation of our marketing efforts. This role is for you if you love collaboration, excel at end-to-end analysis, and have the business acumen and technical skills to make the two line up.

Wrangle data from disparate sources to develop in-depth understanding of our customers, identify areas of opportunity, and execute projects to produce increased customer loyalty
Provide internal stakeholders with data-driven stories of customers to drive strategic decision making
Work collaboratively across the company to build data tools (aggregated views, automated reports, ad hoc analyses, etc) that provide actionable insight
Help create a high-functioning and healthy data ecosystem
Demonstrate database technical proficiency in the areas of performance, reliability, and functionality
Develop data models for applications, metadata tables, views or related database structures
Collaborate with program manager, data platform engineers, analysts, leadership, and key stakeholders to understand business requirements
Desired Experience:
3+ years in quantitative analysis roles; experience with predictive modeling a plus
3+ years using statistical software (R, Python, SAS, etc)
3+ years Tableau experience
3+ years interacting with CRM/performance marketing teams
3+ years heavy use of SQL (Amazon Redshift a plus)
Ability to think strategically about business, product, and technical challenges
Interest and dedication to the healthy food revolution a huge plus
What you'll get:
Competitive pay + bonus plan granted based on performance
Health, dental + vision insurance
Flexible PTO, because we respect the need for work/life harmony
An opportunity to make a real impact on the people around you, both by growing them and by connecting them to real food
To live the sweetlife and celebrate your passion + purpose
A collaborative family of people who live our core values and have your back

title: Business Data Analyst
description:
The Business Data Analyst, assigned to a specific client, is responsible for the process of inspecting, cleaning, validating, transforming and modeling data with the goal of discovering useful information, suggesting conclusions and supporting decision making focused on growth. The Analyst is responsible for monitoring all-source of data information to proactively identify risks and threats that could impact the company people, assets and reputation.
DETAILS

title: Data Analyst, Marketing Ops
description:
About the Team:
You will be a key part of the joint Marketing+Technology team that is responsible for conceptualizing, designing and implementing the customer experience and marketing data innovations that drive Williams-Sonoma Inc.'s industry leading digital business. You'll be working with amazing peers, cutting edge technologies and deep resources to help push the boundaries of multi-channel retail innovation. Don't know whether you are a technologist or a marketer? Then you're a perfect fit for our team - we're both!
About the Role:
Work with the Customer Information Management and Brand teams to execute catalog and other direct-to-consumer, data-driven marketing programs, including targeted audience segment selection and file creation, campaign set-up, testing, and deployment.
You're excited about this opportunity because you will...
Manage WSI's overall catalog production process by overseeing and troubleshooting campaign set-up, maintaining and streamlining the production schedule, and executing campaign selections
Monitor, update, and publish the production schedule by keeping track of all upcoming due dates on the schedule and making sure all deliverables are on time
Use ETL Tools/SQL/Partner Tools to create the targeted audience segments and files for each campaign according to the brands' specifications
Manage pre-campaign planning between the Brand and Customer Information Management teams
Deliver accurate and timely list pulls for other digital marketing programs, including social media, display advertising, SEM, and more
Juggle multiple targeted audience segments and files at once by optimizing time management, planning, and organization
Translate business requests into database queries, using SQL to deliver counts and reports that help others within the company gain a better understanding of our customers
Analyze multiple data sources and databases to diagnose, troubleshoot, and improve various data issues
Research and understand data sources, meaning and importance
Perform and review daily data loading to and exporting from the Marketing customer database
Monitor the quality of data processes by building reports and performing checks of inputs and outputs
Manage invoice coding and tracking, prepare budget reconciliation quarterly summaries, and assemble next year's budget recommendations
Identify system/business process failures and dynamically develop short-term work-arounds and long-term solutions.
Use intellectual creativity to solve system and business problems or improve inefficiencies
Why you will love working at Williams-Sonoma, Inc.
We're a successful, fast-growing company with an entrepreneurial vibe
A technologically and data-driven business
Competitive salaries and comprehensive health benefits
We're at the forefront of tech and retail, redefining technology for the next generation
We're passionate about our internal and external clients and live/breathe the client experience
We get to be creative on a daily basis
A smart, experienced leadership team that wants to do it right and is open to new ideas
We believe in autonomy and reward taking initiative
We have fun!

We're excited about you because you have...
Bachelor's Degree, preferably in STEM major
Excellent analytical skills
Technical skills and experience
Microsoft Office, especially Excel formula and Pivot table experience
At least 1 year experience with SQL
Motivation and aptitude for learning new skills quickly
Desire to work on both technical and non-technical projects
Ability to manage many different kinds of work
Excellent organizational, planning, and prioritization skills
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Ability to optimize time management in order to meet all deadlines
Enjoying working in a team environment
Flexibility and willingness to help others whenever possible
Experience with marketing campaign management and related tools, such as Unica/Epiphany a plus
Experience with Unix, Ab Initio or Informatica ETL is a plus
About Williams-Sonoma, Inc.
Founded in 1956, Williams-Sonoma, Inc. is the premier specialty retailer of high-quality products for the kitchen and home in the United States. Our family of brands are Williams-Sonoma, Pottery Barn, Pottery Barn Kids, PBteen, West Elm, Williams-Sonoma Home, Rejuvenation, and Mark and Graham. These brands are among the best known and most respected in the industry. We offer beautifully-designed, stylish and functional products for every area of the home, including the kitchen, living room, bedroom, home office, closet, laundry room and even outdoor spaces. We've seen some big changes since our first brick-and-mortar store opened more than half of a century ago. What hasn't changed is our passion for high-quality products, functional design, outstanding customer service, and enhancing the lives of our customers and the communities where we operate. Today, we're a multi-brand, multi-channel, global enterprise supported by state-of-the-art technology and some of the most talented teams in retailing - and we're always looking for new energy and ideas.
Benefits:
Once you are here, you can look forward to a wide variety of benefits. Our corporate vision-to enhance our customers' quality of life at home-extends to the lives of our associates. To that end, we offer an extensive benefits package designed to help you grow, personally and professionally, to keep you healthy, to prepare you for the unexpected, to care for your family and to build a secure future. Depending on your position and your location, here's a look at what you might be eligible for:
A generous discount on all Williams Sonoma Inc. brands through multiple shopping channels
A 401(k) plan and other investment opportunities
Paid vacations, holidays and other time-off programs
Health benefits, including health, dental and vision insurance; health and dependent care tax-free spending accounts; medical, family and bereavement leave; same-sex domestic partner benefits; short- and long-term disability programs; life and travel insurance; an employee assistance program
Tax-free commuter benefits
A wellness program that supports your physical, financial and emotional health
In-person and online learning opportunities through WSI University, LearnIt and AcademyX
Cross-brand and cross-function career opportunities
Quarterly sample sales
A business casual work environment
A bike share program
Time off to volunteer
Matching donations to qualifying nonprofit organizations
Company-sponsored walks and runs
Healthy, organic options in the cafeteria and an awesome salad bar
Discounts on nearby gyms and other local businesses
This role is not eligible for Visa sponsorship or relocation assistance. Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.
LI-JC1

title: Project Analyst
description:
Contract
Position: Project Analyst
Location: San Diego, California
Employee Type: Contract
Manages Others: Yes
Reports To: Project Manager
Overview
We are looking for a Project Analyst with life sciences industry experience to work with the Project Manager and client representatives on conducting research projects, preparing and revising project documents, reports and presentations, and performing analytical tasks to ensure that the projects are supporting client goals and objectives. Additionally, the Project Analyst will serve as the liaison between the Project Manager and stakeholders, gather, analyze and communicate requirements, as well as gather critical data and support the project team with budget tracking.
Responsibilities / Essential Functions
Create, manage and disburse project-related reports.
Maintain project assets, communications and related database(s)
Evaluate and monitor the overall project progress.
Review and report on the project’s budget and finances to key stakeholders.
Routinely perform complete or component analysis.
Notify the entire project team about abnormalities or variances.
Provide regular project updates, reports and presentations.
Analyze, manage and mitigate risks associated with the project.
Position Requirements
Bachelor of Science degree in Engineering or technical field.
PMP preferred, but not required.
Life science industry experience is preferred, but not required.
Understanding of risk management policies and procedures.
Experience of managing budgets for large projects.
Ability to effectively communicate using multiple forms of communication.
Strong interpersonal and communications skills, both verbal and written.
Ability to demonstrate initiative and assertiveness, the ability to plan and manage work in an efficient manner.
Ability to work well under stress and time pressures.
Ability to travel to other client sites, if necessary.
Ability to work on weekends, if necessary.
Job Type: Contract
Experience:
Budgeting: 3 years (Preferred)
Education:
Bachelor's (Preferred)
License:
PMP (Preferred)

title: Data Analyst I (Temp)
description:
Temporary
The Data Analyst I position is responsible for gathering and integrating multiple data sets to generate accurate sales reports to business units and executives in a timely manner. Qualified candidates will be self-motivated, detail oriented, dependable and effectively manage your time.
Role and Responsibilities

Works under immediate supervision

Temporary Position:
Location: Fremont

title: Data Analyst (Product)
description:
Hinge Health’s mission is to improve the lives of people suffering from chronic conditions by digitizing the delivery of care - starting with musculoskeletal health. We’re already achieving remarkable outcomes - helping people overcome chronic pain, avoid surgeries, return to work, and get back to doing the things they love. We’re now rapidly signing large enterprise customers.

You’ll play a key role in analyzing data generated by our users and providing insights for both internal teams (clinical, client success, finance, and operations) and our enterprise customers.

We’re firm believers in growth and career development. You’ll own your role, be part of the decision-making process and manage your own time.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Spearheading analysis and reporting with SQL/Python, reports, and dashboards. Setting definitions, writing queries, and working across departments to standardize how our company runs business and product analysis
REQUIREMENTS
Experience in analytics a must, with a focus on internal operational reporting (KPIs) and analysis cross-functionally
Adept at working with our data engineers to set company-wide standards for our datasets, helping create a single source of truth for all analytics
Can take an analysis all the way from a stakeholder request, to an ad hoc query, to a high-caliber dashboard in hours
Strong communication skills and patience when working with multiple stakeholders simultaneously
SQL experience required; Python a nice-to-have
Prior experience with BI/visualization tools (Tableau, Mode Analytics, Domo, etc.) a must
A high attention to detail and the ability to QA data at a glance or in depth
Ability to work autonomously and with minimal guidance
BENEFITS
Competitive salary
Meaningful stock options (We want everyone to feel like a real owner)Medical, dental, vision, 401K
Flexible vacation policy
Lunch & snacks
Company outings (hikes, running, climbing events, and more)
Opportunity to join a fantastically talented, diverse, and passionate team that’s working on a meaningful problem
We’re firm believers in “Learn-it-all” versus “Know-it-all.” To that end, we are looking for a candidate with an open mind and willingness to hustle to drive success at Hinge Health. If you're interested - we'd love to hear from you. No recruiters, please.

title: Data Analyst - Sports Media
description:
$80,000 - $120,000 a year
Data Analyst - Sports Media
San Francisco Bay Area
$80,000-120,000

The Company:
Harnham has recently partnered with a rapidly growing Sports Media company. This San Francisco based company is scaling massively and they are looking to build out a robust analytics team to utilize data to optimize article performance. As a leader in the Sports Media industry, you will have the rare opportunity to combine your passion for analytics and sports!

About This Job:
They are building out their analytics function and are looking for an experienced analyst to join their team and work closely alongside some of the leading editors and writers in the sports media industry. Essentially this person will be tasked with analyzing the content performance across different sports articles and drive strategy to increase engagement.


Responsibilities:
Expert level SQL skills with some exposure to R or Python
Exposure analyzing content, campaign, media analytics in a previous role is a must
Examples of results and impact driven by your analysis regarding guiding high level decision making
Excellent communication skills and ability to work with stakeholders across different teams such as Growth, Product, and Marketing
