title: Data Analyst
description:
About Singular
Singular is a marketing intelligence platform that unifies marketing analytics, giving marketers actionable insights from previously siloed data. By connecting upper funnel marketing data with lower-funnel attribution data, marketers can measure ROI from every touchpoint across multiple channels and optimize spend down to the most granular levels. Singular currently tracks over $10 billion in digital marketing spend to revenue and lifetime value across industries including commerce, travel, gaming, entertainment, media, and on-demand services. Singular customers include companies like Lyft, Yelp, Airbnb, LinkedIn, Symantec, Zynga, Match, and Twitter. Singular is backed by Norwest Venture Partners, General Catalyst, Thomvest Ventures, Method Capital, Translink Capital, DCM and Telstra Ventures. Visit www.singular.net to learn more.
Singular is seeking a data analyst to help us drive the way we use data and the insights we get from it as we grow. You’ll drive insights for internal business units, thought leadership posts and publications and drive data adoption throughout Singular.
About the job
You’ll be working with our marketing and other business teams to help them analyze our data, get a clear picture of our business, and generate ground breaking insights based on our wide customer data. You’ll turn questions into answers by exploring our data, building models, and crafting visualizations to identify and interpret patterns, trends, and anomalies.
In this role you will:
Work closely with business owners and writers to understand their analytics needs, gaps and goals to answer them with data-driven insights.
Connect data sources together as a basis for analytics, work with engineering teams to get access to the relevant data and understand it.
Analyze data through code, queries and BI platforms to provide data driven insights and visualizations needed by the various business teams.
Expand our BI platforms to be more relevant for different teams for daily use.
Drive adoption of data ownership and use on ongoing basis throughout the company, help more people gain the tools needed to get answers to ongoing questions by themselves.
Collaborate with other data analysts to drive data-driven culture in the company.
About you
You’re analytical, collaborative, and passionate about data. You thrive in fast paced environments and communicate cross-functionally with ease. You have experience extracting insights from massive datasets in order to tell a story and helping others, technology and business people alike to utilize data and BI on daily basis. Ideally, you have a background in adtech, martech, marketing analytics, customer journey or SaaS systems. Above all else, you take pride in deriving insights that will ultimately influence the digital marketing industry.
In addition, you have the following experience:
3+ years in data analyst role, having hands on experience with accessing SQL and non-SQL databases, researching business needs, writing queries, analysing data and providing insights and visualizations
2+ years hands on experience with Python or other programming language for data analytics tasks, able to build ETL layers on top of different data sources
1+ years of hands on experience data modeling and reporting using a modern BI/analytics/visualization platforms such as Tableau, Looker, PowerBI, etc; Ideally experience with owning and managing a modern BI platform
Strong team and personal skills, ability to enthusiast and drive data adoption across organizations, understand business needs and generate insights from data
Proficient in Excel
Singular Labs Inc. is committed to equal employment opportunity. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment, and will not be discriminated against in employment, regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, veteran status, or any other protected category. We also consider qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records, consistent with legal requirements. Singular is committed to providing an accessible environment for all candidates and employees. Please let us know of you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation to apply for a job with Singular or participate in the application process.

title: SENIOR DATA SCIENTIST - NLP
description:
$140,000 - $160,000 a year
SENIOR DATA SCIENTIST - NLP
Senior Data Scientist - NLP
San Diego $140,000 - $160,000 + Benefits

THE COMPANY
This tech start-up focusing on using AI to offer a more personalized solution to health care providers all over the world is looking for a senior data scientist to join their mission! You can expect a bright supporting team bringing their innovative ideas utilizing technology to solve the problems in the health care space.

THE ROLE
As a Senior Data Scientist - NLP you will
Lead advanced machine learning and deep learning models through development and deployment
Work with a variety of text analytics - text mining, NLP, word embedding, etc.
Work cross functionally with multiple teams and communicate technical results to customers and stakeholders

YOUR SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE
Advanced education in a quantitative field
Multiple years of relevant professional work experience
Extensive knowledge and commercial experience with advanced machine learning algorithms - clustering, forecasting, text analytics, image processing, classification
Tools: Python or R, SAS or SPSS, SQL, AWS, tensorflow, pytorch, keras, NLP toolkits (NLTK, SpaCy, etc.)
THE BENEFITS
As a Senior Data Scientist, you can expect a base salary between $140,000 to $160,000 (based on experience) plus competitive benefits.

title: Data Analyst
Data Scientist
description:
Witte Construction Inc looking for entry level and senior level data scientists to join our Data Science team. Applicants should be smart, curious, and interested in finding data-driven, evidence-based answers to hard problems. You will work side-by-side with our team of data scientists, account staff, and analysts

Responsibilities
Partner with analytics team to deliver data-driven answers to clients' complex business questions
Collaborate and communicate effectively with stakeholders from teams in data sciences, analytics, account managers, and creative
Compose the right research plan for the project
Assist in executing the plan by pulling data, applying algorithms, etc.
Craft the narrative to explain the results to internal and client stakeholders
Develop new models, algorithms, and data sets to answer clients' business questions better
Discover new patterns in available data
Develop prototypes of new products and solutions
Assemble new data sets
Support the software team in growing and maintaining data and tools platform
Mentor analysts and other staff to use platform most effectively
Drive integration of new data, algorithms, and prototypes into the tools
Requirements, Skills & Experience
A Bachelors, Masters or Doctoral degree in Computer Science, Computational Linguistics, Engineering, Statistics, Machine Learning, or Natural Sciences
A naturally curious disposition
A knack for explaining complex concepts in simple terms
A proven ability to design research methodologies to answer questions with data
Experience using Python, R, Java, or "big data" tools (like Hive, Pig, Spark, etc.) to perform research methodologies on data
Experience interpreting structured and unstructured experimental results data
Project experience in machine learning, computational linguistics, data modeling, data collection, or knowledge engineering

NO CALLS PLEASE!! WE WILL CONTACT YOU AFTER REVIEWING YOUR RESUME.

title: Data Analyst
description:
Callisto Media was inspired by a single, transformational idea: harness the power of big data to produce timely content that enables consumers to lead richer, healthier, more fulfilled lives.

With deep roots in technology and publishing, Callisto Media harnesses the disruptive power of Big Data, creating unparalleled insights into consumer demand and the science of content. Our titles uniquely serve the needs of the reader, enjoy consistent profitability, and delve into the long tail of opportunity.

We have an enterprising, collaborative culture and are backed by leading Silicon Valley venture capitalists. We use proprietary technology to identify and meet consumer demand by delivering timely content in sync with the market. We’re an intellectually curious team made up of driven analysts, editors, designers, marketers, and engineers based in the Bay Area and New York City who are aggressively expanding the breadth and depth of our portfolio in cooking, specialty diet, health and wellness, mind, body and spirit, parenting, kids, business and more.

This person will perform production-facing tasks to support the Editorial and Design departments. They will support the Engineering team in designing and developing new tools to help analyze data related to title production and marketing. They will also perform analyses for other departments as needed, including Marketing, Finance, and Sales.

Required Skills and Abilities
Use tools and processes designed by the R&D team to identify title opportunities
Understand our editorial process and how data can be used to support editorial decisions
Provide additional information and analysis to the Editorial team as needed to help with title production
Generate reports and analyses to convey information about titles to downstream departments
Understand how to use Callisto’s internal tools and systems to collect and analyze data
Conduct ad-hoc analyses for other departments as needed to help answer questions related to production and marketing

Required Experience
Bachelor’s degree or higher in a relevant discipline
1+ Years of experience in a Data Analyst or similar role
Hands-on experience with MS Office suite
Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously with minimal supervision
Experience in Evolutionary and/or Agile development preferred
Proven experience solving complex business issues through data-related research methods and tools
Strong communication skills, particularly with internal clients and managers
Ability to take initiative and work with a high level of independence
Join us! We are a team where data drives our decisions. Where culture matters. We put our customers first and they embody our core values. We’re entrepreneurial and focused in our approach. We challenge each employee to experiment and drive results while feeling empowered to do their best work each and every day.

Callisto Media offers a competitive salary, full benefits, 401k, stock options, for full-time employees, as well as a friendly working environment. This is a full-time, onsite position.

title: Data Research Analyst
description:
$48,522 - $77,635 a year
The SANDAG Data Solutions Program

The Data, Analytics, and Modeling department provides SANDAG member agencies, elected officials, other organizations, and the public with information and technical resources for regional planning, funding, and policymaking efforts. The department represents a broad range of expertise from land use and transportation modeling, programming and website development, applied social research, public safety, demographics, and economics. The information the department gathers, analyzes, produces, delivers, and maintains is essential to the success of SANDAG.

The Data Solutions team administers the data centers that support the agency’s modeling, forecasting, analysis, mapping, and visualization tools. These data centers include a wide range of spatial and non-spatial data acquired and maintained by a team of highly skilled professionals responsible for the development and delivery of the SANDAG activity-based transportation model, economic and demographic estimates and forecasts, geographic information systems, and criminal justice research.

Research Analyst Role

The Research Analyst will coordinate the acquisition and procurement of demographic, economic, and transportation data, as well as geographic information system (GIS) data to support numerous modeling, forecasting, analysis, visualization, and Web applications. The position also will document data standards and processes, develop metadata and data citations, and monitor data and analysis requests.

This is a Limited-Term employment opportunity and is expected to be funded through June 30, 2020. Limited-Term employees are “at-will” and receive many of the benefits of Regular employees.

Job Responsibilities

This opportunity is ideal for an individual who has an interest in furthering their expertise in the acquisition and management of data. We anticipate significant career development will occur while working on the types of duties and responsibilities described below and through mentoring and close collaboration with senior staff. Examples of primary responsibilities include:

Support the development and implementation of the Data Acquisition and Management Strategic Plan (DAMSP); participate in the development and implementation of new procedures and process improvements for standards-based documentation and metadata.
Collaborate with staff to determine data needs; research and analyze new and existing data sources; coordinate with department teams, technology staff, and external vendors to accurately gather and interpret requirements and specifications to determine appropriate data solutions; coordinate the timely and secure acquisition, integration, and exchange of data.
Provide project management support for various DAMSP projects and programs; prepare scopes of work and technical specifications; assist with the development and monitoring of project plans, schedules, and budgets for various projects and programs.
Liaise with the agency’s Contracts and Procurement department to monitor contract status and expiration dates; participate in the preparation of contract amendments and task orders; assist with developing and maintaining a procurement plan and schedule for upcoming procurements; review and process consultant and vendor invoices.
Monitor and support data requests from employees, various jurisdictions, and other customers; coordinate and ensure accurate data request information recorded; monitor the status of requests.
Support quality assurance testing and analysis of regional data; identify and report data anomalies, patterns, relationships, and support the resolution to issues; participate in evaluating data for accuracy and completeness.
Support the overall data architecture; monitor the Extract, Transform, and Load (ETL) processes; participate in the development and documentation of best practices for ETL-related activities including data movement, data aggregation, data quality, and data cleansing.
Monitor automated and manual data integration and ETL jobs to verify execution and measure performance; develop reports used to audit, monitor, and validate data jobs.
Support the development of a department-wide information resource for metadata standards to include identification and retrieval, document data relationships, file and rights management, and preservation.

Experience and Qualifications

Numerous factors contribute to an individual’s ability to be successful in any given role. For this position, we are searching for a candidate with superior organization skills, a technical background, and an aptitude for analytical thinking and problem solving who is responsible and detail-oriented, demonstrates initiative, and is committed to providing professional, prompt, and accurate services while meeting numerous time-sensitive deadlines. Excellent communication skills, flexibility, and the ability to work collaboratively using sound judgment are important attributes for this position.

The minimum education, training, and experience qualifications include a bachelor’s degree with major course work in computer or information science, geography, statistics, engineering, mathematics, or a related field, and one to four years of recent experience coordinating projects with data acquisition, storage, and reporting elements, or contracts and procurement administration.

The following information describes the specific types of career experiences that are most relevant to this position.

Knowledge of best practices regarding systems, methodologies, and procedures for acquiring, organizing, maintaining, and archiving data.
Experience with information or content management; knowledge of current technologies and standards such as repositories, encoding standards, and metadata standards.
Knowledge of basic database theory, design rules, and development practices; experience with data migration, analysis, data architecture, and data integration techniques; ability to accurately compile data for large databases.
Knowledge of quality assurance and quality control practices used for validating data and ensuring data integrity, including statistical analysis and sampling techniques.
Experience supporting the development, implementation, and maintenance of testing systems, transparent practices, and tools that align with business requirements and audit standards.
Experience coordinating, tracking, and monitoring a large volume of data requests; experience ensuring requests are processed in a timely manner; experience providing technical guidance and assistance to customers regarding services and procedures.
Experience participating in multi-disciplinary project teams to coordinate tasks and accomplish goals.
Experience with project coordination including supporting the preparation of budgets and schedules, resource requirements and timelines, quality control and change control mechanisms, and risk assessments.
Ability to research and analyze business issues, evaluate alternative solutions, develop sound conclusions, prepare recommendations, and keep management apprised of issues and concerns.
Experience participating in the development of RFPs, scopes of work, project deliverables, budgets, schedules, technical specifications, and contract amendments; experience with contract monitoring, administration, and reviewing and preparing invoices for payment.
Excellent customer service skills; demonstrated ability to establish, maintain, and foster cooperative working relationships; ability to maintain composure and a professional attitude when working under tight deadlines and with frequent interruptions.
Exceptional time management and organizational skills and the ability to coordinate several concurrent projects at various stages of completion in a fast-paced environment; ability to adapt to changing priorities, exercise good judgment, maintain confidentiality, and work independently.
Strong written and oral communication skills, including the ability to identify user needs, respond to requests for information, and effectively communicate technical information to non-technical users.
Experience preparing project reports, technical documentation, and written, oral, and visual reports and recommendations.
Strong computer skills and proficiency with the Windows operating system and Microsoft Office applications especially Excel; familiarity with SQL Server or other relational database management system.
The selected candidate can anticipate a driving record check upon hire, and approximately annually thereafter. The results of the check may determine whether the selected candidate will be permitted to drive for SANDAG business.

Salary and Benefits

SANDAG rewards the efforts of its employees with a comprehensive compensation package. Competitive salaries are supplemented with a flexible offering of health, financial security, and time-off benefits to meet the work and life needs of employees and their families.

The Limited-Term Research Analyst position will be filled at the I, II, or Associate level depending on qualifications and experience of the selected candidate. The annual salary ranges are: Research Analyst I - $48,522 to $77,635 per year; Research Analyst II - $53,496 to $85,593 per year; Associate Research Analyst - $58,979 to $94,366.

The benefits we offer include traditional health, dental, and vision insurance as well as employee assistance, wellness, and work/life balance programs. To support the need to rest and rejuvenate, employees are provided with a bank of paid time off in addition to paid holidays. And contributions to financial security are provided through a pension plan and deferred compensation program.

How to Apply

We encourage all interested candidates to apply for this position by completing a SANDAG Employment Application form. Resumes, cover letters, and work samples may be submitted in addition to the Employment Application but are not a substitute for this document.

The Employment Application can be downloaded in PDF format from the SANDAG website. Alternatively, a copy can be requested by calling (619) 699-1900 or emailing hr@sandag.org.

Completed applications and related materials can be submitted via email, fax, regular mail, courier, or delivered by hand. See our Careers / How to Apply webpage for additional information.

This position is Open until Filled. The first review of applications for this position will begin on Friday, October 19, 2018.

In compliance with the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA), SANDAG will accommodate persons who require assistance in order to apply for a position at SANDAG. Applicants requiring an accommodation due to a disability during any stage of the recruitment and selection process, including requesting this document and related application materials in an alternative format, should make their needs known by contacting Human Resources at (619) 699-1900, (619) 699-1904 (TTY), fax (619) 699-6905, or hr@sandag.org.

Application Supplement

To help us further evaluate the skills and experience of individuals interested in this position, applicants are asked to respond to the two Supplemental Questions below. The information can be up to 500 words per question and should be submitted with the Employment Application. This is considered a required component of the application; applications received without a response will be screened out of the selection process.

Supplemental Questions

Describe why this position is of interest to you.
Describe the techniques you use to maintain high levels of service while responding to multiple, competing priorities.

Candidate Selection and Notification

Following the first review date for applications, candidates will receive written confirmation that their application has been received. The hiring manager will begin reviewing and evaluating applications within a few days of the first review date. Based on this evaluation, the best qualified candidates will be invited to continue in the selection process. All candidates will receive written notification as to the outcome of their application.

Further Information

The SANDAG website contains a wealth of information about our various project and program areas. The Careers section of the site lists all of our current Job Openings as well as information on how to apply for positions and Frequently Asked Questions about our recruitment program.

In compliance with the Immigration Reform and Control Act of 1986, applicants hired by SANDAG must show acceptable proof of identity and evidence of authorization to work in the United States.

SANDAG is an Equal Opportunity Employer

title: Data Analyst
description:
Do you believe that people with compassion will support one another to create a better world? Well, we do! GoFundMe is the largest social fundraising community in the world and is just getting started.

GoFundMe is the most popular personal fundraising site in the world. Over $5 Billion has been raised by our users for their personal causes - making GoFundMe a Top 200 Website in the USA based on traffic with a monthly audience of over 100M people. Data is at the center of all decisions and strategy at GoFundMe. The mission of the Data Analyst is to provide data insights that enable data-driven business decisions and actions that drive business growth to help build a global culture of peer-to-peer giving.

GoFundme is the leader in the personal crowdfunding market. The Data Analyst will be a key part of the growing Data team to help derive data insights from web, marketing, product and user behavior data. This role requires experience in a wide variety of business areas and datasets to gather data from disparate sources, perform analysis, build models and present recommendations. If you are interested in working in a fast paced environment and like being challenged with fun data problems to solve, come join us.

The Job...

Perform strategic and operational data analysis for all internal teams (marketing, product, engineering, customer service, trust & safety and finance)
Monitor all KPIs and present emerging trends and actionable insights to leadership team
Develop dashboards and perform ad hoc analysis
Ensure data quality by testing tables, dashboards, models and analysis
Measure and analyze A/B test results for product and marketing optimizations
Launch surveys and polls to collect and provide customer insights
Build forecasting and ROI models to project growth for various initiatives to assist with roadmap prioritization
Learn and assist data engineers with data transformations and ETL projects
You...

3+ years experience in data/business analytics using web, marketing, product and user behavior data
Thorough knowledge of statistics applied to business analytics (forecasting, segmentation, A/B testing, predictive modeling, etc.)
Strong visualization skills and experience with BI tools (Tableau/Looker)
Proficient in SQL and Python
Strong presentation skills, being able to author and present insights to the leadership team
Knowledge of data tracking, database architecture, ETL/data preparation tools, APIs, data science and machine learning technologies a plus
Bachelor's degree in a quantitative field (Mathematics, Physics, Economics, Engineering or related areas)
Why you'll love it here...

Your work has real purpose and will be helping to change lives. Really.
We're a fun, close team of people with a work-hard, play-hard mentality.
Our Gives Back program allows employees to nominate one campaign each week to receive a donation of up to $1,000.
We have a fully stocked kitchen and "MegaFridge".
We're happy to pay for superb talent, offer full benefits and issue bonuses.
We're growing fast! We've got some incredible opportunities ahead.
More about GoFundMe…

GoFundMe is changing the way the world gives. Every day friends, family, and members of the community come together to support one another and the causes they care about most. Our campaigners have raised over $5 billion for medical expenses, education, community projects, sports, emergencies, pets and other personal causes and life events--making us the world's largest crowdfunding platform.

GoFundMe has assembled one of the best teams to go build the next leading consumer Internet company - including leaders from LinkedIn, Intuit, Groupon, YouTube, Facebook, Twitter, GoPro, Uber, and several others. We are also funded by some of Silicon Valley's best venture capital firms, including Accel, Greylock, TCV, and others.

title: Data Analyst
description:
We are looking to hire an Engineering Data Analyst to drive a multitude of organizational and reporting improvements to the Engineering departments by performing trend analysis within the department as well as within the company. Performs detailed analysis to provide data for business planning. Helps determine present and future project status. Gathers, analyzes, prepares and summarizes data to develop and support recommendations for project status, evaluating future requirements, and operating forecasts. Uses predictive modeling, statistics, trend analysis, and other data analysis techniques to collect, explore and identify the right data to support engineering and certification for In-Flight Entertainment (IFE) systems. Preparing/providing/ coordinating technical documentation.


MAJOR RESPONSIBILITIES WILL INCLUDE:

Database Consolidation and Organization
Obtain and consolidate information from different groups into one central database for real time project management of engineering platform feature deliverables.
Reporting and managing projects
Utilize project database to track and report project status.
Maintain project schedule database for various technical data deliverables.
Provide trend analysis and data pattern on engineering performance and on-time delivery dates
Gathering and managing technical input from various teams
Maintain department intranet website used for form creation and technical reporting for Mechanical and Certification groups.
Provide status to project management and program management on engineering and certification department
Will support task assignments, scheduling (using MS Project) and negotiation with Project and Program Management for document delivery dates
Suggest and lead process improvement activities for the department

Data Reporting
Prepare technical documentation and release reports.
Support the tech data manager by data consolidation from different sources, and help preparing charts and reports to department manager, certification project engineer, and engineer leads. Monitor and collect data for all related documentation [drawings, test plans, Document Change Requests (DCRs), Document Change Notice (DCNs), Engineering Change Order (ECOs), and Notice of Change (NOCs)]. If necessary, develop method of collecting data and tracking document flow.
Maintain the selection and ordering of parts, materials and vendor relations with Procurement, Mechanical Engineering, Manufacturing, Obsolescence, Product Planning and Material Planning departments.
Recommendations & Forecasting/Planning
Support monthly status on KPI within the department as well as within the company
Recommends and supports the development and documentation of improved business operations processes with emphasis on automation and global coordination.
Monitor and report on test cost, test sample cost and test unit cost.
Drive process improvements by keeping track in-house or out-sourcing, especially for structural, and flammability testing.
Provides recommendations on how to modify spending.



KNOWLEDGE/SKILL REQUIREMENTS:
Proficiency in MS Excel, SharePoint, SQL, VB, and/or Oracle required. Familiar with Agile PLM is a plus
Programming in HTML and Adobe Flash player experience a big plus.
Ability to study and understand detailed mechanical drawings and exploded views.
Familiar with DO-160, FAR25, Boeing, Airbus certification and Airworthiness requirements pertaining to Flammability, Structural, Qualification Basis, Smoke and Toxicity is nice to have.
Ability to analyze problems using conventional (analysis) and computerized techniques.
Proven ability in developing and automating procedures.
Ability to integrate information from more than one discipline (ME, EE, EMI, Product Planning & Manufacturing Engineering) to achieve results or successfully complete difficult and challenging assignments within a specialized field.
Ability work on problems of diverse to complex scope where analysis of data requires evaluation of variable factors.

EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS:
BA in Management Information Systems, or equivalent. Masters preferred.
5 years of experience in an operations and information systems management role
IFE experience preferred.

OTHER REQUIREMENTS:
Ability to travel to other domestic and international locations approximately 20% of the time.



About PAC:
Who We Are: Panasonic Avionics takes entertainment to new heights. We’re the world’s leading supplier of (IFEC) inflight entertainment and communications systems that allow airborne passengers to get their fix of live TV, movies, music, interactive games, maps, and much more! We make traveling on airplanes more exciting!

What We Value:
As an organization, we value people who are motivated and driven. We value a collaborative work environment that enhances careers and positively impacts society. We value our diverse work culture committed to delivering products and achieving high results. Seeing our products bring delight to others is just one way we measure success.

Why You Should Join:
A job is only part of what we offer. See how you can flourish in a career while getting the support and resources from some of the most talented people in the industry. You will work on technology that makes traveling the world that much better. Lastly, you will be rewarded with world class benefits and competitive wages. Come aboard, we’ve been expecting you!
#LI-POST

title: Data Analyst
description:
Common Sense (https://www.commonsensemedia.org/) is the nation's leading independent nonprofit organization devoted to helping kids and families thrive in a world of media and technology.
Every day, millions of families turn to Common Sense for trusted advice and unbiased ratings. We offer the largest library of independent age-based and educational ratings and reviews for everything your kids want to watch, play, read, and learn. Our movie and TV ratings are available on Comcast, DirecTV, Netflix, and many other partner networks, helping families and kids make smart media choices. Through our schools program, we provide educators with a curriculum that teaches the essential digital citizenship and literacy skills every student needs to succeed. More than 600,000 registered educators and 55,000 schools use our ratings and curriculum and content. We also work with policymakers, industry leaders, legislators, and a grassroots community of concerned parents and teachers to improve the media, tech, and education landscape for kids, families, and schools.
Common Sense Media is actively looking for a self-motivated, mission-driven data analyst/scientist to join our team. The data analyst/scientist will work alongside marketing, product and engineering, development, and other departments to set up and deliver advanced analytics and data-driven insights to stakeholders. The main work tool will be Looker; we need someone who can work with the business users/analyst types in different departments, helping them understand and deliver the dashboards and queries that inform their decisions.
Your primary task will be to help increase membership and donations to the organization. You will help test different approaches, messages, and benefits as we come up with the most successful offering to either pursue a paid membership, membership-plus-voluntary-donation, or similar offering to make this an important revenue source for the organization. Experience in driving membership and conversion around membership in previous positions in a plus.
The data analyst/scientist will be supported by a devops engineer who will set up and manage the central data repository, a UX expert who will help define the user needs, a technical project manager, a Salesforce administrator who manages that platform, and other staff members who will help them work with the rest of the organization. The position will report to the CTO/head of product and work closely with marketing. Initially, you will be a one-person team, with a lot of support, but expected to be a leader and evangelist.
The first months will be spent setting up the tool and helping to educate and train various members across departments in using Looker and, over a longer period, training them in becoming as self-sufficient as possible in using the tool.
Essential Duties:
Help train stakeholders and business analysts in other departments in defining and using Looker to think analytically about asking questions; solving their problems; and meeting KPIs with the primary focus on membership growth.
Write the SQL queries and, where needed, LookML code to define dashboards and analytic frameworks within Looker, combining data from multiple sources, including Drupal SQL databases, Google Analytics, and Salesforce.
Evangelize within the organization about the use of data to inform decisions and formulate questions in a way that data can be used to help find the answers and increase membership, donations, or some combination of the two.
Define KPIs, build dashboards, and create reports on the chosen platform in consultation with various team members, primarily marketing, product, and development to begin with.
Respond to operational needs by providing analytical support.
Establish and maintain a system to roll up qualitative data gathered from various sources (customer support requests, user comments, educator outreach) into digestible quantitative insights that support, initially and primarily, membership acquisition.
Perform sufficient qualitative research to gain insights into data trends. (Get data from individual users to show the "why" and "how" for the quantitative data's "how much" and "how often.") Use that research to become an expert in the end-to-end needs of our users.
Essential Requirements:
2+ years of experience in business or data analysis with experience in identity, ecommerce, online payments, education, reviews, or the gaming industry.
Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to train and guide others.
Bachelor's degree or comparable experience required in a quantitative discipline such as mathematics, statistics, economics, engineering, operations research, computer science, or quantitative psychology.
Strong analytical skills including the ability to interpret and manipulate large structured data to develop recommendations and analysis.
Proficiency with SQL, tools such as Tableau or Looker, and other statistical/reporting packages.
Self-motivated; works well both independently and as part of an agile team.
Preferred Experience:
Master's degree required, in a quantitative discipline such as mathematics, statistics, economics, engineering, operations research, computer science, or quantitative psychology.
Experience in developing, driving, and supporting membership/donation models.
Experience with console development for analytical platforms.
Understanding of other Big Data tools.
Experience with visualization tools and platforms.
Experience integrating third-party data into Looker, such as Salesforce.
Note: For the right candidate, we would be willing to provide additional training as needed in use of Looker and data science.
APPLY NOW
Common Sense Media values the diversity of its employees and is an equal opportunity employer.

title: Digital Marketing Analyst
description:
National Pen is looking for an enthusiastic and passionate Digital Marketing Analyst to accelerate the growth of our ecommerce business utilizing Google Analytics (GA 360). In this role, you’ll work closely with the Channel Managers to provide valuable insight into how we measure, analyze, and attribute our digital marketing efforts. You will be expected to cull actionable insights from the data and work with the business leaders to implement and monitor your suggestions. This is a direct hire position with Benefits, PTO, 401K plus much more!
Responsibilities
Create dashboards and ad hoc reports supporting your analysis using Google Data Studio
Monitor trends to identify funnel drop-off points using Custom GA Reports and Google Sheets
Work with Channel Managers to identify tracking opportunities on the website
Facilitate any changes to analytics tagging by working with front-end engineering team to test and deploy new tags
Track Assisted Conversions for Paid Media campaigns
Synthesize quantitative data (GA) with the qualitative data (Full Story) to identify areas of improvement
Monitor and analyze Lifetime Value of all digital campaigns using in-house reporting
Analyze Brand and Non Brand keyword performance for SEO
Ensure data integrity for the Web Analytics dataset
Qualifications
5+ years of experience in web analytics with ecommerce focus
5+ years of exposure to digital marketing efforts (including Paid Media, SEO, or Email Marketing)
Deep subject matter expertise with Google Analytics (and GA 360)
Thorough understanding of Google Tag Manager
Basic SQL knowledge
Strong mathematical and problem-solving skills
Comfortable working with Web Analytics data outside of the GA interface (using R or Python)
Familiarity with A/B testing tools, including Monetate
Proven ability to turn data into actionable recommendations to achieve business goals
Outstanding communication skills with both technical and non-technical colleagues

title: Data Analyst
description:
Data Analyst - price and strategy analysis, engaged in energy market related work.

Job Summary

This position is under our energy trading group. This position needs people to
1. Predict the price trend of California electricity market through mathematical modeling and qualitative analysis;
2. Participate in the bidding strategy formulation
3. Collect and improve the relevant database information
4. Analyze situations of the bidding price node.
The most important responsibility of the position is to use data analysis to help the company to carry out the price and strategy guidance of the daily virtual bidding.

Position Duties and Responsibilities

1. Report the daily forecast node prices and related information to Trading Director, and supply the feasible bidding strategies.
2. Collect and collate the relevant data of the energy market and complete the construction of the database.
3. Use data analysis software, such as R, to establish model of price, power generation forecast and so on
4. Analyze and predict the energy and congestion price of bidding nodes, and provide relate data for bidding.
5. Collate and sum up the California policies and regulations in the energy fields and analyze the potential impact of policy changing on price.

Position Qualifications

1. Master's or above degree in energy, environmental management, mathematics, engineering, or relevant area. GPA is required 3.6/4.0 or above.
2. At least one year's working experience in the relevant area. (the graduate related project experience can be counted as working time)
3. Have working experience or research experience on energy market in US, and understand policies and regulations in energy fields in US.
4. Have working experience or research experience on big data processing and analyzing.
5. Proficiency in data analysis tools (such as R, STATA, MATLAB, etc.).
6. Proficiency in Microsoft Office.
7. Being good at communication with people; efficient complete your tasks; comfort in the fast pace work environment.
8. Strong mathematics background (logic, linear algebra, geometry, etc.)

Pluses

Working experience in data analysis in energy field area.

title: Data Analyst
description:
Position Overview:
Fair Trade USA's newly formed Data Team works with departments across the organization to collect, manage and share data about Fair Trade USA’s business and the impact of our work. The organization is committed to being excellent stewards of our data while working quickly to create meaningful data insights that can be used to evaluate the effectiveness of our programs and deliver supply chain insights to our partners.
The Data Analyst will work directly with Data Scientists, Engineers, and Program Analysts on the Data Team as well as collaborate with multiple departments to implement new tools and methodologies that will allow for optimation data collection, analysis, and visualization.
Key Responsibilities:
Innovate, build, and implement code-based solutions and database infrastructure that facilitate prompt analysis of received information
Implement ongoing Producer and Transaction database record management
Provide key input for internal teams to innovate data analysis methodology
Operate and innovate a Salesforce-based data cleansing tool to centrally convert reported data to uniform values
Conduct ad hoc analysis and visualize data, as needed by internal and external customers
Oversee systematic certification communications
Work effectively in an agile framework as a team member, supporting peers and providing insights and solutions to help improve external customer service as well as internal procedures
Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience
Must be proficient in SQL or another query language
Must show demonstrated knowledge in a programming language, preferably Python
Must be proficient in MS Office applications (most notably Excel)
Exceptional oral and written communication skills
Must be detail-oriented, logical, systematic, methodical, highly organized, able to problem solve and often work autonomously
Experience with auditing, reconciling, collecting, and analyzing data and reports is desired
Demonstrated ability to be flexible, adaptable and able to multi-task in a fast-paced and deadline-oriented environment
Strong work ethic, and likes to have fun on the job
Fluency in English required
A passion for Fair Trade USA’s mission, vision, and accomplishments
To apply:
Please submit your resume and cover letter to the attention of Serena Santoni, Data Scientist

title: Policy Analyst – K-12 Education Policy
description:
$60,000 - $85,000 a year
The California Budget & Policy Center (Budget Center) seeks to hire a Policy Analyst to help lead the Budget Center’s work on K-12 education policy issues and contribute to our work on state budget policy. The successful candidate’s primary responsibility will be to help the Budget Center to analyze and advance sensible policy options to enhance educational opportunities for Californians, including adequately and equitably funding California’s K-12 schools and improving educational outcomes for all students, especially those who are disadvantaged.
About the California Budget & Policy Center
The team at the Budget Center works every day to build a more inclusive California where everyone has the opportunity to participate fully in the state’s economic, social, and political life. This requires our state to make smart policy choices and public investments. By examining the most pressing budget and policy issues and making them accessible and more understandable, we aim to broaden participation in state policy debates and help foster outcomes that work for all Californians, especially those individuals and communities who have not yet shared in our state’s economic prosperity.
How This Position Advances the Organization’s Work
Policy analysts are valued members of the Budget Center’s growing team with responsibility to help develop our strategic agenda, author innovative policy reports, make the case for solutions, and engage almost daily with state, local, and national partners. The Budget Center is committed to advancing equity and inclusion and seeks to create an environment and culture that embraces employee differences.
Roles, Responsibilities, and Qualifications
The responsibilities of the position include analyzing state budget and education policies; researching and writing short reports targeting key policy deliberations; representing the Budget Center before state and local stakeholder groups and policymakers; providing assistance to community groups, legislative staff, and government officials; and analyzing data to identify the impact of state, federal, and local budget and education policies on low- and middle-income Californians and on the state’s fiscal health.
Qualifications for the position include:
Strong commitment to social, economic, and racial justice.
Outstanding written and verbal communications skills, including a demonstrated ability to communicate complex topics to non-expert audiences.
Ability to take initiative, problem-solve, and think strategically.
Self-motivation, ability to work independently, and ability to prioritize tasks.
Willingness to work as a part of a team and enthusiasm for building relationships with key stakeholders and partners in our work.
Facility with numbers, including the use of spreadsheets.
Experience in policy analysis or research, including a familiarity with state, federal, and/or local budget and policy issues and data sources.
A bachelor’s degree plus at least two years of experience in education and/or budget policy and research. A master’s degree in public policy, education, or a related field may be substituted for two years of work experience
This position is full-time. The salary range for the position is $60,000 – $85,000 based on experience and includes health insurance, dental and vision coverage, retirement benefits, and paid time off for vacation, sick leave, and holidays. Applications will be accepted until the position is filled. To apply, email a resume, writing sample, cover letter, and names of three references. No calls please.
Policy Analyst – K-12 Education Policy
California Budget & Policy Center
1107 9th Street, Suite 310
Sacramento, CA 95814
The Budget Center is an Equal Opportunity Employer that values and welcomes diversity in the workplace and strongly encourages all qualified persons to apply regardless of race, creed, color, sex, national origin, marital status, sexual orientation, religious or political affiliation, disability, and any other classification considered discriminatory under applicable law.
Job Type: Full-time
Salary: $60,000.00 to $85,000.00 /year
Education:
Bachelor's (Required)

title: Data Support Analyst - 1
description:
The primary focus of the Data Support Analyst I representative is to manage and support the day to day data transfer processes with an emphasis on proactive customer service. Data Support is an internal escalation group that assist Client Engagement, Sales, Relationship Management, and Client Engagement Tech Support with connection and integration related issues through inbound calls or emails.

Responsibilities
Interface with end user clients to help resolve issues and ensure data transfer efficiencies
Interface with internal support teams on escalated issues – both customer and operations based
Proactively troubleshoot data transfer issues from a global level
Assist in all facets of data transfer implementations
Stays up to date on system releases, new features, and bugs
Makes outbound calls or WebEx sessions in response to ticket or email request
Provides a second level of support for account aggregation
Services about 9000 internal connection tickets a month
Knowledge of both the eMoney application and the Nexus tool

Requirements
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience required; college degree preferred
Minimum of 2 years customer service experience required
Team Player with the ability to work independently as needed

Skills
Exceptional communication skills (both written and verbal)
Strong analytical and diagnostic skills
Detailed oriented
Working knowledge of MS Office suite
Understanding of CRM systems
Knowledge of project based initiatives
Strong interpersonal and verbal/written communication skills
Strong organization skills and excellent time management skills
Adept at data and trend analysis

title: Vans Business Analyst
description:
Vans: Be a Part of the Original

“It was never about waving the brand like a flag, it was always about the people” – Paul Van Doren
Vans is the original action sports footwear company rooted in authenticity and creativity. Founded in 1966, Vans has thrived on a legacy of impacting our greater community through Vans’ four pillars: action sports, music, art and street culture. We are constantly inspired by the expressive creators within our company and community as they bring new and innovative perspectives to help shape and transform the future of our business.

At Vans our culture sets us apart and it influences everything we do. Everything we do supports creativity and we are driven by our five values. We are determined . We are connected to our consumers and to each other. We are inclusive . We are expressive and Fun . And most of all, we are a family.

Vans is a subsidiary of VF, the world’s largest apparel and footwear company comprised of over 30 brands. We are the leading drivers of retail as our global footwear, apparel and accessory brand is available in 170 countries worldwide. As we continue to expand, we take great measures in developing and growing our people.

Vans is founded on a culture of learning. We take great pride in our ability to facilitate learning opportunities by providing the resources and tools necessary to support each individual’s pursuit of growth to achieve future goals. In order to prioritize career growth within our company, Vans offers courses on topics such as leadership, communication, collaboration and technical skills to ensure our employees are self-motivated and developing to the pace of our rapidly growing business.

By joining the Vans family, you will be immersed into an environment of incredibly supportive and collaborative people. We work very hard across a multitude of large initiatives to bring the Van Doren spirit to life. We live for what we do.

Vans Business Analyst– North America: Become the Newest Member of the Vans Family: In this role, your primary responsibilities as Business Analyst are to assist the Product Merchandising department with reporting and analysis to drive regional sales growth and track product efficiency during all product merchandising cycles. This process includes data collection and validation, managing and troubleshooting the database, and preparing weekly, monthly, and seasonal sales/ product merchandising recaps. The Business Analyst is responsible for the reporting of wholesale booking using Cognos and Tableau reporting tools. We are looking for a visionary with a stream of innovative ideas that will transform the action sports industry .

How You Will Make a Difference:

Perform weekly, monthly and seasonal reports to support the Apparel Product Merchandising team and Strategic Accounts team during all stages of the product merchandising cycle.
Assist Product Merchandising Director with the line review and brief reports.
Responsible for setting up new product, channel, and strategic account reports for the region.
Assist Product Merchandising Director with seasonal projections by style/color.
Responsible for Ad hoc analysis using reporting tools which could include Pivotlink, Cognos, CTI, Leapfile, Filezilla, Tableau and Think-Cell reporting.
Responsible for distribution of Product Merchandising reports to merchandising team.
Responsible for development of best practices in the business analyst role as it relates to Vans' developing wholesale business.
Execute action oriented analysis of product performance including but not limited to, product efficiency analysis, and product adoption rate metrics.
Build relationships with similar roles in other coalition brands to develop best practices and leverage VF resources.

Skills:

Ability to think strategically and act tactically.
Strong interpersonal communication, presentation and problem solving skills.
Comfortable in self-starter environment.
Basic computer skills – Microsoft Office, PowerPoint/Keynote.
Exercises strong interpersonal skills across internal and external partners.
Ability to work in an open environment with product team and cross-functional partners.
Computer proficiency including specific job-required applications.
Follows through with all tasks, assignments and job duties in a timely manner.

Special Physical and/or Mental Requirements:
Business travel may be required up to 5-10%.
Bend, lift, open and move product and related office items varying in weight from 1 to 25 lbs, depending on need.

title: Database Marketing Analyst
description:
The Database Marketing Analyst is responsible for helping pull data from the CRM database and create reports to help in the analyzing consumer behavior, as well optimizing existing and building out new database management approaches, constantly enhancing in-house database.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities
Leverage expert SQL programming skills to run extensive customer transaction data queries across large volumes of data, multiple data extensions, and campaign history. Develop and implement weekly reporting for the enterprise on customer segment performance, trends, and key behavior drivers.
Apply analytical and programming skills to mine the relational customer database for insights.
Develop expert knowledge of current DB architecture and ETL processes and recommend ongoing process improvements.
Employ expert knowledge of SQL, Tableau, and BI applications to design, execute, and ensure quality of weekly automated reports, dashboards and ad hoc requests for the marketing team and other stakeholders.
Demonstrate strong business and analytical acumen when reviewing data for inconsistencies or anomalies that could skew analytical results.
Leverage strong interpersonal skills with Marketing and other stakeholders in gathering information to determine specification requirements for data requests, reports, and ongoing utility.
Perform routine database audits that includes review of business rules, data validation and augmentation, merging and purging duplicate records, etc.
Work continuously with third party database vendors to enhance/optimize the data model to accelerate information, reporting, and insights while ensuring accuracy.
Use and support database applications and analytical tools such as Microsoft SQL, Tableau, Microstrategy, Cognos and SSRS

title: Data Analyst Senior
description:
Support completeness and accuracy for risk data submission to CMS, thereby supporting senior leadership attestations.


Support Error Management Team: Enhance error management processes and timely remediation of errors. The Data Analyst provides support to remediate data submission errors by analyzing, manipulating, tracking, internally managing and reporting data.

Essential Functions:
Project Management: Manages small to medium size projects. Develops and executes project plans. Provides project reporting to project sponsor under guidance of higher level resource.
Meta Data Repository: Develops data definitions consistent with data management standards and conventions. Defines meta data structures for information repository and performs model management.
Data Design (logical): Analyzes business information requirements and translates these into logical database designs. Collaborates with physical database designers to develop alternative solutions for meeting complex and conflicting requirements. Develops data definitions consistent with data management standards and conventions. Participates in model integration and convergence activities.
Database Development (physical): Develops, tests and implements the organization's physical databases across multiple platforms, technologies and computing environments.
Database Performance: Provides support to Lead in capacity planning, forecasting, and tuning. Develops performance/tuning evaluation reports.
Communications: Communicates business/information models to clients, developers and database designers. Communicates database designs to data analyst and application programming staff.
Technology Evaluation: Researches and evaluates alternative database solutions and recommends the most efficient and cost-effective solution for the project, ensuring consistency with enterprise direction.
Methodologies and Standards: Recommends development of or adoption/incorporation of new methodologies and standards for supporting information management.
Database Management and Support Tools: Implements, configures and customizes database management and support tools.
Client Consulting: Consults with clients and development areas in the design and implementation of small to medium projects. Consults with clients to determine information management requirements.
Training/Mentoring: Provides direction, guidance, and technical support to clients, applications, and operations areas. Develops technical and analytical skills of lower level resources.
Data Transformation: Designs, develops and tests complex transformation extract s and load routines.
Database Maintenance: Provides second level diagnosis and resolution of database problems. Works with vendor personnel, if necessary, to achieve timely solutions of database problems. Escalates as necessary and provides problem resolutions.

title: Data Analyst, Square Capital
description:
Job Description

As a data analyst on the Capital team at Square, you will be responsible for answering unstructured business questions by analyzing and interpreting a wealth of data about our products, services, and customers. This analysis will touch many parts of the organization, and your work is essentially making business, product, and operational decisions on the Capital team.
You will:
Work with business and product teams to anticipate analytics needs and answer product and business questions
Design and implement data structures and analyses that drive actionable insights for new features and initiatives
Work with data infrastructure engineers to build ETLs to ensure the right data is available for analysis
Analyze, forecast, and build reporting for key performance metrics
Effectively present and communicate analysis to the company in order to drive business decisions

Qualifications
You have:
A BS/BA in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Math, Statistics, Economics, or related technical field (MS is a plus)
3+ years of relevant experience
Experience using relational databases to query data (e.g. SQL) and ETL
Excellent analytical skills and problem solving ability; the ability to answer unstructured business questions and work independently to drive projects to conclusion
Intellectual curiosity
Even better:
Experience with data visualization technology, such as Looker
Experience with scripting and data analysis programming languages (e.g. Python, R)
Experience with ETL management tools, such as Airflow

Additional Information

At Square, our purpose is to empower – within and outside of our walls. In order to build the best tools for the businesses and customers we support all over the world, we have to start at home with a workforce as diverse and empowered as our sellers. To this end, we take great care to evaluate all employees and job applicants equally, based on merit, competence, and qualifications. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply and always consider qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records, in accordance with the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance. Applicants in need of special assistance or accommodation during the interview process or in accessing our website may contact us by sending an email to assistance(at)squareup.com. We will treat your request as confidentially as possible. In your email, please include your name and preferred method of contact, and we will respond as soon as possible.

title: Data Analyst - Growth
description:
In this role you will make Grove's Growth team even more awesome, and will help us take Grove's marketing to new places. Grove is a company that runs on data, and you will be the point person to help identify and solve big business challenges and to equip the team with better insights into business performance. You will get exposure at the highest levels of the company - and will be trusted to independently identify and dive into complex business issues. The KPIs you will be most focused on are revenue, customer engagement and customer lifetime value. You will also ensure that our data analysis and reports are accurate, rigorous (e.g. statistically-backed), and easily accessible via reports & dashboards.

The Opportunity
This role will work very closely with Grove's marketing teams: Retention Marketing and Customer Acquisition, empowering them with data and also proactively pointing out opportunities to them
You will partner with other teams whose work influences our marketing - merchandizing, inventory, engineering, operations and become an expert on how each department's work impacts our customer, our marketing efforts, and our KPIs
You will use your SQL and Excel skills to pull and analyze data
You will synthesize results/findings via clear, written and verbal communications
You will be action-oriented: you will propose next steps, and follow up to make sure action is being taken when big opportunities have been identified



About you
You have 2-5 years of professional experience, and are comfortable working on a high-performing team with shifting priorities
You have spent most of your career in some combination of: B2C digital marketing, web analytics or Ecommerce
You have a desire to be technical and understand data schemas and database joins better than most people at your company
You are passionate about data and your first instinct when solving any problem is to see what the data says
You have a gut feel for how to separate signal from noise, and constantly apply the 80/20 rule to 'sanity check' that you are on the right path, before spending too much time pursuing a dead end
You are extremely comfortable in SQL & Excel
You have some basic exposure to either Python or R for more advanced statistical analysis and visualization
Experience with Looker/LookML is a plus
You are comfortable collaborating closely with team members at all levels and being accountable for high-priority projects
You love detail, over-delivering, and doing more than previously thought possible
You care about leaving a positive impact in the world
You love to work hard, learn fast, and make an impact right away



We are remaking the future of consumer goods and want you to join us. You'll get:
Competitive compensation, with performance based bonuses
Stock options - shared success is core to our mission.
Comprehensive medical, vision and dental coverage.
A beautiful office in Cow Hollow, San Francisco.
A fully stocked kitchen with healthy snacks (feel free to request anything you like!)
A shiny mac and the other productivity accessories you need
Flexible Paid Time Off - we care most about results, not face time.
Exposure at the highest levels of our leadership and a huge opportunity for internal growth at the company



Let's do this

We're building a diverse and inclusive work environment where we learn from each other. We welcome people of diverse backgrounds, experiences, abilities and perspectives. We are an equal opportunity employer and a fun place to work. Come join the community at Grove. It's a heck of a lot of fun, and we'd love to tell you more about it.

title: Developer Analyst I, Junior -- Entry Level
description:
$20 - $24 an hour
USCB America is a 100% Employee Owned and Operated Receivable & Resource Management Company and we pride ourselves with being a leader and innovator in our industry.
We currently have a great opportunity for a student or graduate looking for an entry level position or flexible work schedule which allows them to attend school and work full time. We are always seeking the best people to join our winning team and we are currently in need of an Developer Analyst I to join our Information Systems team in our Downtown (Bunker Hill) Los Angeles Corporate Headquarters.
BENEFITS:
Company Subsidized Medical, Dental, and Vision Coverage
Company Paid Life Insurance
401(k) Savings Plan with 4% Company Match - Retirement Benefit
Employee Stock Ownership Plan (ESOP) - Retirement Benefit
Aflac
Direct Deposit
Metro BTAP Card Program
Employee Gym and Shower
Employee Lunch Room with Ping Pong, Smart TV, Foosball
Additional Break Rooms Including Vending Machines
Employee Quiet Room for Reading, Resting, and Relaxation
SUMMARY:
Developer will assist in the creation, and maintenance, of features within a Healthcare centric Business System. Developer is expected to independently accomplish organization goals by supporting phases of the Software Development Life Cycle under limited supervision.
RESPONSIBILITIES:
Participates in business process assessments
Participates in analysis and conversion of requirements into features
Participates in feature design and scoping
Documents features, configuration, and programming
Participates in testing to ensure feature meets the requirements that guided design
Provides, and guides, training and support to end users
Participates in release, install, and activation activities
Conducts adaptive, perfective, corrective, and preventative maintenance
Works with various data exchange interfaces and integration services
Exercises discretion and independent judgment to successfully track, test, and release software features
Participates in meetings to communicate scope and status of assigned projects
Participates in identification, development, and communication of new standards and best practices
Other duties as assigned.
KNOWLEDGE, SKILL, & ABILITIES SOUGHT:
Associates in Computer Sciences, or minimum 2 years’ experience in software development role
Proficient in Standard Query Language (SQL) and one or more object-oriented languages
Ability to conduct basic configuration, administration, and troubleshooting tasks
Familiarity with development and documentation tools
Knowledge of, or experience with, data exchange interfaces and integration services
Ability to assist in analysis of business processes, assess system and establish requirements
Ability to develop and model basic database objects
Ability to design applications and processes to support business functions or complete well defined tasks
Ability to create simple reports and database queries in one or more reporting environments
Ability to perform basic testing and troubleshooting of features
Ability to apply problem solving skills; troubleshoot and identify root causes and solutions for errors
Ability to obtain and retain general knowledge of function and practices of business units
Ability to effectively communicate with non-technical team members, stakeholders, and vendors
Knowledge of medical terminology and Health Information Systems a plus
Must successfully pass a criminal history screening
USCB America will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of the Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring (Ban the Box) Ordinance.
Job Type: Full-time
Salary: $20.00 to $24.00 /hour
