title: Data Science Analyst
description:
$100,000 - $115,000 a year
DATA SCIENCE ANALYST- CRM PLATFORM
SAN FRANCISCO, CA
$100,000-115,000 (DEPENDENT ON EXPERIENCE) + BONUS
Are you looking to work at a fast paced, data-driven start up? This company is building out their analytic function in the Bay Area and are looking for a self-starter who loves working hands on with data and has extensive modeling experience. If this sounds like it could be you keep reading to get an idea of what could be your next, exciting challenge!
THE COMPANY
This start up SaaS company offers an email and sales platform for small businesses to manage and optimize their customer lifecycle, CRM, and marketing automation. This company has been growing through extensive levels of growth within all their analytics functions. They are headquartered in their South and have expanded to the Bay Are where they are already establishing a strong presence.
THE ROLE
They are looking for an analyst who is not only experienced in data science but is eager to get hands on experience collaborating with Data Science team to gather and prepare the data, create statistical models, and on-going monitoring. You will also be:
Preforming ad-hoc statistical analysis and create actionable insights for business stakeholders
Designing, constructing and maintaining highly scalable data science tools
Working with the data science team to find opportunities to create a more data driven environment
YOUR SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE
Expert in SQL
Commercial experience in data warehouses (BigQuery/Redshift/Hive), tools such as Looker, and Salesforce or Marketo
Commercial experience in a data analytics role, preferably at a tech company
Advanced proficiency in Python and R
Experience building out statistical models
Be a self-starter, ask questions when needed, but are eager to work autonomously at a high level
THE BENEFITS
A good office environment that is tight-knit and collaborative
Leadership that encourages autonomy and self-motivated individuals
Competitive benefits
Convenient office location right in the Financial District

title: Research Data Analyst
description:
Grade: G
The Division of Pediatric Cardiology in the Department of Pediatrics seeks a Research Data Analyst for the Priest, Ashley Labs on the School of Medicine campus. This position will involve close collaboration with Macarthur Grant awardee Dr. Chris Re in the Department of Computer Science.

The Priest laboratory employs genomic and genetic methods to study the molecular mechanisms underlie congenital malformations of the heart. For genes and variants identified through genetic studies, we work to identify mechanisms by which causal variation is responsible for altered gene structure or function, and employ tissue culture and genetic mouse models to identify how encoded factors participate in the disease process.

The Research Data Analyst will execute day-to-day experiments under the guidance of Dr. Priest and Dr. Re, primarily supporting ongoing computer vision studies of MRI data to accomplish the goals of the lab. This work will require the maintenance of local, shared, and cloud computation resources along with deployment of standard and novel workflows in computer vision analysis such as convolutional neural networks. S/he will be expected to collect, analyze, and present research data to the research group. The Research Data Analyst will be expected to troubleshoot existing protocols and develop novel protocols and procedures and provide technical and scientific advice to other research personnel in lab. The position will also entail some lab support tasks such as systems administration of local computing resources, maintaining lab records, and adhering to data compliance regulations.

Duties include:

Collect, manage and clean datasets.
Employ new and existing tools to interpret, analyze, and visualize multivariate relationships in data.
Create databases and reports, develop algorithms and statistical models, and perform statistical analyses appropriate to data and reporting requirements.
Use system reports and analyses to identify potentially problematic data, make corrections, and determine root cause for data problems from input errors or inadequate field edits, and suggest possible solutions.
Develop reports, charts, graphs and tables for use by investigators and for publication and presentation.
Analyze data processes in documentation.
Collaborate with faculty and research staff on data collection and analysis methods.
Provide documentation based on audit and reporting criteria to investigators and research staff.
Communicate with government officials, grant agencies and industry representatives.

- Other duties may also be assigned

DESIRED QUALIFICATIONS:
At least one year previous experience in computer vision research
Experience in Linux/unix facility along with python, perl, java, and swift
Strong analytical skills and excellent judgment
Ability to handle a wide range of assignments and meet deadlines with minimal day-to-day instruction
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Familiarity with Biomedical Research

EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE (REQUIRED):

Bachelor's degree or a combination of education and relevant experience. Experience in a quantitative discipline such as economics, finance, statistics or engineering.

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES (REQUIRED):
Substantial experience with MS Office and analytical programs.
Strong writing and analytical skills.
Ability to prioritize workload.

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS*:

Sitting in place at computer for long periods of time with extensive keyboarding/dexterity.
Occasionally use a telephone.
Rarely writing by hand.

- Consistent with its obligations under the law, the University will provide reasonable accommodation to any employee with a disability who requires accommodation to perform the essential functions of his or her job.

WORKING CONDITIONS:

Some work may be performed in a laboratory or field setting.
Additional WORKING CONDITIONS:
May require working in close proximity to blood borne pathogens.
May require work in an environment where animals are used for teaching and research.
Position may at times require the employee to work with or be in areas where hazardous materials and/or infectious diseases are present.

title: Senior Business Data Analyst- Digital
description:
Are you?

Excited to influence business decisions with data- driven insights?
Awesome with Google Analytics, AdWords, and SQL?
Looking to collaborate with stakeholders as a strategic thought partner?
If the above describes YOU, keep reading for more details about this opportunity:

Based out of La Jolla, California, National Funding, an innovator and leader in the financial technology industry, is seeking a Senior Business Data Analyst focused on our digital marketing channels. National Funding has experienced double digit growth for many years and that growth is expected to continue. Our new Senior Business Data Analyst will contribute to that growth by delivering insights and recommendations that drive business decisions in our digital marketing strategy.

How you will make an impact:
Partner with Marketing Managers, Sales, and executives as a strategic thought partner to deliver key insights from web tracking metrics
Study website behavior patterns to analyze and optimize business results and user experience
Synthesize data from multiple sources, developing assumptions where needed, to drive customer insights and strategy development
Coordinate with external partners and business stakeholders to develop actionable dashboards which present the end to end funnel metrics, contributing to the development of hypotheses and actions
Collaborate with Marketing to measure impact of website strategy across all campaign channels and to refine strategy driven by data-based insights
Work with stakeholders to develop learning plans with recommendations of analytics approaches, including A/B testing
Ensure site tagging is implemented properly to provide visibility to impact and value of various initiatives and releases
An ideal candidate looks like this:
5-8 years of experience in web analytics decision support and website optimization
Deep subject matter expertise with Google Analytics and SQL; experience with Google AdWords, Google Webmaster tools and Google Tag Manager a plus
Solid understanding of Paid Search, SEO, and other digital marketing channels such as Affiliate, Social, and Display
Strong analytical and problem solving skills
Experience with Tableau (or similar data visualization tools such as Spotfire, PowerBI, QlikView, etc.)
Proven ability to tell stories with data and instill confidence in recommendations to motivate stakeholders to take action
Outstanding communication skills with both technical and non-technical colleagues
Prefer candidates with experience with CRM systems (Salesforce)
Prefer candidates with experience in Finance, Mortgage, Banking
Why National Funding?

Positive, energetic, passionate, business casual environment
Fantastic benefits package including medical, dental, vision, life, LTD, FSA, 401(k) with an employer match and PTO
Numerous employee events throughout the year including our annual traditions such as a Day at the Del Mar Racetrack, Del Mar Mud Run, Bring Your Kid to Work Day, Holiday Party, Employee and Family Picnic, sporting events, and more
National Funding is one of the leading providers of short term loans and equipment leasing for small businesses across the United States. For five years running, we've been ranked by the San Diego Business Journal as one of the 100 Fastest Growing Private Companies in San Diego and listed on the Inc. 5000 List of America's Fastest Growing Private Companies. Since 1999, we have been in the forefront of the equipment leasing business, working with businesses in hundreds of communities and industries to expand and upgrade their business equipment. As we have grown, so too has our product line, and now we are one of the country's largest private lenders of small business loans. Our customers call on us to get working capital, merchant cash advances, credit card processing, and, of course, equipment leasing.

title: Project Analyst
description:
Contract
Position: Project Analyst
Location: San Diego, California
Employee Type: Contract
Manages Others: Yes
Reports To: Project Manager
Overview
We are looking for a Project Analyst with life sciences industry experience to work with the Project Manager and client representatives on conducting research projects, preparing and revising project documents, reports and presentations, and performing analytical tasks to ensure that the projects are supporting client goals and objectives. Additionally, the Project Analyst will serve as the liaison between the Project Manager and stakeholders, gather, analyze and communicate requirements, as well as gather critical data and support the project team with budget tracking.

Provide regular project updates, reports and presentations.
Analyze, manage and mitigate risks associated with the project.

Bachelor of Science degree in Engineering or technical field.
PMP preferred, but not required.
Life science industry experience is preferred, but not required.
Understanding of risk management policies and procedures.
Experience of managing budgets for large projects.
Ability to effectively communicate using multiple forms of communication.
Strong interpersonal and communications skills, both verbal and written.
Ability to demonstrate initiative and assertiveness, the ability to plan and manage work in an efficient manner.
Ability to work well under stress and time pressures.
Ability to travel to other client sites, if necessary.

Budgeting: 3 years (Preferred)

Bachelor's (Preferred)
License:
PMP (Preferred)

title: Data Analyst
description:
We are searching for an analyst to join the operations team at Twist. As a data analyst you will be responsible for gathering data, generating metrics, finding trends, compiling reports, interpreting results, and communicating conclusions to management. This position will also be the designated data steward for our operational data. As such, you will be responsible for monitoring operational data quality, identifying issues, and performing data cleanups. The data analyst will thus ensure that our data is clean and that we extract as much value as possible out of it.

The successful candidate will have a passion for data and an intense attention to detail. They will work with business partners to define metrics for tracking business performance, and then deliver dashboards and reports on those metrics. The data analyst will also drive operational excellence by monitoring key performance indicators (KPIs) and generating regular reports.

Responsibilities

Perform routine data mining using a variety of source data and methods
Manage daily-weekly-monthly reporting
Prepare ad-hoc reports. Review reports for accuracy and completeness
Create Tableau dashboards to track KPIs
Respond to outside requests for data
Identify patterns in operational data
Actively monitor, analyze, and report metrics to track business performance goals
Official data steward for operations. Accountable for data quality
Monitor data quality
Identify data quality issues
Perform data cleanup
Work with business partners to provide technical guidance on operational data needs
Required experience/qualifications:
Bachelor's degree – STEM background preferred
1+ year analyst experience
Proficient in SQL and Excel
Experience with reporting, business intelligence or similar
Experience with data visualization tools – Tableau preferred
Good understanding of data infrastructures
Fluency in data analysis principles
Able to build and iterate reports, tools, and dashboards
Detail-oriented. Able to understand and justify the gritty details of each report. Data must be good, analysis must be sound, results must be correct, and metrics must make business sense.
Proven ability to write excellent documentation
Excellent verbal and written skills. Must be able to clearly communicate data-related technical concepts.
Able to navigate between multiple projects, meet deadlines, and process ad hoc requests promptly
Preferred experience

Knowledge of Python
Experience in manufacturing operations
Experience in life sciences / biotech
About Twist Bioscience

Twist Bioscience synthesizes genes from scratch, known as "writing" DNA. Just as children learn to both read and write, the next phase of development for the genomics revolution is the ability to write DNA.

At Twist Bioscience, we work in service of people who are changing the world for the better. In fields such as health care, agriculture, industrial chemicals and data storage, our unique silicon-based DNA Synthesis Platform provides precision at a scale that is otherwise unavailable to our customers.

Twist Bioscience Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Twist Bioscience Corporation provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, genetic characteristics, or any other category protected by law.

San Francisco applicants: Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

title: Product Data Analyst
description:
Qventus is a real-time decision-making platform for hospital operations. Our mission is to simplify how healthcare operates, so that hospitals and caregivers can focus on delivering the best possible care to patients. We use artificial intelligence and machine learning to create products that help nurses, doctors, and hospital staff anticipate issues and make operational decisions proactively. Qventus works with leading public, academic and community hospitals across the United States. The company was recognized by the 2016 Fierce Innovations Awards in Healthcare and by Healthcare Informatics as a 2017 Innovator Award winner.

The Role
We're looking for a product data analyst to join our product team. You will use your background in product analytics and/or business intelligence to measure and understand the entire impact chain of our product, from performance of our algorithms, through nudges and recommendations made to hospital staff, to the actions they take and the operational impact those actions have. You'll work closely with our product, design & engineering teams to help drive the insights you derive into tangible results in our product portfolio. You'll also be a resource for our go-to-market teams to help explain key concepts to our customers and prospects, and on occasion write blog posts / white papers that advance our thought leadership position in the market. You will be integral in developing our core methodology for how we measure success.

This is a high impact role that will drive innovation in our product and high impact in the market.

Responsibilities
Create real-time visibility for us and our clients into what's working and not in our product
Facilitate our product, design, and engineering teams' laser focus on outcomes
Explore our data to find leverage points and opportunitiesBuild and tell robust analytics stories
Advise our customer success and go-to-market teams on what works, why, and how to drive further success

Qualifications
2-5 years experience in product analytics and/or business intelligence
Proficiency in SQL and dashboarding/visualization tools (e.g. Tableau, Superset, Looker)
Comfort with Python or R a plus
Ability to construct analyses that resonate with a variety of audiences
A love for the big picture and a healthy obsession with the details
Deep curiosity and a passion for real-world impact

title: Database Marketing Analyst
description:
The Database Marketing Analyst is responsible for helping pull data from the CRM database and create reports to help in the analyzing consumer behavior, as well optimizing existing and building out new database management approaches, constantly enhancing in-house database.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities
Leverage expert SQL programming skills to run extensive customer transaction data queries across large volumes of data, multiple data extensions, and campaign history. Develop and implement weekly reporting for the enterprise on customer segment performance, trends, and key behavior drivers.
Apply analytical and programming skills to mine the relational customer database for insights.
Develop expert knowledge of current DB architecture and ETL processes and recommend ongoing process improvements.
Employ expert knowledge of SQL, Tableau, and BI applications to design, execute, and ensure quality of weekly automated reports, dashboards and ad hoc requests for the marketing team and other stakeholders.
Demonstrate strong business and analytical acumen when reviewing data for inconsistencies or anomalies that could skew analytical results.
Leverage strong interpersonal skills with Marketing and other stakeholders in gathering information to determine specification requirements for data requests, reports, and ongoing utility.
Perform routine database audits that includes review of business rules, data validation and augmentation, merging and purging duplicate records, etc.
Work continuously with third party database vendors to enhance/optimize the data model to accelerate information, reporting, and insights while ensuring accuracy.
Use and support database applications and analytical tools such as Microsoft SQL, Tableau, Microstrategy, Cognos and SSRS

title: Data Analyst
description:
What You'll Do
Do you love working with data? Are you passionate about turning complex data into information, information into insight, and insight into business decisions? Then the Cisco Impact Data Quality & Analytics team may be an exceptional opportunity for you. We are looking for a highly motivated Data Analyst in the Carlsbad, CA office.
In this role, you will develop analysis and reporting capabilities. You will also monitor performance and quality control plans to identify improvements.
Responsibilities:
You will interpret data, analyze results using statistical technique, and provide ongoing reports and dashboards.
You will build and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics, and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality.
You will acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems.
You will identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets.
You will filter and “clean” data by reviewing computer reports, printouts, and performance indicators to locate and correct code problems.
You will locate and define new process improvement opportunities.
Who You'll Work With
On this team, we interface between technical teams and the business partners. We work with management to prioritize their business and information needs. Do you thrive while mentoring others and want to become a resource within the team for less experienced colleagues? Then this is an opportunity to use your skills.
Who You Are
You have the ability to handle and lead multiple projects, along with conducting full lifecycle analysis to include requirements, activities, and design. You will be a master at visualizing data for insights for the business. In addition, you possess good communication skills (written and verbal). You are customer-focused, strive for professionalism at all times, and possess a high intellectual curiosity with an ability to learn new concepts/frameworks and technology quickly as changes arise.
Requirements:
BS in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management or Statistics
3-5+ years of experience as a business data analyst or a data analyst
Deep understanding of data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques
High level of visualization experience using Tableau or similar products
Strong design, documentation, and analytical skills
Adept at queries, report writing and presenting findings
Experience in developing and maintaining documentation for policies, procedures, and standard methodologies
Why Cisco
At Cisco, each person brings their unique talents to work as a team and make a difference.
Yes, our technology changes the way the world works, lives, plays and learns, but our edge comes from our people.
We connect everything – people, process, data and things – and we use those connections to change our world for the better.
We innovate everywhere - From launching a new era of networking that adapts, learns and protects, to building Cisco Services that accelerate businesses and business results. Our technology powers entertainment, retail, healthcare, education and more – from Smart Cities to your everyday devices.
We benefit everyone - We do all of this while striving for a culture that empowers every person to be the difference, at work and in our communities.
Colorful hair? Don’t care. Tattoos? Show off your ink. Like polka dots? That’s cool. Pop culture geek? Many of us are. Be you, with us! #WeAreCisco

title: Data Analyst
description:
Los Angeles based, Internet Brands is currently seeking an Analyst for it's Legal Vertical (businesses including Lawyers.com, Nolo.com, and Avvo.com) to help grow organic traffic.

As an Analyst at Internet Brands, you will work with a team of SEO leaders across the vertical to drive traffic growth through research and monitoring. As SEO continues to evolve, there will be continuous learning opportunities as you contribute to the Legal vertical's traffic growth.

We are looking for someone who will provide quantitative observations and ideas to help create A/B tests, monitor changes, interpret the outcome of tests, use data to find new growth paths, build reporting systems for internal stakeholders, leverage 3rd party SEO tools to collect data about site performance, etc.

Responsibilities:
Adept at researching, testing, and analyzing.
Review existing analytics to make informed data-driven recommendations for SEO improvements.
Collaborate with internal teams to recommend and implement SEO improvements to a wide variety of sites.
Keep current with trends and advancements in technology, SEO, UI/UX, Google algorithm updates, etc.
Ability to manage several projects simultaneously in a fast-paced environment.
Help prioritize projects for maximum impact in as short a time as possible.
Assist SEO team with site audits through crawling tools and personal direct assessment to maintain best practices as well as diagnosis potential issues.

The ideal candidate will be:
A strong analytical mind, with demonstrated experience with SEO.
A great communicator, boiling complex concepts down into clear, actionable instructions.
A true collaborator, working with multiple stakeholders across teams to educate, influence, and execute.
Willingness to dive in and research a problem from multiple points-of-view, provide supported conclusions, and lay out a clear go forward game plan.

Success starts with having the right people. At Internet Brands, we value and mentor each member of our growing team. We seek out talented, goal-oriented professionals who live and breathe the Internet and thrive in a flexible but challenging work environment. Our team of innovators has enabled Internet Brands to sustain high levels of profitability and success while evolving along with the Internet for over 20 years.

At IB, we promote an entrepreneurial, friendly culture that applauds innovation and results while embracing change and independence. Our employees are intensely driven and constantly encouraged to reach higher and use creativity to achieve success – all the while enjoying high levels of collaboration and the luxury of coming to work in jeans and sneakers. We are proud to offer a unique blend of the innovation of a start-up with the history, stability, and benefits of an established corporation.

Internet Brands and its wholly owned affiliates are an equal opportunity employer.

title: Threat Intelligence Analyst
description:
Job Description – Threat Intelligence Analyst – R0029146

eBay is seeking an Information Security Threat Intelligence Analyst to join our highly visible Threat Management & Response Organization (TMR) to design and develop our threat intelligence program in support eBay’s eCommerce and Payments platforms. This position will perform intelligence collection/curation activities, and provide analysis using the Intelligence OODA Loop framework to identify emergent cyber threats to eBay.
Working within eBay’s TMR organization you will have the opportunity to build innovative solutions to identify and mitigate information-security threats. You will work collaboratively to creatively solve complex security problems in a heterogeneous environment. With your contributions, we’re building the best security operations center in the industry. Your skills, vision, tenacity, and passion will help us defend and respond daily to keep eBay’s critical information assets away from threats and hackers.
Candidates must have extensive experience working with various security methodologies and processes, advanced knowledge of TCP/IP protocols, extensive experience providing analysis and trending of security threats from various threat intelligence sources.

Core Job Functions Include:
Identify and assess internal and external cybersecurity risks that threaten the security or integrity of eBay’s eCommerce and payments platforms including all non-public information stored on systems.
Establish policies commensurate with eBay’s risk and complexity that addresses the concepts of threat information sharing through appropriate ISACs and other intelligence sharing bodies.
Modify control structures to use threat intelligence and build collaboration processes to identify and respond to information on threats and vulnerabilities.
Develop and formalize effective threat identification and assessment processes (Threat Knowledge), including maintaining procedures for obtaining, monitoring, assessing, classifying severity, and responding to evolving threats and vulnerabilities. Use this Threat Knowledge to drive risk assessments and response.
Develop, maintain, and update a repository of cybersecurity threat and vulnerability information that may be used in conducting risk assessments and provide updates to senior management, eBay board of directors, and eCI board of directors on cyber risk trends.
Conduct research and evaluate intelligence data - with specific emphasis on tactics, techniques, and procedures - focusing on threats facing eBay’s eCommerce and payments processing systems.
Correlate threat data from various sources and analyze network events to establish the identity and modus operandi of malicious users active in or posing potential threats to eBay.
Report security performance against established security metrics and compare to other similar businesses in the eCommerce and payments space.
Work closely within various Global Information Security teams and eBay’s Legal, and Risk teams to develop a fuller understanding of the intent, objectives, and activity of cyber threat actors.
Conduct complex cyber intelligence analysis, coordination, and interaction across a broad range of eBay, it’s adjacencies, and third-party ISAC partners.
Understand the trade-offs required to communicate the different levels of risk tolerance and risk exposures across the organization and balance this with risk investments
Coordinate with technology and business groups to assess, implement, and monitor business-related security risks/hazards.
Prepare assessments and cyber threat profiles of current events based on the sophisticated collection, research, and analysis of classified and open source information
Produces high-quality papers, presentations, recommendations, and findings for Senior Level Management and Enterprise Technology Leaders
Provides briefings and presentations to leadership supporting Information Security and Network Operations decision making
Provide situational awareness to executives and stakeholders of emerging threats and breaches in a timely fashion with appropriate guidance on impact to eBay, Inc.

To be successful in this position, you should be proficient with:
Communication – ability to articulate complex cyber threats to non-technical business partners. Proven competency in business writing and speaking for technical and executive audiences.
Teach – ability to train security concepts to other teams
Offensive Techniques – Penetration testing, IOCs, and exploits at all layers of the stack.
Logs Analysis - Comfortable with SEIM searching to gather and analyze logs to recreate incidents and hunt for threats.
System Forensics – Basic understanding of image acquisition techniques, memory forensics, and analysis
Networking Fundamentals - TCP/IP Protocols (HTTP, DNS, FTP, DHCP, ARP, etc.), and Wireshark/TCPDump.
Scripting – Should be familiar in scripting in at least one of the following: python, perl or a similar language.
Risk Analysis – Prior work experience analyzing threat and vulnerability data; classifying threats/vulnerabilities to determine severity and prioritize against existing system states, determining threats causing critical risk to business.

Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in Information Assurance, Information Security, Cyber Intelligence, or related field.
5+ years of experience in Cyber Threat Intelligence

Must have at least one (1) of the following certifications:
SANS GIAC: GCTI, ISC2: CISSP, NICCS: CCIP, EC Council: C|TIA

In addition, minimum of one (1) year of specialized experience in one or more of the following areas:
Security Assessment or Offensive Security
Application Security
Security Operations Center/Security Incident Response
Cyber intelligence Analysis

At eBay, your work makes a difference. We believe that we can build a better form of commerce that is enabled by people, supported by technology, and open to everyone – creating more opportunity for all.





This website uses cookies to enhance your experience. By continuing to browse the site, you agree to our use of cookies

View our privacy policy

View our accessibility info

eBay Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, and disability, or other legally protected status. If you are unable to submit an application because of incompatible assistive technology or a disability, please contact us at talent@ebay.com. We will make every effort to respond to your request for disability assistance as soon as possible.

title: Developer Analyst I, Junior -- Entry Level
description:
$20 - $24 an hour
USCB America is a 100% Employee Owned and Operated Receivable & Resource Management Company and we pride ourselves with being a leader and innovator in our industry.
We currently have a great opportunity for a student or graduate looking for an entry level position or flexible work schedule which allows them to attend school and work full time. We are always seeking the best people to join our winning team and we are currently in need of an Developer Analyst I to join our Information Systems team in our Downtown (Bunker Hill) Los Angeles Corporate Headquarters.

Company Subsidized Medical, Dental, and Vision Coverage

SUMMARY:
Developer will assist in the creation, and maintenance, of features within a Healthcare centric Business System. Developer is expected to independently accomplish organization goals by supporting phases of the Software Development Life Cycle under limited supervision.
RESPONSIBILITIES:
Participates in business process assessments
Participates in analysis and conversion of requirements into features
Participates in feature design and scoping
Documents features, configuration, and programming
Participates in testing to ensure feature meets the requirements that guided design
Provides, and guides, training and support to end users
Participates in release, install, and activation activities
Conducts adaptive, perfective, corrective, and preventative maintenance

title: Sales Analyst
description:
Kyriba empowers financial leaders and their teams with award-winning solutions for cash and risk management, payments and supply chain finance. Kyriba delivers a highly secure, 100 percent SaaS enterprise platform, superior bank connectivity and a seamlessly integrated solution-set for tackling today’s most complex financial challenges. Thousands of companies, including many of the world’s largest organizations, rely on Kyriba to streamline key processes, protect against loss from fraud and cybercrime, and accelerate growth opportunities through improved decision support. Technology analyst-firm IDC recognized Kyriba as a global leader in its MarketScape for SaaS and cloud-enabled treasury and risk management applications for 2017-2018. Kyriba is headquartered in New York, with offices in San Diego, Paris, London, Tokyo, Dubai and other major locations. For more information, visit www.kyriba.com.
Kyriba is hiring a talented Sales Analyst that will collaborate with sales leadership ensuring data quality/management expectations are met, and KPI’s/reports/analytics are well understood. This role will be key in communicating actionable insights that help drive optimal business outcomes.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
Deliver analysis and recommendations for various sales programs and initiatives; creation and management of executive level reporting.
Design and consult in the development of highly effective dashboards and reports that provide meaningful business and operations insights using leading edge front end applications.
Help program leads deliver useful analysis that leads to understanding of performance drivers and decision points.
Contribute to selection of KPIs that function properly and meet requirements of executives.
Collaborate with business and stakeholders to gather requirements for new reporting and enhancements to existing reports.
Identify opportunities to use analyses to answer core business questions and to support improved action-oriented decision-making.
Ensure program plans have appropriate metrics in place to show performance against goals and efficacy.
Input to the annual planning process with analysis of past performance and ad hoc analysis.
Ensure data quality and management requirements are met.
Partner with IT and technical teams in building/maintaining analytics.
Education and Experience:
Bachelors’ degree in Business or related area of study.
5+ years of related experience, previous experience in a Sales Analytics role(s) is a plus.
Analytical thinker and problem solver.
Ability to communicate complex information into a clear and concise message that the respective audience can understand.
Technical Skills: Advanced Excel, proficient in Power Point, SQL, SFDC.
Detail oriented, while keeping it tied into the bigger picture.
Quick learner who enjoys working/learning more about data, technology and analytics.
Ability to prioritize and manage time effectively, thrive in a dynamic, fast paced work environment and manage multiple projects simultaneously.
Ability to anticipate project risks and identify solutions to proactively resolve those.
Kyriba Culture and Values: At Kyriba, we value a strong work culture and sense of community and ownership among our global team. We live by our “iCare” value system to demonstrate our care and commitment to our clients and to each other. In hiring, we look for candidates that are a strong fit with our culture and values, as well as bring the talent and experience required by the position.
Innovation: We foster innovation and entrepreneurial thinking across our team by rewarding employees for their achievements and encouraging efficiency and continual process improvement.
Client Success: Our passion is to enable our clients’ success. We do this by understanding their needs, and developing and managing solutions that provide them the insight to effectively drive decision making within their organizations.
Accountability: We each take personal responsibility for our actions. We are committed to our own continuous improvement and we go the extra mile to meet our clients' needs.
Respect: We respect each other’s ideas, efforts and commitments, and embrace our diverse cultures and points of view. We achieve our goals through teamwork, responsiveness, open communication and a positive attitude.
Excellence: We strive for excellence in all that we do and bring the passion and commitment to deliver on our promises. We achieve excellence through leadership, teamwork, transparency and integrity, and we are committed to recognizing employee achievements.
To learn more about Kyriba:
Check out our Career page: http://www.kyriba.com/company/careers
Like Kyriba on Facebook at facebook.com/kyribacorp
Follow Kyriba on LinkedIn at linkedin.com/company/kyribacorporation
Follow Kyriba on Twitter at twitter.com/kyribacorp
Read Kyriba’s blog at kyriba.com/blog

United States (Required)

title: Senior Business Data Analyst- Digital
description:
Are you?

Excited to influence business decisions with data- driven insights?
Awesome with Google Analytics, AdWords, and SQL?
Looking to collaborate with stakeholders as a strategic thought partner?
If the above describes YOU, keep reading for more details about this opportunity:

Based out of La Jolla, California, National Funding, an innovator and leader in the financial technology industry, is seeking a Senior Business Data Analyst focused on our digital marketing channels. National Funding has experienced double digit growth for many years and that growth is expected to continue. Our new Senior Business Data Analyst will contribute to that growth by delivering insights and recommendations that drive business decisions in our digital marketing strategy.

How you will make an impact:
Partner with Marketing Managers, Sales, and executives as a strategic thought partner to deliver key insights from web tracking metrics
Study website behavior patterns to analyze and optimize business results and user experience
Synthesize data from multiple sources, developing assumptions where needed, to drive customer insights and strategy development
Coordinate with external partners and business stakeholders to develop actionable dashboards which present the end to end funnel metrics, contributing to the development of hypotheses and actions
Collaborate with Marketing to measure impact of website strategy across all campaign channels and to refine strategy driven by data-based insights
Work with stakeholders to develop learning plans with recommendations of analytics approaches, including A/B testing
Ensure site tagging is implemented properly to provide visibility to impact and value of various initiatives and releases
An ideal candidate looks like this:
5-8 years of experience in web analytics decision support and website optimization
Deep subject matter expertise with Google Analytics and SQL; experience with Google AdWords, Google Webmaster tools and Google Tag Manager a plus
Solid understanding of Paid Search, SEO, and other digital marketing channels such as Affiliate, Social, and Display
Strong analytical and problem solving skills
Experience with Tableau (or similar data visualization tools such as Spotfire, PowerBI, QlikView, etc.)
Proven ability to tell stories with data and instill confidence in recommendations to motivate stakeholders to take action
Outstanding communication skills with both technical and non-technical colleagues
Prefer candidates with experience with CRM systems (Salesforce)
Prefer candidates with experience in Finance, Mortgage, Banking
Why National Funding?

Positive, energetic, passionate, business casual environment
Fantastic benefits package including medical, dental, vision, life, LTD, FSA, 401(k) with an employer match and PTO
Numerous employee events throughout the year including our annual traditions such as a Day at the Del Mar Racetrack, Del Mar Mud Run, Bring Your Kid to Work Day, Holiday Party, Employee and Family Picnic, sporting events, and more
National Funding is one of the leading providers of short term loans and equipment leasing for small businesses across the United States. For five years running, we've been ranked by the San Diego Business Journal as one of the 100 Fastest Growing Private Companies in San Diego and listed on the Inc. 5000 List of America's Fastest Growing Private Companies. Since 1999, we have been in the forefront of the equipment leasing business, working with businesses in hundreds of communities and industries to expand and upgrade their business equipment. As we have grown, so too has our product line, and now we are one of the country's largest private lenders of small business loans. Our customers call on us to get working capital, merchant cash advances, credit card processing, and, of course, equipment leasing.

title: Database Marketing Analyst
description:
The Database Marketing Analyst is responsible for helping pull data from the CRM database and create reports to help in the analyzing consumer behavior, as well optimizing existing and building out new database management approaches, constantly enhancing in-house database.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities
Leverage expert SQL programming skills to run extensive customer transaction data queries across large volumes of data, multiple data extensions, and campaign history. Develop and implement weekly reporting for the enterprise on customer segment performance, trends, and key behavior drivers.
Apply analytical and programming skills to mine the relational customer database for insights.
Develop expert knowledge of current DB architecture and ETL processes and recommend ongoing process improvements.
Employ expert knowledge of SQL, Tableau, and BI applications to design, execute, and ensure quality of weekly automated reports, dashboards and ad hoc requests for the marketing team and other stakeholders.
Demonstrate strong business and analytical acumen when reviewing data for inconsistencies or anomalies that could skew analytical results.
Leverage strong interpersonal skills with Marketing and other stakeholders in gathering information to determine specification requirements for data requests, reports, and ongoing utility.
Perform routine database audits that includes review of business rules, data validation and augmentation, merging and purging duplicate records, etc.
Work continuously with third party database vendors to enhance/optimize the data model to accelerate information, reporting, and insights while ensuring accuracy.
Use and support database applications and analytical tools such as Microsoft SQL, Tableau, Microstrategy, Cognos and SSRS

title: Data Analyst and Modeling Engineer
description:
The Modeling Team is strategically positioned within Technology R&D to provide essential input to all phases of the powertrain engineering process. Using custom-built modeling tools, the Modeling Team performs high-level feasibility analyses for future products, defines vehicle- and component-level specifications, and coordinates interdependent iterative design processes for various powertrain components.

Additionally, by leveraging internal and external data sources the team provides quantitative analysis to continuously improve Tesla’s products, inform future product roadmaps, and develop core algorithms that tie Tesla’s products into a seamless customer experience.

The Modeling Team is looking for determined, eager individuals with strong breadth and depth of technical knowledge. The Data Analyst and Modeling Engineer will be responsible for tying the Modeling Team to Tesla’s data pipelines, creating web-based visualizations and analyses, and building tools and infrastructure to support the teams many data needs.

Responsibilities:
Perform analysis and visualization of fleet data as it relates to the Modeling Team’s responsibilities
Build infrastructure and tools to automate fleet data analysis and visualizations
Develop infrastructure to support the Modeling Team’s data needs
Collaborate closely with Tesla’s Fleet Analytics big data infrastructure team to ensure relevant data is tracked and processed
Technical communication and dissemination of analysis results

Minimum Requirements:
B.S. (or M.S.) in Computer Science, Physics, Mathematics, Statistics, or other quantitative field
High proficiency in MATLAB and Python’s data stack (additional experience with Hadoop, Hbase, Spark strongly desired)
Experience building and hosting web-based data visualizations
Strong physics-based understanding of mechanical, electrical, and thermal systems, and lumped parameter modeling
Ability to manage projects on a timeline and concisely communicate results

Apply
Tesla participates in the E-Verify Program

title: Threat Intelligence Analyst
description:
Job Description – Threat Intelligence Analyst – R0029146

eBay is seeking an Information Security Threat Intelligence Analyst to join our highly visible Threat Management & Response Organization (TMR) to design and develop our threat intelligence program in support eBay’s eCommerce and Payments platforms. This position will perform intelligence collection/curation activities, and provide analysis using the Intelligence OODA Loop framework to identify emergent cyber threats to eBay.
Working within eBay’s TMR organization you will have the opportunity to build innovative solutions to identify and mitigate information-security threats. You will work collaboratively to creatively solve complex security problems in a heterogeneous environment. With your contributions, we’re building the best security operations center in the industry. Your skills, vision, tenacity, and passion will help us defend and respond daily to keep eBay’s critical information assets away from threats and hackers.
Candidates must have extensive experience working with various security methodologies and processes, advanced knowledge of TCP/IP protocols, extensive experience providing analysis and trending of security threats from various threat intelligence sources.

Core Job Functions Include:
Identify and assess internal and external cybersecurity risks that threaten the security or integrity of eBay’s eCommerce and payments platforms including all non-public information stored on systems.
Establish policies commensurate with eBay’s risk and complexity that addresses the concepts of threat information sharing through appropriate ISACs and other intelligence sharing bodies.
Modify control structures to use threat intelligence and build collaboration processes to identify and respond to information on threats and vulnerabilities.
Develop and formalize effective threat identification and assessment processes (Threat Knowledge), including maintaining procedures for obtaining, monitoring, assessing, classifying severity, and responding to evolving threats and vulnerabilities. Use this Threat Knowledge to drive risk assessments and response.
Develop, maintain, and update a repository of cybersecurity threat and vulnerability information that may be used in conducting risk assessments and provide updates to senior management, eBay board of directors, and eCI board of directors on cyber risk trends.
Conduct research and evaluate intelligence data - with specific emphasis on tactics, techniques, and procedures - focusing on threats facing eBay’s eCommerce and payments processing systems.
Correlate threat data from various sources and analyze network events to establish the identity and modus operandi of malicious users active in or posing potential threats to eBay.
Report security performance against established security metrics and compare to other similar businesses in the eCommerce and payments space.
Work closely within various Global Information Security teams and eBay’s Legal, and Risk teams to develop a fuller understanding of the intent, objectives, and activity of cyber threat actors.
Conduct complex cyber intelligence analysis, coordination, and interaction across a broad range of eBay, it’s adjacencies, and third-party ISAC partners.
Understand the trade-offs required to communicate the different levels of risk tolerance and risk exposures across the organization and balance this with risk investments
Coordinate with technology and business groups to assess, implement, and monitor business-related security risks/hazards.
Prepare assessments and cyber threat profiles of current events based on the sophisticated collection, research, and analysis of classified and open source information
Produces high-quality papers, presentations, recommendations, and findings for Senior Level Management and Enterprise Technology Leaders
Provides briefings and presentations to leadership supporting Information Security and Network Operations decision making
Provide situational awareness to executives and stakeholders of emerging threats and breaches in a timely fashion with appropriate guidance on impact to eBay, Inc.

To be successful in this position, you should be proficient with:
Communication – ability to articulate complex cyber threats to non-technical business partners. Proven competency in business writing and speaking for technical and executive audiences.
Teach – ability to train security concepts to other teams
Offensive Techniques – Penetration testing, IOCs, and exploits at all layers of the stack.
Logs Analysis - Comfortable with SEIM searching to gather and analyze logs to recreate incidents and hunt for threats.
System Forensics – Basic understanding of image acquisition techniques, memory forensics, and analysis
Networking Fundamentals - TCP/IP Protocols (HTTP, DNS, FTP, DHCP, ARP, etc.), and Wireshark/TCPDump.
Scripting – Should be familiar in scripting in at least one of the following: python, perl or a similar language.
Risk Analysis – Prior work experience analyzing threat and vulnerability data; classifying threats/vulnerabilities to determine severity and prioritize against existing system states, determining threats causing critical risk to business.

Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in Information Assurance, Information Security, Cyber Intelligence, or related field.
5+ years of experience in Cyber Threat Intelligence

Must have at least one (1) of the following certifications:
SANS GIAC: GCTI, ISC2: CISSP, NICCS: CCIP, EC Council: C|TIA

In addition, minimum of one (1) year of specialized experience in one or more of the following areas:
Security Assessment or Offensive Security
Application Security
Security Operations Center/Security Incident Response
Cyber intelligence Analysis

At eBay, your work makes a difference. We believe that we can build a better form of commerce that is enabled by people, supported by technology, and open to everyone – creating more opportunity for all.





This website uses cookies to enhance your experience. By continuing to browse the site, you agree to our use of cookies

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, and disability, or other legally protected status. If you are unable to submit an application because of incompatible assistive technology or a disability, please contact us at talent@ebay.com. title: Digital Marketing Analyst
description:
National Pen is looking for an enthusiastic and passionate Digital Marketing Analyst to accelerate the growth of our ecommerce business utilizing Google Analytics (GA 360). In this role, you’ll work closely with the Channel Managers to provide valuable insight into how we measure, analyze, and attribute our digital marketing efforts. You will be expected to cull actionable insights from the data and work with the business leaders to implement and monitor your suggestions. This is a direct hire position with Benefits, PTO, 401K plus much more!
Responsibilities
Create dashboards and ad hoc reports supporting your analysis using Google Data Studio
Monitor trends to identify funnel drop-off points using Custom GA Reports and Google Sheets
Work with Channel Managers to identify tracking opportunities on the website
Facilitate any changes to analytics tagging by working with front-end engineering team to test and deploy new tags
Track Assisted Conversions for Paid Media campaigns

Analyze Brand and Non Brand keyword performance for SEO
Ensure data integrity for the Web Analytics dataset

title: Mobile Game Data Analyst
description:
Redemption Games is the first American game studio to receive funding from Supercell, the world's best mobile gaming studio. We believe strongly in one of their key principles, which is “the best teams make the best games.”
We are based in Carlsbad (north of San Diego) and operate in a relaxed, friendly environment. We try to focus all our energy on the creation of amazing games that can win at the top of the grossing charts.
We now have an opportunity for a Data Analyst to join our team. This Data Analyst would be responsible for working with the team to measure our data, and most importantly, digging into the data to discover actionable insights that can meaningfully move our KPI's in the right direction.
You’ll be responsible for compiling raw game data into usable data stores and reports for both game developers and stakeholders within the company, as well as generating novel insights on game performance, user acquisition, and user experience.
Responsibilities:
Use data to identify the weakest areas of game performance and user experience, and work with the team to create data-driven solutions.
Prepare data visualizations, reports, and high-level summaries for the game team based on both raw data and aggregate results.
Perform data verification and validation to ensure that instrumentation, aggregation, reporting, and analyses are accurate and complete. Devise and implement solutions when gaps or errors are found.
Qualifications:
2-3+ years of experience working in analytics, leveraging data to build business & product solutions
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in Math, Statistics, Computer Science, Business, Economics or other quantitative field preferred.
Strong knowledge and proven abilities with SQL.
Experience building reports with Tableau or any other similar tools.
Strong communication skills. Able to explain technical concepts to a non-technical audience; as well as non-technical concepts to a technical audience
Experience with cloud-based computing (especially Amazon Web Services), procedural programming (especially PHP or Python), EMR frameworks such as Spark or Hadoop, and data science and machine learning methods such as k-means clustering, random forest, decision trees, etc. are all a plus.
Passion for gaming and the gaming industry is a must!
This is an onsite, full-time position with Redemption Games. Our studio is located in Carlsbad, CA. We have a casual, friendly, work environment, comprehensive benefits package including meaningful stock option compensation, a competitive salary, and a great opportunity for career growth and development.
Job Type: Full-time

title: Data Analyst
description:

title: Data Analyst
description:
About Public Consulting Group
Public Consulting Group, Inc. (PCG) is a leading public sector management consulting and operations improvement firm that partners with health, education, and human services agencies to improve lives. Founded in 1986 and headquartered in Boston, Massachusetts, PCG has over 2,000 professionals in more than 50 offices around the US, in Canada and in Europe. PCG’s Human Services practice helps state, county, and municipal human services agencies to achieve their performance goals in order to better serve populations in need. PCG’s Human Services’ seasoned professionals offer proven solutions to help agencies design programs, services, and systems; increase program revenue; cut costs; and improve regulatory compliance with state and federal regulations. To learn more, visit http://www.publicconsultinggroup.com/humanservices/.
Overall Responsibilities
PCG is seeking highly motivated and dependable Data Analyst with an interest in public service to be part of the training team for the San Diego CalWORKs/Refugee/Child Care and Payments Project for the South, Central, and East Regions of San Diego County.
This role will be responsible for creating and distributing reports and data throughout the organization with the final goal of ensuring that all departments meet or exceed the contractual measures. The Data Analyst will generate these reports utilizing existing reporting database. This person will be empowered to create new solutions to improve the efficiency of data gathering and the adoption of its use throughout the organization. The Data Analyst will identify trends and highlight those to leaders and staff members.

Specific Responsibilities
Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports
Partner with the database team to improve data collection, integrity and analytics
Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets
Filter and “clean” data to locate and correct problems
Work with management to prioritize business and information needs
Locate and define new process improvement opportunities
Seek feedback and direction from project leadership team
Communicate data trends in writing, meetings and reports
Fulfill other project related duties as assigned; and Maintain positive working relationships with all staff and customers.
R Required Skills
Proven working experience as a data analyst or business data analyst
Technical expertise regarding data models, data mining and segmentation techniques
Some knowledge of and experience with reporting packages, databases (SQL etc), programming (XML, Javascript, or ETL frameworks)
Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets (Excel, SPSS, SAS etc)
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
Adept at queries, report writing and presenting findings
Comfortable creating and explaining polished reports targeted at all staff levels.
Must have competent oral, written, and interpersonal communication skills.
Ability to recognize and maintain the confidentiality of all materials in the work setting.
Ability to work across all levels of management and staff.
Display a professional level of empathy for participants and respect for cultural differences.

Required Education and Experience
A Bachelor's degree in Mathematics, Computer Science, Information Management or Statistics strongly preferred
At least 1 year of experience as a data analyst
Ability to travel between offices in El Cajon, San Diego, and Chula Vista.

title: Associate Data Analyst

The Associate Data Analyst will work alongside Production, Community, and Engineering to deliver advanced analytics and will be responsible with using big data, machine learning tools, and visualization techniques to find consistent patterns and correlations that will help drive our KPIs.

title: Data Analyst
description:
Job Description

We are looking for a Data Analyst to join the team. Candidates should be naturally curious, detailed oriented, have a sharp analytical mind, are good with SQL, can write scripts and have the ability to communicate complex concepts with technical and non-technical people alike.
What you'll be doing
Work with various groups within the company to understand business needs, provide relevant data, and in-depth analysis
Write complex SQL queries to pull and process data from multiple data sources
Create dashboards to help business keep track of important metrics
Provide ad hoc and regular reports on key business metrics
Write scripts to automate repetitive tasks

Qualifications

About you
BS/MS Degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Statistics, or other highly quantitative field
1-3 years of practical experience in SQL querying large and complex data sets
Experience in Excel including pivot tables and common functions
Proficiency in Python, PHP, or other scripting languages as well as proven ability to work with large data sets
Strong communication and client-facing data presentation skills
Proven ability to learn quickly, work independently, and adapt to change in a fast-paced environment
Bonus points
Experience with MemSQL, Hadoop, and other scalable architecture
Experience in tools such as Pandas, R, etc.
Experience with BI/reporting tools such as Tableau
Previous internet/mobile industry experience

Additional Information

Regular fun team events, snacks, drinks and weekly meals in the office
